loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
“My ambition is simply to be a successful businesswoman,” says Lilia M..

Lilia is married to Jaime M.. They raised their family at Barangay Bonfal Proper Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. With their continuous support and sacrifices, most of their children have finished their studies in college and some have already gotten married. 
Farming is their main source of income. They plant a variety of vegetables twice a year. Lilia also sells their vegetables in the local market so they can get the retail price for as much of the crop as possible. She is borrowing an amount of PHP 12,000 as additional working capital. She believes that someday she will be successful by relying on her continued patience and sacrifices.

loans.use: Business Capital for faming business.

loans.name: Giovanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92751&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Giovanna  estudio secretariado pero no termino se caso y tuvo hijos, le  gusta la cocina y  vende menú de lunes a viernes en su casa y desde los 18 años los sábados y domingos hacen tamales y los vende en la puerta de una panadería, por las tardes teje chompas, chalinas.
Desde que Giovanna esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar a desenvolverse, le gusta el compañerismo. 
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para comprar lanas, hilos y ingredientes para hacer tamales.
El sueño de Giovanna es comprarse un carro para taxi
texts.en:
Giovanna studied to become a secretary but did not finish. She is married and has children. She likes to cook and sell meals from Monday to Friday at her house and for the last 18 years, on Saturday and Sunday, she makes tamales and sells them outside of a bakery. In the afternoon, she knits sweaters and scarves. Since Giovanna has been with FINCA Peru she has learned to save and to manage herself, and she likes the companionship. Giovanna needs a loan of 2,200 Sols in order to buy wool and thread, and ingredients to make tamales. Her dream is to buy herself a car to use as a taxi. Click here to see her first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, thread, and ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 41 and the mother of 4 children who are in school. She lives in Runyenjes Embu. She is an entrepreneur who runs a boutique which she opened in 2002. She sells assorted items for both men and women, including shoes, clothes and handbags. She has requested a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase more stock for her boutique.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Erlinda G. raises pigs in her backyard. She started her business with only two piglets. Now, she has a sow and she sells piglets also to her neighbors and contacts.

She needs additional capital. She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase feed. She hopes that by having a loan to support her business, she will be able to expand her business.

She actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings. CEVI is not just giving loans to people. They are also bringing education to all their clients to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Angeline,

Angeline is a widow who is 43 years old and takes care of two children with the following years old: 16, and 19. Angeline has been selling charcoal for the past five years and She earns a monthly profit of 80,000 RWF by working from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM.

Angeline is requesting her first loan of 500,000 RWF From Vision Finance Company s.a

With this requested loan, Angeline hopes to expand her business through purchasing more charcoal for sales.

Through accessing this new loan, believes to get more food for her family and paying school fees to her children.

loans.use: charcoal

loans.name: Ipogolo C Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Ipogolo borrower group in Ruaha,iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 12,8 and 3 years .

Ruth started her own  shop business selling rice,cooking oil,sugar 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 140,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ruth`s first laon from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Ruth hopes to save money and expand her business.

Maria is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for shop business

loans.name: Juana Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Juana T. se dedica a la actividad de venta de cosméticos y de ropa en un establecimiento del mercado central de la ciudad de León donde atiende a sus clientes ofreciendo los productos de cosméticos y también la ropa.

El crédito lo solicita porque tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los cosméticos y de la ropa para comercializarla y de esta manera hacer el esfuerzo por llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir las necesidades de sus dos pequeños hijos que requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Juana T. sells cosmetics and clothes in a store in the central market of the city of León where she assists her clients offering them the aforementioned products. She is applying for a loan because of the need to invest in her business and commercialise it through the purchase of cosmetics and clothes. In doing so she can make the effort to sustain her family and provide the necessities for her two young children who need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ada Yanira

texts.es: Ada Yanira V. D. M. resiD. en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ada tiene 40 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos aun menores D. edad. Ada tiene su propio negocio ubicado en el mercado D. cocinas D. Cojutepeque, el negocio D. Ada es el  conocido y preferido por muchos, tiene una clientela estable por la cual ahora solicita este crédito ya que necesita producir mayor cantidad D. comida para cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para aumentar la produccion de su comedor

loans.name: Vanesio's Group

texts.en:
B. Vanesio is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a nice person and loves what he does, in addition to wanting the best for others.

Vanesio is 30 years old and is a hardworking and determined man with a business he has had for two years selling produce in the town. Before this business, Vanesio was only a farmer but now he goes to the market himself to sell his produce. He also buys from other farmers when he has a deficit. He is good at handling his customers and this has helped him expand due to his many customers.

Vanesio needs a loan to help buy more produce for resale. He is grateful that the loans help him have a variety to sell. He hopes to have a happy and healthy family in future so that his children can be self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: El

texts.en: El A. is 29 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than three years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier or from the river, where there are many fishermen. She is married with a school-aged child. Her husband is a used-clothes trader (he appears in the picture). El A. is taking out her loan to buy a motorcycle, which she will use for transporting the fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle which she will use for transporting fish to sell at the market.

loans.name: Marialita

texts.en: Marialita G. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marialita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marialita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marialita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador A. L. de 49 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Salvador posee una panadería y una tienda  de productos perecederos, negocios en los cuales trabaja junto a su esposa. Salvador es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador el cual según sus vecinos es muy amable y de muy buenos valores. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar granos básicos y otros productos perecederos para la tienda, así también desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan. Debido a que Salvador cuenta con una familia muy extensa, él posee el deseo de poder ampliar sus negocios y así contar con la capacidad de brindarles todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Salvador A. L. is 49 years old. He lives in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapán together with his wife and four young children. All his children are in school. Salvador has a bakery and a store where he sells perishable food items. He works these businesses together with his wife. Salvador is a very happy and hard-working man. According to his neighbors, he is very nice and has very good values. He is asking for a loan so that he can buy basic grains and other perishable items for his store. He also wants to buy ingredients to make bread. Because Salvador has a large family, he hopes to be able to grow his businesses that way he can provide his wife and four children with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable items and ingredients for bread-making

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 39 year old single mother of one daughter aged 13. She supplies chicken and fish in Nairobi and describes her business environment as competitive. She employs one person and hopes to expand her business and start supplying beyond Nairobi and become an established business lady. She has requested a second loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock after successful repayment of her first Kes. 50,000 loan. She describes herself as humble and hardworking.

loans.use: Add stock of chicken and fish to her business.

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es: Rosa Gladys B. D. M. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en el Barrio D. San Jacinto, vive junto a su esposo, el cual ya es jubilado y junto a su único hijo el cual es mayor D. edad y trabaja. La señora Rosa posee una tienda llamada “El Mercadito”, el cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que La señora Rosa no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa Gladys B. D. M., 52, lives in the San Jacinto neighborhood with her retired husband and only son. Her son is grown and works. Rosa has a store called “El Mercadito”, which is located in her home. She is asking for a loan to stock her business. Rosa does not have the money to do so. It is much needed for herself as well as for her husband. The business allows them to pay all of the family expenses. She wants to stock her store with products like detergent, canned food, bread, sweets, drinks, and other products that are basic needs items for the home. These are the products most requested in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable items for her store

location.town: Barrio de San Jacinto, departamento de San Salvado

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Our featured entrepreneur is primarily engaged in snack vending and running a sari-sari store. She is Mrs. Erlinda B., 57 years of age, married and a resident of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Her husband Remegio is a farmer and a carpenter. Under these conditions, they've felt financial hardships, especially in raising 13 children. To help her husband, she decided to engage in snack vending and operating a little sari-sari store in their house. At this time, she is earning an average net income of at least 1,500 PHP a month in which is very beneficial to the family. For her first loan, she borrowed 3,000 PHP to add to her capital for her snack vending and sari-sari store business. She is hoping that her business will become more progressive in the future and through these activities, she will be able to send all her dependent children to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La Sra. Aydee vive en una zona Peri urbana - Villa Israel de la ciudad de Cochabamba, La señora es casada  y tiene 3 hijitos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el esposo trabaja con taxi propio, pero que tiene que pagar una deuda por la compra de su taxi. La Sra. Aydee tiene como actividad economica el servicios de Internet y cabinas de punto viva, cuenta con ocho maquinas y tres cabinas, la atencion que realiza es todos los dias de la semana ya que es una zona alejada y no existen servicios en el lugar el cafe internet de la Sra. Aydee es el unico del barrio, el destino del credito es para la compra de menorias para poder actualizar sus maquinas y ofrecer un mejor servicio a su vecindario. Es una persona trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

La Sra. Aydee esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Aydee lives in Villa Israel, which is located in Cochabamba's peri-urban area. She is married and has three small, school-age children. Her husband drives his own taxi but he still owes payments on it. Aydee provides Internet services and Punto Viva phone booths; she has 8 computers and three phone booths. She provides these services every day because she is located in an area that is remote and where there are no Internet services; hers is the only one in the neighborhood. She will use the funds to buy memory chips to upgrade her computers and offer better service to the neighborhood. She is a hard-working person who is responsible with respect to her repayments. Aydee is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy memory chips to upgrade her computers.

loans.name: Abibath

texts.fr: A. Abibath est née le 17 février 1986 à Djidjè au Bénin.  Il y a 6 ans que Abibath s’est installée  à PK10 dans la commune de Sémé-Podji au Bénin.  Mariée à MITRODE Laurent, un forgeron, Abibath est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés.  Abibath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Abibath a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Abibath vend des produits divers (savons, lait, galettes, conserves de sardines et de tomate, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Abibath s’approvisionne. Abibath exerce son activité depuis environs cinq ans, mais n’a encore jamais bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse des clients, Abibath sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Abibath A. was born on the 17th of February, 1986, in Djidjè, Benin. Six years ago Abibath moved to PK10 in the Sémé-Podji borough of Benin. She is married to Laurent Mitrode, a blacksmith, and has five children, all of whom attend school; Abibath herself attended up to secondary school level. Abibath lives with her husband and children, and the couple work together to see to the family's needs. Now, she makes a living selling various products from home (soap, milk, biscuits, tinned sardines and tomatoes, pasta etc); she sources these from the international market in Benin. She has been working in this field for around five years, but has not yet sought a loan from ALIDé. However, she is now seeking her first loan in order to grow the business to meet increasing consumer demand.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various products

loans.name: Mrs. Thou Pol Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuo P. is 53 years old and she is a village bank president of nineteen people who all live in Kou Doul village in TaK. province. The members of this loan will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Thuo P. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming, she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Run, is a motorbike taxi driver from which he is able to earn a small income to support his family.

Since her pig-raising business is going well, Mrs. Thuo P. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed.

This couple has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory, another is a farmer supporting his parents’ business, while the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: 03.02.02 Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nguyen T. T. (03.02.056) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nguyen T. T. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.02.02 Hoang Hoa -Thanh Hoa (03.02.02 Hoang Hoa).


Nguyen T. T. is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Nguyen T. T. operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale.  Nguyen T. T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1.700.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Nguyen T. T. joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nguyen T. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nguyen T. T. from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nguyen T. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Dang T. N. (03.02.018) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Cao T. H. (03.02.021) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Le T. L. (03.02.028) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nguyen T. T.(03.02.056) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nguyen T. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.02.02 Hoang Hoa -Thanh Hoa (03.02.02 Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Nguyen T. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyen T. T. kiếm được khoảng 1.700.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Nguyen T. T. đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nguyen T. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Dang T. N. (03.02.018) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Cao T. H. (03.02.021) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Le T. L. (03.02.028) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
La  Señor. JAIRO ANTONIO M. G. Labora como Operario de Equipo en el M. Mayoreo de Managua.
 El  tiene tres hijo a su cargo, y estos se  encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos y perlines para el techo de su casa ya que viene la temporada de lluvia.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
La Señor. JAIRO ANTONIO M. G. Labora como Operario de Equipo en el M. Mayoreo de Managua. El tiene tres hijo a su cargo, y estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos y perlines para el techo de su casa ya que viene la temporada de lluvia. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Yesi

texts.es: Yesi tiene 22 años, es una joven emprendedora, casada con  Jhonny de 35 años y juntos tienen 2 hijos, está familia vive en su vivienda propia fabricada de material rústico a base de adobe (tierra compacta de forma cuadrada y tejas). El motor de su vida para cada actividad son sus hijos, a quienes quiere brindarles todo lo bueno que ella no tuvo, por eso con bastante dedicación siembra papa, arveja, maíz y alfalfa, es por ello que hace más de 3 años se dedica a esta actividad en compañía de su esposo. Asimismo en sus ratos libres esta pareja trabaja como operarios, ganando al día S/. 20.00 soles. Yesi ama la tranquilidad del campo y  confiesa que le gusta cocinar al aire libre, por otro lado le incomoda los precios en rebaja de sus productos, pese a eso no se amilana y busca el mejor comprador mayorista para no perder. Con las ganancias de esta cosecha, ha pensado instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en un espacio dentro de su domicilio, pues el lugar donde se encuentra viven no hay bodegas cercanas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y asegura que con esfuerzo y dedicación podrá salir adelante, por eso le agrada trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes e insecticidas para proteger de las plagas sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Yesi is 22 years old and is an enterprising young woman. She is married to Jhonny who is 35 years old and they have 2 children. This family lives in their own home made from basic material using adobe (square compact earth and tiles). The driving force of her life for each enterprise are her children. She wants to provide them with all the good things that she did not have, therefore with a lot of dedication she grows potatoes, peas, corn and alfalfa, It is for this reason that for more than 3 years she has worked in this business with her husband. Also in their spare time this couple work as laborers, earning PEN 20.00 per day. Yesi loves the tranquility of the countryside and confesses that she likes to cook outdoors, on the other hand the falling prices of their produtcs worry her. In spite of this she is not daunted and looks for the best wholesale purchaser so that she does not lose out. With the profits from her crop, she is thinking of opening a shop selling foodstuffs in a space within their home, as the area where they live does not have grocery stores nearby. This is their third loan with MFP and they are sure that with effort and dedication they will be able to get ahead, therefore they are pleased to work with their communal group. With the loan they are requesting, they will buy several bags of fertilizers and insecticides to protect their potato crops from pests.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Samross

texts.en: Mrs. Samross L. is 30 years old and a villager from Trapeang Leuk village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nos Pich (pictured with her), are farmers who own one hectare of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. To support her farm, Mrs. Samross L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mrs. Samross L. makes fishing nets for sale while her husband works as a laborer. The couple has two children, who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and pay a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Nelly Verónica

texts.es:
Nelly Verónica A. tiene 24 años, y vive con sus padres y su hija de 5 meses, Alexandra, en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. 
 
Nelly es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de maíz, papas y legumbres.

Nelly estudia y trabaja en la agricultura cuando no esta estudiando. Hace las compras y ventas de sus productos en San Pablo cada semana. 

Nelly solicita el crédito para los estudios y para comprar un becerro. Su meta es tener su profesión para poder trabajar. El desafío que enfrenta es económicamente para poder viajar a la universidad.
 
Le gusta practicar el basket y las costumbres como fiestas de San Pedro y San Pablo (pueblos cercanos de San Miguel).
texts.en:
Nelly Verónica A., age 24, lives with her parents and her five month old daughter, Alexandra. They live in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. Nelly is a member of the Santiagopamba Communal Bank, which is located in San Pablo. It is a half hour from the town of San Miguel. The communal bank is comprised of people who mostly work in agriculture. They plant corn, potatoes, and vegetables. Nelly goes to school, and she works when she is not studying. She makes her purchases and sells her products every week in San Pablo. Nelly is requesting a loan for her studies and to buy a calf. Her goal is to have a profession so that she can work. The challenge she faces in order to be able to travel to the university is economical. She likes to practice basketball, and she likes the traditions like the San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations (towns close to San Miguel).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education and to buy a calf

loans.name: Tainratha Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesspeople in Magburka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 4,200,000 for the entire group in order to enable them to expand their businesses. With  this loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. 

Memuna K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. She was born in a small town called Lunsar, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately thirty-nine years of age, married, and has six children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – four in secondary school and two in primary school. 

Memuna sells fresh fish. She has been in the fish business for many years now. With her share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000), she will travel to Freetown and buy cartons of fresh fish and sell them retail in Magburaka's town market. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: Buy cartons of fresh fish to sell retail

loans.name: Macelinda

texts.en:
Macelinda A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 60 years old. Macelinda is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Macelinda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish in the market. Macelinda has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Macelinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Macelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Macelinda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mr. Som S. R., 27, is an electronic repairman who learned his skills in a private school. He owns a small workshop in his home where he fixes all types of electronic material. He is married to R. Lay, a 27-year-old garment laborer, and they are blessed with one young child who is enrolled in school. Som S. R. has faced difficulties traveling to buy anything for his service or to get anywhere else because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. He dreams of having a motorcycle, but he can’t make that possible due to his saving is not being able to enough to buy one. Therefore, Som S. R. decided to request a loan which will enable him to afford purchasing a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To afford purchasing a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Alegría, se conformó en fecha 14 de enero del 2.010, con mucho esfuerzo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, y  de apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Clara Jiménez  quien se dedica a venta y elaboración de artesanías, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar su producción y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
 Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró  ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido, con  el ingreso de la venta de sus productos.
 Según la Sra. Clara    mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que mediante ella pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo. 
Solicita la compra de   compra de artesanía como ponchos de lana, frazadas de lana, gorras, y otros.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women named “Alegría” (Joy) was established on January 14, 2010. With great effort, the members joined together in unity to become part of the program. In addition to their independent businesses, the members also develop activities in which they raise funds so that they will have group capital with which they can financially support their families.

A very moving story involves Sra. Clara Jiménez, who sells and produces handicrafts. She says that with this loan she will be able to improve production, her standard of living, and her income. Through her business, Clara claims that her family finances have improved. Her husband also generates an income to supplement the earnings from the sale of her products. She says that that the activities with Fundación Paraguaya have been very important because they have helped her develop in her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts such as ponchos, blankets, caps, and other items made of wool.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts such as ponchos, blankets, caps, and other items made of wool

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene cinco hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Desde muy joven, Sixto se percató que el producto de cacao, tenía mucha demanda en el mercado, por ello decidió trabajar en la chacra de sus padres, desde luego que le gustaba vivir en el campo, ya que respira armonía y paz, durante un buen tiempo estuvo aplicado removiendo la tierra, sembrando y cosechando el producto de cacao que producían sus padres. Hoy produce y comercializa cacao a los grandes mayoristas, desde luego que hace un reconocimiento a sus padres, por las buenas lecciones que le brindaron, fruto de esa enseñanza tuvo buenos resultados económicos, ya que él aplica técnicas en el cuidado de sus plantaciones, por el cual sus clientes recurrentes están mas que satisfecho con el producto de cacao que ofrece. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su querida esposa y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita  de peones con la finalidad de que puedan extraer el fruto de forma eficiente y oportuna. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y los vende a un precio incomparable, para ello trabaja de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. En el futuro Sixto anhela construir su casa a base de material noble con la necesidad de que los pueda brindarle estabilidad y seguridad a su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando, tal como lo hizo en anteriores préstamos, además satisfecho con la institución, ya que lo brinda demasiado facilidades. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en el mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, para que de esa manera no disminuya su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Sixto is 44 years old, married, and has five children. They live together in the town of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house made of wood. Since he was very young, Sixto realized that there was a great deal of market demand for cocoa. For this reason, he decided to work on his parents' ranch. Of course he enjoyed living in the countryside, where you can breath harmony and peace. For a while, he applied himself to tending the land, planting and harvesting the cocoa produced by his parents. Today he produces and sells cocoa to the large wholesalers, as his parents have recognized the good lessons he has offered them. He uses techniques in care of his fields, so that his repeat customers are very satisfied with the cocoa product he offers. In general, he works with his beloved wife and together they make a good working team. However, during harvest season, he needs laborers in order to harvest the fruit in an efficient and timely manner. He makes his sales in the gathering centers of his town, and he sells at an unmatched price. To do so, he works from 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. In the future, Sixto longs to build his house from more solid materials, so that he can offer stability and security to his family. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he promises to continue to make repayments, as he has with his previous loans. He is also satisfied with the organization, which offers him good opportunities. He plans to use the loan he is requesting to invest in the adequate maintenance of his cocoa fields, so that his agricultural production will not decrease.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his farmland, in order to achieve better cocoa production

loans.name: Kenneth Aroka

texts.en:
Kenneth is single and has no children yet.

Kenneth is requesting his second loan in KADET LTD and has no other loans with other MFIs. He serves in a middle class estate and it is well populated. 

Kenneth will use the extra profits to open a new laboratory, Kenneth hopes to have many laboratory branches.

Kenneth describes himself as hard working and social.

loans.use: purchasing a blood test machine

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M., from the village of Siapaloc, Sibutad, is 50 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Estrella owns a business providing motorcycle transport. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, Estrella is now requesting her sixth loan of 4,000 PHP to invest in hog raising.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in hog raising

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo C. is from the village of Mandulog, Iligan City. He is 53 years old, is separated from his spouse and has 1 adult child. Cerilo owns & operates a transportation business, providing motorcycle or habal-habal (a motor-cycle with an extended seat for 2-6 passengers) services. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cerilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to maintain his motorcycle. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase maintenance materials needed to expand his services. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cerilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance materials needed to expand his service

location.town: Mandulog, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel C. is 30 years old, and lives in Coastal Place of Talim Island, Rizal, Philippines with her supportive husband, Margarito, a fisherman, and their two children. The couple works hard for a better life and to give a better education to their children. They decided to join ASHI in 2007 to acquire capital for their fishing and fish-trading business. 

The couple has asked for a new loan of Php 25,000.00 as working capital for their fishing business. Maribel hopes to build their own beautiful house, expand her fishing business, and have more space for their fishing equipment. The family feels very happy with the loan that has improved their lives,  and wishes all lenders the best of luck and hopes they will continue to support poor families like them.

loans.use: working capital for their fishing business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling sala sets, table covers, and placemats to local community members. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase yarns, cloths and threads to be used in the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase yarns, cloths and threads to be used in the business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Victor Manuel G. M., tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el Barrio Santa Rosa, es casado y su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, que actualmente se dedican a los esrtudios, el labora con Guarda de Seguridad, la familia batalla con una enfermedad cornica de uno de sus hijos, es por el pequeño que solicitan un prestamo para la remodelacion del porche de su hogar, debido a que el pequeño es aca donde tiene sus tiempos de exparcimiento, ellos esperan les apoyen economicamente para darles a sus dos hijos mejores condiciones socio economicas para su diario vivir.
texts.en: Victor Manuel G. M. is 44 years old and lives in Santa Rosa neighborhood.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They have 2 dependent children who are studying.  Victor Manuel works as a security guard.  His family is battling a chronic disease which one of his children is suffering from.  The loan is for the little one.  They would like to redesign their house porch because this is where their little one spends their relaxation time.  They hope to receive receive financial support so that they can provide their two children with better socio-economic conditions in their daily lives.

loans.use: To redesign his house porch

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 70 años de edad, es viudo y reside en el Caserío Sime, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe. La localidad se encuentra ubicada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la ganadería y crianza y comercialización de animales. El cría vacas, ovejas y aves de corral en su domicilio. Las suele alimentar de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona y al público en general. El negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para subsistir y llevar una vida tranquila.

Alejandro desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 70 years old, he is a widow and he lives in the community of Sime, an agricultural region located in the district of Pitipo of the Ferrenafe province. The region is located more than forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

His business is agriculture, cattle farming and the sale of livestock. He raises cows, sheep, and foul from his home. He strives to feed those grains and natural grasses. When the livestock have reached a certain stage in development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region and to the general public. The business provides him with the income necessary to live and to lead a quiet life. 

Alejandro wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more livestock and feed. He will increase his sales and see better earnings. To this end he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 soles. With this loan he hopes to reach his goal.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a butcher shop and salt sales. Her husband, Roberto, 50 years old, earns his living as a vendor and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between the ages of 14 and 20.

Elizabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Elizabeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use to buy more meat and poultry to sell to help her save up for her children's future education. Elizabeth T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operations of her butcher shop

loans.name: Carmen Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses son bajos. Tiene  45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos mayores y una linda chiquilla  de 17 años que  estudia  el último año de colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella es economista de profesión y trabaja en un CDI. Como maestra parvularia.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el mismo que se dedica a la compra y venta de arroz, polvillo y arrocillo, los mismos que los compra en una pilladora en Charapoto y que luego lleva a entregar  por quintales a otras ciudades y en su localidad, también se dedica al cultivo de este producto, trabaja cuatro días a la semana, estos productos los deja a crédito hasta un mes de plazo y cobra de acuerdo a como lo prefieran sus clientes.  Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva en esta actividad ya por muchos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, polvillo e insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos. Sus sueños son seguir en su trabajo y que el negocio de sus esposo crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Crucita" meet in the parish of Crucita in the Portoviejo canton. This place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and that are visited by many national and international tourists. It is known as Crucita The Beautiful.
Carmen is a founding member of the community bank, and she likes it because the loans are quickly granted and the interest is low. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children from this marriage, 2 of them adults and 1 is a pretty girl of 17 years old who is in her final year at high school. Her husband is in business. She is an economist by profession and works in a CDI as a preschool teacher. 
She is requesting the loan for her husband's business - he works buying and selling rice, polvillo, and arrocillo, which he buys in Charapoto and later distributes by the bushel in other towns in the area. He also grows these crops. He works at his job four days a week. These goods are bought on credit which lasts for up to a month, and then the customers pay in the way they prefer. Carmen tells us that her husband has been doing this work for many years and he has always done well. 
This loan is to buy rice, polvillo, and agricultural inputs for the crops. Her dreams is to continue working and she hopes that her husband's business keeps growing every day.

loans.use: To buy rice and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Felicita Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Felicita, ella tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa.  Su esposo es jubilado. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, además se desempeña como la presidenta del Banco función que cumple muy bien ya que este es un Banco muy ordenado y cumplido, le agrada porque a través de los créditos a podido sacar su negocio adelante.

Es un ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de la marca Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  ella enseña su revista para que sus clientes escojan lo que necesitan luego ella envía los pedidos que luego entrega a sus clientes y que los cobra en dos  tres partes de acuerdo a como lo prefieran. Entre lo que más vende están los perfumes y cremas, lleva en este negocio ya 4 años.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son tener una boutique y llegar a ser directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
In the Quiroga Parrish of Calceta, a city where the people largely make their livings in agriculture, raising animals and selling their products, the Quiroga Communal Bank holds meetings every two weeks.

This is the place where we find Señora Felicita.  She is 56 years old, married and with her husband has three grown children.  One of their daughters lives at home with them.  Her husband is retired.  Señora Felicita is the founder of the communal bank.  In addition, she fulfills the role of President in the communal bank, a duty she carries out quite well as the bank is very organized and successful.  She is happy about the bank because through its loans she has been able to advance her business.

Señora Felicita is a homemaker who also makes a living in sales.  She sells Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works four days a week and makes her sales by going door to door.  She goes over the Yanbal catalog with her customers so that they can choose what they need.  She then sends in the orders and delivers the products to her customers.  Señora Felicita allows her customers to pay in two or three installments, in accordance with their preference.  The products she sells the most of are perfumes and lotions.  Señora Felicita has been in this business for 4 years.

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and other products.  Señora Felicita's dreams are to have a boutique and to become Yanbal Regional Director.

loans.use: To purchase Yanbal brand lotions, perfumes, cosmetics and costume jewelery.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 57 years old, married and blessed with five children.  He has been running a cafeteria for fourteen years.  He is able to provide for his family, including educating his three children, with the income he gets from his business.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya for funding him because he has managed to buy a piece of land and educate his children.  He hopes to open a hotel in the future.  Currently, he needs 50,000Kes to buy ingredients such as baking flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as baking flour, cooking fat and charcoal

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
Maria C. hace 14 años inicio su negocio  de bazar y lo mantiene hasta ahora, además imparte clases de ingles para principiantes, intermedias y avanzadas.

El trabajo lo realiza con una chica a la  cual le ayuda hasta el medio día de 8:30 hasta 7:00pm 
Unos de sus obstáculos es la delincuencia lo cual hace deficiente su trabajo ya que esta cerca del cementerio del batallón. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar cuadernos, lápices, bolígrafos. Unas de sus metas es el crecimiento de su negocio  junto a las clases de  ingles que diariamente lo realiza.
texts.en:
Maria C. set up her store 14 years ago and still has it today, in addition she teaches English classes for beginners, intermediate and advanced.

She works from 8:30 to 7:00pm and has a girl to help her until midday.
One of her obstacles is crime which makes her work difficult as it is near the batallón cemetary. 

With this loan she is going to buy exercise books, pencils, pens. One of her goals is the growth of her business together with the English classes she takes daily.

loans.use: Exercise books, stationery

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 46 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de unos familiares. Desde hace 3 años se dedica  las actividades agrícolas, y diariamente prepara sus terrenos para sembrar alfalfa y otros productos que le sirven de forraje para sus animales, ya que son indispensables para que produzca leche. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha visto el resultado de su esfuerzo y constancia, ahora posee más vacas en su establo y espera en el futuro adquirir más animales, con el fin de intensificar su actividad.  Esta convencida  que con esfuerzo logrará mejores beneficios económicos, por ello se ha propuesto tener un establo ganadero. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, todo este tiempo de experiencia le ha servido para mejorar su situación económica, además de conocer personas que ahora son sus mejores amigos, por tal motivo seguirá integrando su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de alfalfa, ya que sembrará en otras extensiones de terreno, para que sea el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en: Ana is 46 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in a house belonging to a family member. For the past 3 years she has been dedicated to agricultural activities and every day she prepares her land to plant alfalfa and other products that serve as foraging for her livestock. They are indispensable for milk production. During this work season she has seen the fruit of her efforts and sustained work. She has more dairy cows in her stable and she hopes in the future to acquire even more livestock with the hopes improving her business. She is convinced that with effort she will improve her earnings, which is why she has set up a dairy farm. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and throughout all this time it has help her improve her financial situation. Additionally she was able to meet new people, who are now her friends, reason why she will continue to be part of her communal bank. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of alfalfa seeds to plant in other plots of land and to produce feed for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Yuk

texts.en:
Yuk S., 28, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. 

S. is a massager, earning an income of $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Jose Martil

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Martil tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la colonia 27 de mayo de El Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica junto con su esposa a vender golosinas, refrescos, churros, desayunos, burritas, tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo y almuerzos, tienen un puesto de comidas en la plaza civica de el Triunfo, aqui circulan muchas personas todos los dias, esto hace que sus ventas sean buenas, su esposa se encarga de preparar los alimentos y el se encarga de la cobranza y atencion a los clientes, les sirve la comida, limpia el lugar y hace otros oficios para que los clientes pasen un momento ameno cuando estan comiendo.
Jose es padre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad, juntos con su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante la familia.
en sus tiempos libres los dos se dedican a la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
Mr. José Martil, 34, lives in the 27 de Mayo neighborhood in El Triunfo, Choluteca.  He and his wife sell snacks, beverages, sweets, breakfasts, burritos, tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese and lunches.  They have a food stall in El Triunfo’s main square.  Many people pass through here daily which means sales are good.  His wife prepares the meals and he collects payment and tends to customers.  He serves the food, cleans the place and does all the other chores required so that his customers will enjoy a pleasant time while eating.

José is father to two children who are going to the local school.  He and his wife work hard to support the family.  In their spare time both of them raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy firewood, chickens, tortillas, beef, pork, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, garlic, spices, potatoes, manioc, bananas, beans, bread, coffee, beverages, snacks, sweets, cookies, eggs, butter, wheat flour, lard, oil and gas.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to buy salt, sugar, batteries, matches and other general merchandise for sale in his mobile retail shop. He operates in markets, a business he has done for 8 years. Richard is 29 years old and lives in a two-room rented house in the Disrict of Kyenjojo together with his wife and their five-year-old child. Richard started off by selling passion fruits. He now wants to start up a wholesale shop in the future. He dreams of educating his children and becoming a prominent business man.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, batteries, matches and other general merchandise

loans.name: Luzvizminda

texts.en: Luzvizminda is 54 years old and married with five children. She has been raising pigs for 5 years, and has taken out 19 loans from NWTF to sustain her business. Luzvizminda has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and pig feed. In the future, Luzvizminda would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Basoka Kwavula Group

texts.en: Base is a businesswoman who hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 30 years who owns a boutique. She dreams of educating her five children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a restaurant she owned. Base is a member of the above-named group where each member guarantees the others in accessing credit .Base wants a loan to buy children’s wear for resale in her boutique.

loans.use: To buy children’s wear to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Violeta

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 59 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos y clientes. Ella vive en una comunidad rural  perteneciente al distrito de Chepén- La Libertad. La condición de vida de Esperanza es buena.

Desde hace 7 años Esperanza se dedica a la venta de verduras al por menor en una zona de comerciantes ambulatorios de su dsitrtito. Esperanza cuenta con clientes establecidos, que la prefieren por el buen servicio y la amabilidad que ella brinda. 

Ella desea invertir en su negocio para adquirir algunas comodidades. Es por eso que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar verduras y así surtir su negocio. Además, desea hacer algunos arreglos en su vivienda y adquirir otros bienes.

Esperanza es una clienta antigua para Edpyme Alternativa, gracias a nuestra entidad su negocio ha prosperado y es por eso que Esperanza se siente muy agradecida y contenta con nuestros financiamientos. Esperanza ha cancelado adecuadamente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 59 years old, and is a hardworking woman who has good personal and work references from her neighbors and clients. She lives in a rural community in the district of Chepén, La Libertad. Esperanza’s condition of life is good.

For 7 years, Esperanza has sold vegetables in small quantities in the busy commercial area in her district. Esperanza has established clients who appreciate her good service and kindness. 

She wants to invest in her business to acquire assets. Because of this, she requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy vegetables and, in this way, grow her business. Also, she wants to make some repairs to her house and buy other goods.

Esperanza is an old client of Edpyme Alternativa, and thanks to the institution’s support, her business has prospered. Because of this, Esperanza is very thankful and happy with the loans. Esperanza has promptly repaid her loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, grow her business, and repair her house

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 31 years old and lives with her two daughters in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her older daughter who is eight years old goes to a local secondary school while the younger one is in kindergarten. 

Altangerel manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2008 and gained much experience. In addition she began conducting a used clothing trading business since February, 2011. She is doing her best to feed her children and to pay her children's education costs. 

She is planning to expand and continue her business, because her business earnings are the only source of income for her family. She is a polite woman who says, "I am trying hard to overcome obstacles encountered in my life." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 26-year-old wife and mother of two children. Her husband Mujahid has a store selling cleaning products in Al Baqaa. It has been three years since he opened the store. Wafaa has always wanted to help and support her husband, so she applied for this loan to fill the store with a variety of cleaning products to be able to serve more customers in their area. Since Wafaa is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Mujahid appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: to add more cleaning products to his store

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en: Valentino is a thirty-year-old married man with two children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in agriculture for ten years.  He started with a small garden and now is a large-scale commercial farmer. His hardships are price fluctuations and high transport costs.  His dream is a well-maintained model farm and a poverty-free family.  Valentino intends to use this loan to buy seeds and pay labour.

loans.use: buy seeds and pay for farm labour

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Rowena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en: Bayartsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her two sons and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard at the local prison and her eldest son is a high school student. She started her business many years ago. She operates a clothes trading business. Previously, she rented a commercial space but she bought her own commercial space about two months ago. She has many years of business experience and skills. She is planning to expand her business in the long run. This is her first loan from the bank. Previously her husband received several bank loans. She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 36 años, está casado con Victoria de 34 años y tienen 04 hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en su propia morada, entre las verdes praderas de su centro poblado Santa Rosa. El trabajo al que se dedica es el de cultivar plantas oriundas de la zona selvática, como: cacao y café, frutos que tienen mayor demanda en el mercado y gracias a ello puede sostener a su familia. Tiene ya 25 años ejerciendo éste trabajo y hasta la fecha se ha convertido un hombre experto en la materia, pues le gusta lo que hace y del esfuerzo dado, ha logrado construir su casa a base de material noble. Para él la agricultura debe dedicarle el mayor tiempo posible, sin embargo necesita de la ayuda de jornaleros, quienes contrata para que se encargen de la cosecha y de trasladar los productos a los centros de acopio. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, y explica que en sus anteriores créditos fue muy puntual en la devolución del dinero, por ello espera una vez más contar con su ayuda para seguir prosperando. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 36 years old and married to Victoria, age 34. They have four children who are of school age. Feliciano and his family live in their own home among the green meadows in central Santa Rosa. His work involves cultivating plants that are native to the jungle region, such as cacao and coffee. These crops are in great demand at the market and enable him to sustain his family. Feliciano has 25 years of experience in this type of work and has become an expert in his field. He enjoys what he does and gives his full effort. Feliciano was able to build his home out of solid materials. For him, farming requires dedicating as much time as possible. However, he needs the help of workers that are hired to harvest and transport his products to the collection centers.

This will be his third loan with MFP. Feliciano explains that his previous loans were repaid very promptly. Once again, he hopes to receive assistance so that he can continue prospering. This loan of 2000 PEN will be used to buy sacks of compost so that he can fertilize his land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Romeo has a shop that buys & sells detergent, soap & beauty products. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell.
Romeo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Romeo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is a father who owns and manages a hog-raising business to generates income. He is 29-years-old, married and has three children. He aims to strengthen his source of income to support his family and educate their children. They planned to earn and save more income to support the education of their children for they want them to become professionals someday.

Due to inadequate capital, he wants to ask for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that through this loan he will improve his business and make it a viable source of income. He hopes that in the future they will become financially stable and be able to give their children a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 40 year old man. He is married with five sons and two daughters. he is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sami wants to improve his family's living conditions by purchasing new home furniture such as: bedroom and dinning room furniture,..etc , but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sami gets the loan, he will be able to purchase the necessary home furniture the family needs . Sami is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Dalila De Los Angeles

texts.es: Dalila De Los Ángeles es una mujer que no se deja vencer por los miedos que atraviesa día a día. Sus esfuerzos han logrado que ella haya podido proporcionado a sus hijos los estudios necesarios pues como toda madre se preocupaba por brindarles lo necesario. Su actividad es una pulpería, desde hace más de 22 años que tiene este negocio la experiencia que obtiene es muy gratificante pues le brinda la ayuda necesaria para su familia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, refrescos, pan, fósforos, fideos y huevos.
texts.en:
Dalila De Los Angeles is a woman who does not permit herself to be defeated by the fears she encounters day alter day. Her efforts have been successful in that she has been able to provide her children all the necessary education, just as any mother who wants to provide what is needed.

Her business is a small grocery store, which she has had more than 22 years. The experience she has had is very gratifying since the business provides the support needed by her family. The purpose of the loan is to buy dry grains, soup, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, matches, noodles and eggs.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, soup, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, matches, noodles and eggs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and has five children aged 1 to 21.  Her husband works as a farmer.  She has been selling foodstuffs for six years.  

Josephine would like a loan to buy more sorghum and beans to sell.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de amable y jovial, es conviviente de Luis. Vive en compañía de su pareja, sus cuatro hijos de 15,18, 20 y 30 años de edad, y sus tres pequeños nietos a los quiere mucho, instalados en su casa propia. El negocio que realiza Hilda es la venta de comida como tallarin, arroz chaufa, pollo frito y refresco. Para eso instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa todas la noches. Dicha actividad se inicio hace 10 años, con el apoyo de una capital de trabajo que le brindó su pareja y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró ganarse una regular clientela, a la que ahora atiende amablemente con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el estar ocupada y sentirse una mujer productiva, además del ingreso económico que le genera. Por otro lado lo que no le gusta de su actividad, es calor de la cocina a carbón que le calienta el cuerpo y le perjudica la salud. Tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se siente bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará más utensilios de cocina como platos, ollas, sartenes, así como ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos al por mayor como fideos, arroz y aceites.
texts.en:
Hilda is 48 years old and is a hardworking, dynamic woman.  She’s very friendly, jovial, and lives with her husband Luis.  She has four children, ages 15, 18, 20, and 30.  She also has three young grandchildren whom she loves very much and who live with her in her own home.

She has a food selling business and sells dishes such as tallarin, chaufa rice, fried chicken and drinks.  She sets up a table in front of her house every evening.  She started this business ten years ago, with the help of some working capital that she got from her husband.  With great effort and dedication, she was able to win regular customers.  Now she gives them friendly service, with her children’s help.

Aside from the income it generates, what she likes about this business is that it keeps her busy and makes her feel like a productive woman.  However, what she doesn’t like is the heat of the food cooked over charcoal, as it warms her body and damages her health.

She plans to open a restaurant in her home.  This will be her second loan though MFP and she’s hopeful for your cooperation that will allow her to continue with her objectives.  She feels good about her communal bank because its members are responsible people.  With this loan of 1,000 PEN ($375), she will buy more kitchen utensils, such as plates, pots, pans, and ingredients, such as noodles, rice, and cooking oils to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and ingredients.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 57 years old and married with 1 child. Lilian works very hard to provide for her family. 

For 25 years, Lilian has run a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Julia Haydee

texts.es: Julia Haydee de 40 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con sus 4 hijos dos de los cuales trabajan y el resto estudia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de carteras y bolsos para todos los gustos y preferencias, los cuales promociona de manera ambulante en diferentes zonas cerca de su lugar de residencia.  Julia Haydee se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy creativa, dedicada y sobre todo responsable. Muchas personas confían en ella ya que siempre ofrece calidad y buenos precios  en los productos que vende. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que son muchos años los que ha trabajado en la misma.
