Su sueño es poder abarcar una mayor demanda  del mercado ya que muchas veces no alcanza a cubrirla por la limitación en materia prima para realizar los diferentes bolsos y carteras. Debido a esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios (cuero, hilo, agujas, telas, etc.) con el fin de cumplir su sueño y poder ofrecer mejores condiciones a su familia ya que todo lo que hace es por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julia Haydee is 40 years old and lives in her own house with 4 children, 2 of whom work and the rest study. She makes hand-held wallets and purses for all tastes and preferences, which she sells door to door in different zones near her place of residence.

Julia Haydee is a very creative, dedicated and above all responsible person. Many people have confidence in her, because she always offers quality and good prices for the products she sells. Julia can count on lots of experience in this activity, since she has worked at this for many years.

Julia Haydee's dream is to be able to embrace a greater market demand, since often, she can't cover demand due to the lack of primary materials for making her different purses and wallets. That's why she has decided to request this loan through INTEGRAL, to invest in buying the necessary supplies for her business (leather, thread, needles, cloth, etc.) in order to fulfill her dream and be able to offer better conditions for her family. Everything she does is aimed at improving their conditions of life.

loans.use: buy leather, thread, needles, cloth, etc., to make wallets and purses.

loans.name: Upendo - Linda Group

texts.en:
Gervas is a 45 year old father of six children. One child is earning a secondary education. He has been working hard for over six years producing coffee, maize and beans. His farming problems are caused by lack of fertilizer and crop diseases. 

Gervas is looking for financial assistance that can be utilized to pay for fertilizers and insecticide for his growing crops. Also he has a target of five years to expand his scale of production from 5 to 10 acres so that he can earn more income that can be used to build better houses, buy food, clothes and cover medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, insecticide, hoes and gum boots.

loans.name: Djantoyerela 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Djantoyerela 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  KADIA, assise au milieu, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Djantoyerela 2" are married women averaging 40 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with KADIA, seated in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and at the San market to a customer base composed of men and women.

She plans on making an average profit of  160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm in puts, seeds, and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6, James has been working hard to manage his business, which is a small wholesale clothes shop. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes that would fit different ages for resale.  This will help him to generate greater profits and earn more money to provide for his family. James hopes that in the future he will be able to open other clothes stores. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Yordan Manuel

texts.es:
Yordan Manuel es un joven de 22 años, soltero, habitante del municipio de El Sauce.
Vive al lado de su madre y se siente agradecido con Dios por tener un trabajo digno que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y estudiar ya el último año de su carrera que es Ingeniería en Sistema.
A pesar de ser tan joven es muy responsable y obligado con su madre, ya que hoy ella depende de él.
Yordan labora para una Institución privada que brinda ayuda económica a los niños de escasos recursos sobre todo los que son originarios de las comarcas. Él se encarga de hacer el contacto y hacer llegar esta ayuda hasta sus hogares.
Se siente muy contento con su trabajo, ya que él apoya a esta organización extranjera que hacen felices a estos niños que muchas veces carecen de ropa, calzado y sobre todo alimentación.
Yordan en este momento necesita de la ayuda de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le apoyen con un préstamo, ya que está por culminar su carrera y necesita hacer los módulos de profesionalización para obtener su título como Ingeniero y espera en un futuro su vida cambie.

loans.use: Pago de módulos de profesionalización

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a single mother with one child, who doesn’t go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy pineapples,tomatoes,onions,peas fresh mangoes, paw-paws and oranges. She works at the market for seven days a week. Her major business challenges include perishability of fruits and vegetables. She aspires to grow some of the fruit and also to become a wholesaler of fruits. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy pineapples,tomatoes,onions,peas fresh mangoes, paw-paws and oranges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose wants to buy a dairy cattle

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene owns a small rice farm in Santa Lucia County. He has lived in rural Santa Lucia his entire life and has over 30 years of experience growing rice. He also has some cattle that he raises on his farm. He has one son who is 11 years and is currently in school. He and his wife, Veronica, hope they can continue to provide their son with an education and have him earn a college degree. They also hope they can make some improvements to their wooden home in the near future with the extra profits.

The Primero de Agosto Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Rene is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank. All bank members are part of the Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia, and they will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Cultivate Rice

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosita has telephone cabins in her house. She began her business with the savings she had from renting apartments and some money that her parents gave her. At first she only had the cabins. Now she sells pre-paid cellular phone cards. Rosita hopes to remodel her business and sell accessories for cell phones. She has the only such business in the area, which allows her a good income. Rosita is 32 years old, is separated from her husband, has 2 children who are studying, and lives in a cement house. Thanks to her business, she has a stable family. As a single mother things are difficult for Rosita, but she has faith that she can support her children. This is why she saves what is left over with the hope of being able to invest in her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita tiene unas cabinas telefónicas en su domicilio. Empezo su negocio con un ahorro que tenia de los departamentos de alquiler y un dinero que le facilitaron sus padres. Al principio solo tenia las cabinas. Ahora tiene venta de tarjetas prepago para celulares. Rosita aspira adecuar su negocio y vender accesorios para celulares. Es única en su zona lo que le permite que sus ingresos sean buenos. Rosita tiene 32, esta separada tiene 2 hijos los dos estudian, su vivienda es de cemento gracias a su negocio tiene estabilidad familiar. Como madre soltera le es dificil para Rosita, pero ella tiene la fe que podra apoyar a sus hijos. Pare eso ella ahorra lo que le sobra con la esperanza de invertir en la educacion de sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in phone accessories

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda G., 41, and her daughter Sonia, 16, have a little side business of selling cosmetics and soap products to neighbors and friends. Sonia is only 16, but has already grown the business to the point of making a profit of as much as US$140 per month. Many times when the family comes up short on the monthly payment for the other kids' schooling, Sonia comes through with a bit of money to make up the difference.

Erlinda has been borrowing with Friendship Bridge credits for four years now, and is requesting a relatively small loan this time, which will be used to invest in more products for Sonia's cosmetics sales.

Erlinda has two boys in school and they're doing well. She herself had no schooling at all, although she can read a bit and write a little. She's committed to the education of the boys, and hopes they'll have better careers as a result.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for cosmetics sales

loans.name: Saadeh

texts.en: Saadeh is a 31 year old woman living in the South of Lebanon in the village of Al Hibarieh. Saadeh owns a small beauty shop where she provides hairdressing and make up services, and she is also a good tailor who proposes sewing services in the village. She is her family's head of house and financially provides for her retired parents as well. Saadeh is very dynamic in the village community and is part of the local women's association. She would like a $1200 loan to purchase new equipment and to make aesthetic improvements to her salon.

loans.use: Saadeh would like to purchase new equipment and make aesthetic improvements to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Mrs. Soth L. E., aged 36, is a construction worker earning $10 per day. Her husband, aged 39, is a construction foreman, earning $12 per day. They have three children, one who helps his parents at work and two who are students. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase construction tools for her work as well as pay worker's fees to the contractor.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her work.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam Usmanov lives in Kastakoz; he is married and has children. He appealed to Microinvest three times and every time the loan sum was increased. He recommended himself as a serious and loyal client. He has about 10 years of experience in business, and his wife participates closely in the business. He also works as the inspector of Raygaz. Now he requires a new loan of 2000 STJ for livestock support and development.

loans.use: Business support and expansion

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
I am Balqees M.. My husband is a farmer and works on land that we have obtained on contract. He also trades livestock. I have two kids: one girl and one boy. Last year we had a loss in our animals trading because the prices fell down. My husband now again wants to buy few cows for his business for which he requires a loan. I plan to collect a dowry for my daughter with the profits this year.

I am a group leader for a few women who are: Safia B., who wants to expand their wood business; Seema B., who wants a loan to rent an orange orchard; Jabeen B. requires this loan to buy items for their grocery store; Zahida N., who needs a loan for their cardboard busienss; Rukhsana R. will utilize the loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish directly from fishermen, brings the fish home for preservation (smoking), and later sells the smoked fish to her customers. She is married with a child. Her business is doing very well. She wishes to increase her sales to meet the increasing demand for her fish. Mary is hereby seeking $225 of additional capital to buy more fresh fish for processing and to then sell the fish to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional fresh fish for processing to increase sales.

loans.name: Ndifakulya East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sulaina N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to rent bigger premises. Sulaina is 33 years old and is married with a husband who trades produce for work. She has 1 school going daughter aged 14. Each week, Sulaina makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Sulaina is joined in her small group by Amina B., Aisha B., Justine Y., and Mariam K.. Amina B. has a business making and selling pottery and wants to add more capital. Aisha B. is currently operating a business in chicken trading and wants a loan to expand her business. Justine Y. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Mariam K. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar H. is a 55-year-old grocer who runs her business from home. She earns about $10 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Chhorn, earns $6 per day as a construction worker. They live with their 6 children in the Sophy Village, Banteay Meanchey Province.

She requests a $1,000 loan to expand her stock of groceries and to purchase a motorcycle for her husband. This will allow her to increase her business profit and make it easier for her husband to get to work. In the photo, her husband is sitting in the bed, and two women are her clients. Mrs. Sar H. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To expand her stock of groceries and to purchase a motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Evelyne M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 9. In 2004 Evelyne established her communications business, where she provides telephone and computer services. Evelyne requires a loan in order to purchase additional phone credit vouchers and computer accessories. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional phone credit vouchers in bulk, as well as computer accessories

loans.name: José Ariel

texts.es:
Mr. José Ariel L. has worked very hard since he was a young man raising cattle. He has developed his skills in raising livestock such as calves, cows, heifers, and pigs.

He is the father of three children and since he started his business, he has been through difficult situations such as the lack of financial resources for the acquisition of animals. Nonetheless, despite these difficult situations he has survived thanks to his hard work and the support that Ceprodel has provided him through business loans. Today he is requesting a loan with the purpose of obtaining enough money to purchase calves. It is important to point out that this credit will bring him greater opportunities to improve his financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero José Ariel L. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo desde muy joven al negocio de la ganadería el cual ha desarrollado habilidades en la crianza de ganado como terneros, vacas, vaquillas y cerdos.

Es padre de tres hijos y desde que inició en este negocio ha atravesado múltiples situaciones adversas como la ausencia del recurso económico para la adquisición de los animales. Sin embargo a pesar de sus difíciles situaciones ha sobrevivido gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para el negocio. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito con el propósito de adquirir el dinero para la compra de los terneros. Es menester destacar que gracias a este crédito logrará mayor oportunidad para mejorar su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Thi Qua

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Qua (ID number: 030002) is 42 years old this year. She wants to borrow 2,006,000VND (approximately 125USD) to buy more popcorn to sell. Her family has a stable income. The family's average daily income is 70,000VND (approximately 4.50USD). She has two school-going children. She likes to join this Fund because the procedure is simple. Her family had borrowed from the Women's Group before.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Lưu Thị Quả (MS: 030002), năm nay 42. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua hàng bỏng ngô bán, gia đình có thu nhập thường xuyên. Cô có 2 con còn đang đi học. Mức thu nhập bình quân 70.000 VND/ngày. Cô thích tham gia chương trình vì thủ tục đơn giản. Gia đình cô đã từng vay vốn của hội phụ nữ.

loans.use: Popcorn selling

loans.name: Rosa And Ayde Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a 37-year-old mother of three children. Rosa sells fruit at the regional fairs, traveling on Saturdays and Sundays to buy cereals, cheeses, etc. to resell in the local markets. Furthermore, Rosa works in a house where she cooks and cleans.

Meanwhile, Ayde is a single, 27-year old-woman. Ayde sells food on the weekends in the Nery Garcia market, streetside in the mornings, and sells catalog cosmetics.

Rosa and Ayda are members of the Generosidad Vilage Bank. They need respective loans of 400 Nuevos Soles each to invest in oranges, bananas, cucumbers, pots, and knives. Rosa and Ayde's dream is to improve their businesses, to have a stable business, and that their children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in oranges, bananas, cucumbers, pots and knives

loans.name: Omina

texts.en:
I. Omina is 45 years old. She married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to support her husband with the family expenses, Omina has been running her own business of selling coats and jackets at the local market of Isfara town for more than 12 years.

She started with a small side business from home. Thanks to her good nature, she has been able to multiply her client base. Her main motivation is to provide a good education for her four children and to make their family living conditions better. Omina already has a good fixed client base, whose buying changes with the seasons. Since autumn came, she is certain she will take in good sales.

Omina is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni (1000 USD) to purchase autumn raincoats, since she knows her demand is increasing and already has orders for them. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months. She is grateful for your support in continuing her business and helping improve her family's quality of life. We believe Omina’s willingness to offer her customers greater value and a wider choice of merchandise, combined with her excellent service, will secure the successful growth of her trade and guarantee good profits from sales.

loans.use: Purchase autumn coats for women in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Hamdam

texts.en:
S. Hamdam is 46 years old. He is married with 2 children – an 18-year-old daughter and a 15-year-old son. He and his family live in the town of Khujand. Hamdam rents a bus and offers transportation services.  Hamdam’s usual itinerary is the Khujand-Gafurov-Khujand route. He usually has many passengers as there are no other bus drivers who take this route. Hamdam has been in this business for 6 years, and it is the only source of income for the family.

Currently, Hamdam earns a profit of about $20 a day. Hamdam’s bus needs maintenance. At the moment, its running gear has to be fixed. That is why Hamdam is requesting a loan of $800 to fix the problem. One of his long-term plans is to buy the bus and continue to be self-employed. Hamdam promises to repay this loan in 12 months without any delay.

loans.use: Purchase parts to repair his bus

loans.name: Bahati's Group

texts.en:
Bahati has been selling charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may increase her inventory and expand her business. With an increase in profits, Bahati intends to reinvest in her business so that it may continue to grow.

Bahati is currently able to earn a profit of approximately US$ 15 each month. She is 23 years old, single, and has no children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tunu, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr: Mr T. est pére de famille agé de quarente (40) ans .Il est tailleur de profession depuis 22 ans .Dans son atelier il forme des jeunes au metier de tailleur en meme temps il confection des vetements.Les fetes de fin d' année constituent  des periodes de grandes opportinuté pour les tailleurs ainsi il sollicite un pret pour acheter de accessoires (fils biais bouton renfort ect)pour pouvoir beneficier des economies d'echelle.
texts.en:
Mr. T. is 40 years old and a father of a family. He has been a tailor by profession for 22 years. He uses his workshop to teach young people the tailoring trade while at the same time selling his clothing. The end of the year holiday is a very important sales period for tailors. For this reason he is requesting this loan to purchase accessories ( thread, buttons, cut material, linings, etc) that would increase his business and benefit from the economies of scale.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds (to purchase materials)

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar G. is originally from the town of Istaravshan. For several years he has dedicated himself to sheep breeding. He has attended to this work with great effort in order to maintain his home. He is married with 3 children and has the duty of supporting his family. For this reason he has decided to once again come to IMON International for help in buying sheep to raise. It is his dream to develop his business with more loans and in this way continue to maintain his humble home. At this time he has taken out 2 loans and has repaid them both in a timely manner. Zafar promises to repay this loan in a timely manner, as well, and thanks all Kiva lenders for trusting and supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more sheep to expand his business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hươngnăm nay 35 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2006. Trong suốt quá trình tham gia Quỹ tình thương phần lớn số vốn vay được chị Hương đều sử dụng vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại đây cũng là  một  trong những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu  đáng kể từ  việc sửa xe đạp của chồng (bình quân 80 000/ngày) . Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000 để mua thêm phụ tùng sửa xe đạp và đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hương, 35 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. In the past, she has used most of her loans from the Fund to raise animals, and today this is one of the main sources of income for her family. Besides raising animals, the family earns money from her husband’s bicycle repair shop (an average of about 80,000 VND (5 USD) per day). In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy spare bicycle parts and to invest in expanding the repair shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Rebbecca

texts.en:
Rebbecca W. is currently in the business of selling ice cream at the market street, on occasional days, and at the stadiums. Rebbecca is 34 years old and single. She has no children. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling ice cream.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 33  años de edad, vive  en pareja con Gladys Aguero de 32 años de edad, viven en  casa propia, tienen un hijo de 3 años .
Moisés empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor,  luego adquirió una pequeña camioneta y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace más de cinco años.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de todo tipo, las cuales distribuye en un camión de su propiedad por las compañías de la ciudad de Paraguari.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ya cuenta con buena clientela bien formada y además le da trabajo a dos primos suyos, quienes cobran de acuerdo a las ventas realizadas.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de harina, arroz, azúcar, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Moisés is 33 years of age and lives with his partner Gladys Aguero who is 32 years old. They live in their own home and have a son who is 3 years old. From a young age Moisés started to work with his father as a salesman. He then acquired a small truck and began to work independently more than five years ago. He currently works selling all kinds of merchandise, which he distributes in his truck to companies of the city of Paraguari. Thanks to his effort he already has a well developed clientele and in addition employs two of his cousins, who earn according to their sales. He needs a loan to buy flour, rice, sugar, drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, sugar, drinks etc. to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth) for resale

loans.name: Kadijat

texts.en: Kadijat is 33 years old and married with two children.  She sells building materials like paint, nails, etc.  She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more building materials to sell.  Kadijat thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama S. is married with 6 dependents and received an education through Junior High School. Since 2004, she has worked as a trader at Dwomo, near Shama Junction, selling items such as meat pies, drinking water, a cocoa drink (a chocolate flavoured drink that is served cold) and soft drinks.  While Ama works as a trader, her husband is employed as a mason.   Ama uses her income to assist her husband in paying various household expenses, primarily for the needs of the children.  She will use the loan to increase her capital base to buy more flour and other ingredients for the making of pie for sale. With her newly gained profits, Ama plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Vinaca

texts.es:
La señora Vinaca pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tien 60 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 02 hijos, no tiene estudios; vive en la Comunidad de Lupaza sector Patáni. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, tiene su negocio de compra y neta de ganado menor, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00  nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital adicional. 
Debido a la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de más cabezas de ganado para incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia. 
A la señora Vinaca le gusta mucho los ahorros y las reuniones en las cuales, nos cuenta, que se distrae mucho con sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
Vinaca belongs to “Rio Desaguadero” communal bank in the district Desaguadero, province Chucuito, department Puno. She is 60 years old, widdowed, and has 02 children. She has not gone to school. She lives in the Lupaza community in the Patáni area. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She has her business purchasing and clearing small livestock. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 which she used for additional capital. Due to demand from her customers, she now needs a loan of S/. 3000.00 so that she can purchase more livestock and increase her income, and help her family. Vinaca really likes savings and the meetings, in which, she tells us, she enjoys herself with the other women.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing alpacas and sheep

loans.name: Hamid

texts.ru: Хамид Кузиев торгует на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова.Для расширения бизнеса Хамид уже второй год получает кредиты в Микроинвесте.Хамид ездит за товаром в Истаравшан на оптовый рынок.Торгует на рынке каждый день.Его запасные части в основном для сантехников, поэтому у него много своих постоянных клиентов, которые покупают у него товар.Для пополнения товарооборота Хамид хочет получить следующий кредит.
texts.en:
Hamid K. sells at the Farovon market in Gafurov. Hamid has been using loans from Microinvest to expand his business for the past two years. He travels to the wholesale market in Istaravshan to buy merchandise, and sells at the market each day. The spare parts he has are mostly for plumbers, so he has many regular customers. Hamid would like to obtain another loan to use to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare plumbing parts

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 34 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children who are all in school.

Regina sells at the community market of the place where she lives with her family. She sells fried yam with fish by the roadside of Adawso, a suburb of Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. Fried yam with fish is a very tasty meal and is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. Regina has been in this business for five years now.

Regina takes delivery of yams in bulk from the farmers and the fish from the Koforidua market. She says the price of commodities in the market has increased now, making it difficult to buy more stock. She is therefore requesting loan support to enable her to meet the daily demands of her customers by buying more yams and other ingredients. She believes with that help she can realize her dream of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more yams, cooking oil, fish, etc.

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
Arifa H. is 57, married, and has five children. She started her own business nine years ago because her husband at that time was unemployed. Arifa sells different kinds of food in the local market, such as candies, cookies, butter, yoghurt, tea and pastries. The generated income allows Arifa to support her family. Arifa dreams that all of her children will achieve a higher education.

Today, Arifa requests 2000 USD to purchase more food products to enlarge her range of goods. She is planning to spend the income on the well-being of her family as well as for educating her children.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a member of the Dodoma Roa C borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa, is a 36-year-old married mother of four children, ages 14, 11, 9, and 6 years. She also cares for one other dependent. Joyce started her own retail business selling charcoal eight years ago. Working eight hours a day, she earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This will be Joyce’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal, and with the additional profit accruing from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell grains

loans.name: Saidati

texts.en: Saidati A. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and married woman. She runs a food shop in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food crop products. She purchases the business goods directly from the producers on a wholesale basis and also from the city market, then sells them to retail customers at her shop. She meets her family's daily demands from the business income and also capitalizes the business. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 44 años, es soltera y vive en su casa propia. Lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida y tener una vejez tranquila. Se dedica es la elaboración de helados, ella misma los prepara y distribuye entre las tiendas donde tiene contrato, donde sus helados son rápidamente consumidos, debido al sabor tan agradable que tienen, es por eso que su negocio marcha muy bien. Lo que más le gusta a Gregoria de su trabajo es que puede distribuir su tiempo entre la elaboración de helados y el arreglo de su hogar. Lleva 9 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el frió que le hace cuando prepara sus helados. Para el futuro espera tener una heladería grande donde pueda vender sus helados cómodamente.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Gregoria con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos siempre ha sido muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar una nueva máquina de helados, ya que una de las que usa actualmente ya no funciona bien.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 44 years old, single, and lives in her own home. What she wants most is to get ahead in life and have a peaceful retirement. She makes ice cream and distributes it to stores where she has a contract, mainly places where ice cream is rapidly consumed. Business has been doing very well because her product tastes so good. What Gregoria likes most about her work is that she can divide her time between making ice cream and taking care of her home. She has been in business for 9 years and says the most difficult part of her job is enduring the cold while she is preparing the ice cream. In the future, she hopes to open a large ice cream shop where she can sell her product more easily.

This is Gregoria’s fifth loan with MFP. Her previous loans were always repaid on time and she expects the same with this loan. With the 3000 soles that she requested, she plans to buy a new ice cream machine since the one she currently has is not functioning well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new ice cream machine

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Vilma del Socorro Ramírez Narváez tiene 62 años, a esta edad Vilma ha luchado por salir adelante en la vida y ha conocido de diferentes experiencias de su negocio. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo como es la elaboración de de ropa variada, bolsos y mochilas. Ella siempre ha sido cliente de Fundación León 2000, ella es madre de 10 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende ella ya que todos trabajan de manera independiente. Ella distribuye sus productos de manera ambulante, por lo que ya que es la única posibilidad que tiene mostrar sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus productos. Su deseo es  mantener este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma del Socorro Ramírez Narváez is 62 years old. At her age, Vilma has struggled to make progress in life and has had many different experiences with her business. She has dedicated herself to the same work for over 20 years, which is the creation of handbags, backpacks and clothing of various types. She has always been a client of the León 2000 Foundation. She is the mother of 10 children, none of whom are financially dependent on her today, since they are all working independently. She distributes her products on foot, since it is the only way she can show them to buyers. The financing she is currently requesting will provide working capital to purchase raw materials for each of her products. Her desire is to continue with this business, since it is her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi is 27 years old, and is married with two children who are both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the busy commercial/farming community of Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region.

Kofi runs a roadside grocery store in his community. He sells all kinds of provisions, which he procures from Kumasi and sometimes from distribution vans. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk for his store

loans.name: Vet

texts.en: Fish is the main source of food for a great majority of Cambodians and many Cambodian people depend on catching fish to earn a living. One of these people is 35 year old Vet D.. Him and his wife wake up when the sky is still dark in order to prepare their equipment to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River, which is the best place to catch fish. After they have finished fishing, they take the fish and sell it at the local fish market. Besides fishing, Vet D. also provides a taxi service using his motorbike. Vet D. is requesting this loan to purchase a boat for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for his fishing business

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh S., 44, is a low-income woman living in Kampong Chhnang Province, in Cambodia, where she and her husband earn a living as chicken traders. Lonh S. has given birth to three children, who are employed in different occupations.

The couple goes to buy chicken in bulk from citizens who live in the rural area and then they bring them to sell to their customers who are retail sellers in the market.

Lonh S. requests a loan for capital to sustain the growth of her chicken selling business

loans.use: As capital for her chicken selling business.

loans.name: Aylen

texts.en:
Aylen D. lives in the village of Brgy. Sibucao, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, with 3 school-age children. Her husband used to be a baker, but now he helps Aylen run their business.

When her husband was earning a salary as a baker, Aylen stringently allocated the income on their household's needs. But she realized that as her children grew, their expenses would also increase and soon her husband's income would not be sufficient.

This encouraged her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001. She used the new capital to start a food vending business, selling food within her community and in the neighboring villages. She also put up a "sari-sari" or general store to ensure that she would have a regular daily income. The business performance was so good that the couple decided it would be more lucrative for her husband to manage their general store than earn a monthly salary as a baker. 

As their business experience widened, they also took on new opportunities like selling vegetables. Now they earn a monthly income of 15,000 PHP, which is quite enough for the current needs of their family including the education of the children.

Aylen used her previous loan of 21,000 PHP as additional capital for her businesses. Now Aylen will use her 18th cycle loan of 22,000 PHP as working capital for her general store. Income from it will be used for house improvements.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store.

loans.name: Good Family Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Good Family' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. They have been in business for many years now but business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs. They therefore decided to form themselves into a group of three and apply for a loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of a loan, they can expand their businesses and make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better provide for themselves and their children.

The leader of this group of borrowers is Musu M. on the left. Musu was born in Waterloo, forty-seven years ago. She is a widow with four children. Two of her children are attending school – one in primary and the other in secondary school.

Musu owns a bar where she sells hard drinks, soft drinks, luncheon meat, sardines, baked beans, cigarettes, and so on. She has been in this business for more than twenty years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy two crates of beer, two crates of stout, one carton of Codys and one carton of Carlsberg.

loans.use: Buy two crates of beer, two crates of stout, etc.

loans.name: Boli

texts.en: Boli is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in Dornogobi Province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a private company while her oldest daughter Nomintuya is in university. Her youngest two, aged 15 and 17, are in a local secondary school. Boli operates a grocery trading and felt product making business. During summer she plants vegetables to sell in her little grocery shop while in winter she makes felt products such as shoes, souvenirs, etc. to sell to her neighborhood residents. Boli started her business in 2000 and has built a stable operation over the years. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and is focused on the future. Her business has provided her family with financial stability and has enabled her to improve her quality of life. Boli has many plans for the future and says, "With continued success, I hope to buy equipment for my felt product business." She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more products to sell in her grocery business and to build a greenhouse for her vegetable growing.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Marie Hélène

texts.fr: Marie Hélène D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et les bénéfices gérés de cette activité lui permettent de s'équiper en meubles et de s'occuper de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Marie Hélène D. is a 38-year-old woman, married and mother of three children. She has been a member of the local ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for five years. Her occupation is fattening sheep. The income generated by this activity allows her to acquire furniture and take care of her progeny.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her working capital

loans.name: Oneyda María

texts.es:
La señora Oneyda María N. E., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, es Auditor fiscal, todavía está en la universidad estudia administración de empresas, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres.
Ella solicito el crédito para ayudarles a sus padres a realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda por que todos viven juntos y aportan un granito de arena.
texts.en:
Sra. Oneyda María N. E. works for the City of Chinandega as a financial auditor. She is still a university student who is studying for a degree in business administration. Oneyda is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents.

The loan she is requesting will be used to help her parents with some home improvements. Since they all live together, she would like to make a small contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to make improvements to her parents' house

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon.  She is 42 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Marilyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling mostly food and daily use products in the local community.  Marilyn has been in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilyn joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her 1st from HSPFI.  Marily plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 
---------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Siguikadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Siguikadi sont majoritairement des  femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans,  2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Noumousso  un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo,  Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les trois prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente de beurre de karité et des tasses en plastique.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter chacune, 150kg de beurre de karité, 4 douzaines  de tasses en plastique.  
Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages avoisinants et au grand marché de la ville de Kadiolo. Elles vendent à Kadiolo ville et au marché les jours de foires, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 35.750 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent devenir des grossistes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Siguikadi group are mainly married women, with in average 38 years of age, two children and most of them live in polygamous families in Noumousso, a neighborhood of the city of Kadiolo, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. This is their fourth solidarity loan and they fully repaid the previous ones. They sell shea butter and plastic bins. With this new loan each of them is planning to buy 150 kg. of shea butter and four dozens of plastic bins. They buy their supplies in the neighbor villages and at the big market in the city of Kadiolo. They sell their products for cash in Kadiolo and at the market on fair days to a customer base of both men and women. They expect to reach average monthly earnings of 35,750 FCFA each, of which part will go into savings and meeting family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in their business. Their ambition is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of selling items

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: To make a living, Rosemarie C. raises pigs for sale. She is 37 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City. Rosemarie has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes M. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a que su negocio tuviera más variedad de mercancía para vender.
Doña Mercedes está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que el actual esta en muy malas condiciones y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder mejor su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio de venta de ropa. Ya que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. is very grateful for the previous loan that made it possible for her to have more varied stock merchandise to sell. Mercedes is asking for a new loan to repair the roof on her house because it is in very poor condition and she does not have funds at present to make these needed home repairs. She plans to repay the loan with profits from her clothing sales since her children help her out with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Sra. Guillermina C. D. Vásquez, tiene 59 años D. edad. Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, patos y gallos D. pelea. Ella es casada. Su esposo percibe un ingreso mensual por su pensión D. jubilación. Viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Tate Camino GranD.. Su vivienda esta siendo lentamente reconstruida  con sus esfuerzos después del terremoto del año 2007. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora ya que no solo se ha dedicado a la crianza D. animales si no que también venD. comida. Con dichos ingresos ha educado a sus hijos  siendo actualmente personas independientes. Su sueño es construir totalmente su vivienda D. material noble, con el fin D. alcanzar una mejor calidad D. vida. Por eso está solicitando el préstamo. 

La Sra. C. se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le estamos brindando con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina C. D. Vásquez is 59 years old. She raises and sells chickens, ducks, and fighting cocks. She is married, and her husband receives a monthly income from his retirement pension. They live in their own house in the Tate Camino GranD. district. Their house is slowly being reconstructed through their efforts since the 2007 earthquake. Sra. C. is a very entrepreneurial woman who not only raises animals but also sells food. With this income, she has educated her children, who are now independent people. Her dream is to totally construct their house out of good quality materials, with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. This is why she is requesting a loan. Sra. C. is very grateful for the support that is offered her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut J. A. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut J. is the group leader of a 16-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Triwana Sari (MUK-0024).

Ni Ketut J. is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, Ni Ketut J. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut J. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Ketut J. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut J. is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK in the amount of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Ketut J. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Ketut J. A. (0) merupakan 27 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Ketut J. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 16 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Triwana Sari (MUK-0024).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut J. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut J. menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut J. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut J. meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo H. is from the village of Little Tadian. He is 44 years old. Eduardo is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP when he sells a pig he has raised.

In 2010, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 33 años, es una carismática y atenta mujer, está casada con Ever de 38 años, juntos tienen 4 hijos y viven en su casa propia, que se encuentra ubicada en una zona turística de la ciudad de “La Merced”. Desde dulces hasta prendas de vestir, se puede encontrar en la tienda de Norma, que es una de las tiendas muy bien surtidas. Paralelo a ello prepara comida y la ofrece a las personas quienes trabajan en los campos agrícolas, mientras su esposo, labora como ayudante panadero y en su tiempo libre la ayuda en su puesto de comida, atendiendo a sus clientes. Lleva 3 años dedicada a estos oficios y confiesa que más le gusta hacer compras observando la necesidad de sus consumidores y hasta distingue marcas y precios. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable porque le genera ganancias considerables, en donde lo administra e invierte en aras de ampliar su bodega hasta poder vender al por mayor y menor. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está agradecida con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes son muy responsables y unidos ya que le permiten seguir accediendo a créditos que le facilitan su progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de primera necesidad y comestibles, así como bebidas alcohólicas y gasificadas.
texts.en:
Norma, age 33, is a charismatic and thoughtful woman. She is married to Ever, who is 38. They have four children, and they live in their own house. It is located in a tourist area in the city of La Merced. You can find things from sweets to clothing in Norma’s store. It is one of the stores that is very well stocked. She also prepares food and sells it to the people who work in the fields. Her husband works as a baker’s assistant. In his time off he helps her with her food stand by waiting on her customers. She has been doing these jobs for three years. She says that what she likes the most is making purchases according to her observations about her customers’ needs, brands, and prices. She thinks that this activity is very profitable because it generates considerable earnings. She manages the income and invests it in order to expand her store until she is able to sell for retail and wholesale. This is her third loan with MFP. She is grateful to the members of her communal bank. They are very responsible and united. They allow her to continue to get loans, which facilitate her progress. She will use the requested loan to buy basic needs products, food, and other things such as alcoholic drinks and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products such as basic needs products and soft drinks

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Antonia es una mujer dedicada al comercio, tiene la edad de 41 años, madre soltera de tres hijos, desde hace varios años vende productos de papas, fritas, manzana, algodones de azúcar, palomitas, que vende de forma ambulante junto con su hijo mayor para lograr vender y sacar el diario de su alimentación.
En su casa aun falta hacer muchas mejoras, como repellar paredes, embaldosar por es de tierra, lo que hará en un futuro ya que no cuenta con dinero para estas mejoras ya que lo primordial es lograr ayudar a sus hijos y poder pagar los gastos básicos.
Con este financiamiento podrá comprar: quintal de papas, galón de mayonesa, salsa de tomate, queso, platos desechables para servir las papas fritas, tres canastos de manzanas, quintales de maíz, para preparar las palomitas, y lograr aumentar su inventario.
En este momento hay poca venta y la que tenía la anda mi hijo mayor vendiendo. 
Contenta ya que podrá seguir con la inversión de su negocio mediante estos prestamos.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia is a businesswoman. She is 41 years old and the single mother of three children. She's been selling fried potatoes and apples, candy apples, cotton candy, and popcorn for several years. She sells on foot, along with her eldest son, in order to be able to earn enough for their daily sustenance. Her home still needs many improvements, such as repairing walls and tiling the dirt floor. She will do this later because she does not have the money. Her priority is to help her children and pay for basic necessities. This loan will allow her to buy 100 kilograms (kg) of potatoes, a gallon of mayonnaise, tomato sauce, cheese, and paper plates on which to serve the fried potatoes, three baskets of apples, and 100 kg lots of popping corn. This will allow her to increase her inventory. At this time her sales are low and her eldest son makes those that she has. She is happy that she will be able to continue investing in her business through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie J. is from the village of Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells bananas and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211040002) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


H. is married and has 2 adult children. She owns & operates a livestock business, raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The will be the 2nd loan taken out by H. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Ngô Thị T. (0) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20211040002) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Ngô Thị T. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Virtuosas se conformó en fecha 09 de abril del 2.010 gracias  a la Sra. Myrian. 
En la actualidad todos participan activamente en las reuniones semanales, y están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado, y desean seguir trabajando en conjunto ya que alcanzaron buenos resultados hasta ahora.
Una de las integrante es la señora Myrian, una señora muy activa y que trabaja constantemente para su familia.
Ella se dedica  a venta de frutas y verduras, y lo realiza recorriendo las casas de los clientes quienes ya la conocen y la consideran proveedora de frutas y verduras.
Así ella cuenta con clientela formada y cada dia sale a mercado para comprar las mercaderías que posteriormente sale a vender.
Comenta que la actividad es muy sacrificada pero que seguirá trabajando hasta conseguir el capital para abrir un puesto de ventas en el mercado y desde ahí realizar sus ventas.
Ella solicita en esta oportunidad el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras (papaya, plátanos, ananás, naranjas, cebollas, tomates y otros)
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas women committee was founded on April 9 2010 thanks to Myrian. All group members are actively involved in weekly meetings, are very grateful Fundacion Paraguaya for their support, and wish to continue to work together as they have had good results so far. One of the members is Myriam, a very active woman who works hard for her family. She sells fruits and vegetables from door to door. Her customers already know her and see her as their supplier of fruits and vegetables, so she has a good customer base. Every day she goes to market to buy the goods she later sells. She says that it's hard work but she will continue to work until she gets enough capital to open a market stall where to sell from. She would like to take this opportunity to request a loan to buy fruits and vegetables (papaya, bananas, pineapples, oranges, onions, tomatoes, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina F. is 55 and married with seven children. She owns a business catching and selling ocean fish. She has two years of experience in this business and needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $100 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Lolina joined SPBD in 2010 and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Lolina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Materials for her tailoring

loans.name: Lê

texts.en:
Dị Lê D. (20209010009) is a 51-year-old man living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. He is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Dị owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale.  Dị has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,300,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Dị joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Dị is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Dị from SEDA.  Dị plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Dị Lê D. (20209010009) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Dị Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Dị thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dị kiếm được khoảng 3.300.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Dị đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các D.ch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dị đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua con giống.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.
