Dị dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các D.ch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên D.ch. .  Do việc biên D.ch thủ công các D. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela O. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Michaela is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Michaela owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Michaela has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michaela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michaela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Michaela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh G. is 31 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two daughters, aged eight and six, both attend a local primary school, while his wife is a hairdresser. Gansuh operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2008 with a working capital of 800,000 MNT. Since then, he has found success with his new business and has gained many permanent customers within this short period. Today, he has built a stable operation and his working capital has grown to exceed 3,000,000 MNT. For the future, he hopes to continue growing his business successfully. Gansuh is a very polite, open-minded man. His dreams are to buy a new car and to have a comfortable workplace for his wife. He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase replacement parts for his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Gulvarkhon's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan is slowly developing its fashion industry. Such clothing designers as Dilbar Ashimbaeva, Assol Moldokmatova and Galina Boikova are proving that Kyrgyz ornaments and traditional accessories can arouse a great deal of interest on an international scale.

Gulvarkhon J., the 48-year-old leader of this group, is a resident of Uzgen and the mother of eight daughters, three of whom are under 18. Her husband is a cab driver. A unique designer and sewer, Gulvarkhon's creation is a “tushak”, which is a mattress or a blanket that is usually spread on the floor with pillows on it. It’s a great symbol of Kyrgyz handmade traditional goods, and almost every family has some at home, which explains the big demand for them. Gulvarkhon used to make tushaks just for home use or as gifts to friends, but one day her friend suggested that it could be a good business idea. And she was right. The popularity of these tushaks has spurred great interest among both local residents and foreigners.

Sewing these tushaks requires large expenditures on inputs such as fabrics of cotton, velvet and velor. Gulvarkon believes that her group is suitable for this loan and she thanks all lenders. Gulvarkhon’s dream is to purchase a two-storied house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials for sewing

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una madre de familia de 56 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona marginal del distrito de Reque, una localidad bastante comercial que se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con animales  menores como cuyes, conejos, pavos, gallinas y ovejas, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar su  localidad con frecuencia. El negocio le ayuda a mantener la economía de su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerza para sacarlo adelante.

Adelaida desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra en mal estado y su estructura se dañaría aún mas debido a las lluvias que se presentan en la estación de verano. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a mother, 56 years old, lives with her husband and children in a poor area in the Reque district. The area is commercialized and located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She counts on small animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, turkeys, chickens, and sheep which she raises in her small backyard. When they mature she sells the to the public and other sellers who visit her frequently. Her business allows her to financially help her family as she always makes an effort to improve their standard of living.

Adelaida would like to make some improvements to her home since it is in bad condition and the foundation would get worse due to rain damage that come during the summers. To do this she requested from Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: Zeledonio

texts.es:
Don Zeledonio tiene 27 años de edad, vive en su finca de 40 manzanas de terreno situada en la Comarca el Jicaro, zona sur de Nueva Guinea,  

desde muy pequeño desarrolla la actividad agropecuaria, comercializa Ganado en compra y venta y tambien le saca provecho a su Finca realizando cultivos agricolas, raices y tuberculos de modo que sus ingresos sean rentables en el mercado para el sostenimiento de su Familia, la Finca presenta buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo del inventario ganadero, posee 48 cbz,  su crédito anterior lo cancelo bien, solicita el 3er crédito, para invertir en compra de ternero desarrollo, 

ya que sueña con manejar una hacienda con verdes pastizales y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a su famila.
texts.en:
Zeledonio is 27 years old and lives on his 40 manzana (1 manzana = 1.73 acres) ranch located in Jicaro region, an area south of Nueva Guinea.

Since he was very young, he has worked as a farmer.  He buys and sells livestock and takes advantage of his ranch by growing crops, roots, and tubers.  His income is profitable in the market and supports his family.  His ranch is in good technical condition for the development of livestock.  He owns 48 cbz.  

He repaid his last loan and he is asking for a 3rd loan to invest in the purchase of calves that he can raise.

He dreams of running a ranch with green pastures and improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 old and married with six children. He and his family live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. John has been selling and buying maize for fifteen years and the business is profitable, as he has been able to build a house. John’s major challenge is the high cost of rent and electricity for his business. John is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell. In the future, he would like to own a store and become a central supplier.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Amistad 6 Group

texts.en: Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Amistad 6 (Friendship), and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in El Seybo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children. Carmen is excited to be seeking her second loan with Esperanza. Notably, she has already successfully repaid her previous loan which enabled her to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Specifically, she sells underwear, so the loan will be used to purchase them for kids and women. She will invest the profits in completing her home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro Lopez C. es habitante de la comunidad de Loma Manantial a treinta minutos de Tierra Blanca en el estado de VeraC.. Ella tiene la edad de 35 años solo estudio scundaria y es madre soltera de dos niñas de nombres Amairani de 12 años de edad que asiste a la primaria y Maria Teresa de 5 años de edad que asiste al preescolar, Socorro como la conocen en su comunidad nos platica que ya hace mas de tres años inicio con su propio negocio de venta de pollo destazado, ella vende desde su casa y nos dice que regular mente no vende todos los dias ya que es un pueblo pequeño solo vende cuando levanta pedido con sus clientes amigos amigos y vecinos, ella tambien vende cosmeticos por catalogo los cuales vcende casa por casa en su comunidad y algunas veces sale a vender a otras comunidades, ella lleva los catalogos con sus clientes, levanta pedido y posteriormente lo encarga a sus proveedores, cuando su pedido llega los entrega a sus clientes y recibe su pago, Socorro nos dice que ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio ya que es madre soltera y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus pequeñas y darles una mejor calidad de vida, ella necesita este prestamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, catalogos y cosmeticos. Soccorro esta muy agradecida con la fundacion por la oportunidad que le esta brindando para que su negocio prospere por medio del prestamo.
texts.en:
Señora María del Socorro L. C. lives in Loma Manantial, half an hour from Tierra Blanca in the State of VeraC.. She is 35 years old, studied only until secondary level and is the single mother of two daughters: Amairani is 12 and attends elementary school, and María Teresa is 5 and goes to kindergarten.

Socorro, as she is called in her neighborhood, told us that more than three years ago she started her own business, selling quartered chicken from her home. Regularly there were days when she sold nothing because she lives in a small town, and she sold her products only when she could secure orders from her friends and neighbors. She also sells cosmetics from a catalogue; she sells door-to-door in her neighborhood and sometimes she travels to other neighborhoods. She takes the catalogues to her customers, takes the orders and subsequently requests the products from her suppliers. When she gets the products, she takes them to her customers and receives payment. Socorro told us that she decided to open her own store, because she is a single mother and needs to be successful to provide her daughters with a better quality of life.

Socorro needs this loan to buy chickens, catalogs and cosmetics. She is very grateful to the microfinance organization Fundación Realidad A.C. for the provided opportunity to see her business grow thanks to the loan.

loans.use: To buy chickens and cosmetics

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling business for the past one year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She hopes to expand her food stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and cooking oil

loans.name: Los Lopez Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los López está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Felix de 56 años quien se dedica al comercio de verduras en el populoso mercado oriental. Ella inicio en este negocio de desde muy joven y poco a poco lo fue aumentando.
Ella con el crédito comprara verduras como zanahoria, chayote, ayote, yuca, quequisque, papa, yerba buena..etc.

Los otros integrantes son María de 25 años se dedica a realizar bordados desde hace 5 años y Terecio quien vende calzado desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The “Los López” group has three hard working, dedicated, enterprising members. Félix is 56 years old and is a vegetable merchant at the crowded Oriental Market.  She started the business while still very young and gradually has been expanding it.  She will use the loan to buy vegetables like carrots, chayote, squash, manioc, taro, potato, spearmint, etc.

The other group members are María, 25, who has been making embroidery for five years, and Terencio, who has sold shoes for ten years.

loans.use: For fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.es: Maria C. R.  de 27 años  se dedica a vender pescado de mar y   vive en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo de 5 años en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Maria comenzó su negocio hace 7 años  con $500.000 COP, ocurrencia que tuvo cuando visitaba,  en su natal  El Banco Magdalena,  a su familia,  en las navidades y muchas veces regresaba desde allí trayendo pescados para su hogar, que terminaba vendiéndolos entre sus mas cercanas amistades.  Desde ese momento le ha ido muy bien, trabaja con su cónyuge y su  meta es la de incrementar su mercado y con ello las ventas de este producto; Maria es una joven muy dinámica, que en la actualidad vende pescado al  por mayor en la plaza del mercado, pero  ella igualmente genera otros ingresos  vendiendo mercancías variadas  desde su casa y por encargo. En la actualidad el pescado se lo traen dese El Banco Magdalena, pero  últimamente  ha encontrado una forma de comprar que le resultaría  mas económica,  si pudiera traerlo desde  Zapatoca, un municipio en el departamento del Cesár. Esta es el objetivo de solicitar su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para que  su esposo viaje directamente a este municipio y logren hacer una negociación directa y beneficiosa para ella y sus clientes,  en cuanto a precio y a calidad. Su inversión sería exitosa porque se acerca la semana mayor, época donde las ventas de este producto se incrementan  por razones de que muchas personas no consumen carnes rojas en días específicos y el pescado forma parte de la dieta de muchas familias que conservan esta tradición.
texts.en: Maria C. R. is 27-years-old and she works as a fishmonger. She lives with her spouse and 5-year-old son in the municipality of Malambo in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. Maria began this business 7 years ago with $500,000 COP (Colombian currency). She had this wild idea when she was visiting her family for Christmas in her native El Banco Magdalena. She often returned from there with fish for her home and ended up selling them among her close friends. From that moment on it has gone very well for her. She works with her spouse and her goal is to increase her merchandise and sales. Maria is young and very dynamic. She currently sells fish in bulk in the market plaza, but she also generates income selling varied merchandise from her home. She currently brings the fish from El Banco Magdaleno, but recently she has found a way to buy it that is more economical if she were able to bring it from Zapatoca, a municipality in the department of Cesár. This is her objective in requesting her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo--that her husband will be able to travel directly to this location and do direct business, which will benefit her and her customers in terms of price and quality. This investment would be successful because Holy Week is approaching, a time when sales of this product increase because many people don't eat red meat on certain days, so fish forms part of the diet of many families that preserve this tradition.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma C. is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Corrales, a part of the municipality of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Elma runs a general store from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Elma is just starting this business.

In 2011, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from GDMPC, of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 29 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, convive con Tomas de 30 años, fruto de esa relación tiene 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la ciudad de Santa Rosa. El trabajo al que Aydee se dedica, es el arar la tierra; en su parcela posee plantas de cacao, café, barbasco  y hojas de coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, sale a trabajar hacía sus fincas en compañía de su pareja, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá parar cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Ella vende sus productos en los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudades de San Francisco, Kimbiri y santa rosa, puesto que es donde mejores precios percibe por sus granos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales donde es el proceso final para  luego comercializarlos. Aydee necesita el préstamo para comprar abonos naturales y fertilizantes químicos para mejorar sus cosechas. En adelante, espera adquirir nuevas tierras para así tener mayores ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará abono natural como: guanos de isla y estiércol de animales y a la vez fertilizantes químicos para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Aydee is 29 years old.  She is from Santa Rosa district and lives with her partner, 30 year-old Tomas.  They have three children and live in their own home which is located in the town of Santa Rosa.

Aydee's business is working her land.  On her land she has cacao, coffee, barbasco and coca leaf plants.  Every day, very early in the morning, she goes out to work on her farm together with her partner as she knows that she depends on the money she makes from her produce to cover her household expenses.  Aydee sells her produce to the warehouses in the towns of San Francisco, Kimbiri and Santa Rosa since this is where she makes the most money for her grains and coca leaf.

What Aydee most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since that is when she feels that the months of hard work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for eight years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops from the farm to the drying areas where they undergo their final process before they are sold.  

Aydee needs this loan to buy natural manure and chemical fertilizers to improve her harvests.  In the future, she hopes to acquire more land so that she can make more income.  This is her fifth loan from MFP and she says that this loan will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  Aydee is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy natural manures such as guano and animal dung, and also chemical fertilizers, in order to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy guano and fertilizers

loans.name: Wilmore Antonio

texts.es: Wilmore Antonio tiene 50 años, se dedica a la venta de accesorios, lubricantes para vehículos y repuestos para teléfonos. Hace más de 22 años que tiene este negocio, es asistido por él personalmente ya que siempre está buscando como brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio. A pesar que Wilmore es hombre de avanzada edad, está plenamente lleno de sueños y metas que dice él aún no culmina. Desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello trabaja día con día con la esperanza y fe puesta en Dios que algún día lo logrará. El crédito lo invertirá en insumos como  compra de llantas, espejos, tapizado, radios, lubricantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Wilmore Antonio is 50 years old.  He sells vehicle accessories and lubricants and spare parts for telephones.  He has been in this business for more than 22 years.  He serves in his business himself since he is always looking for ways to provide his customers with the best service possible.

In spite of the fact that Wilmore is a man who is getting on in years, he is full of dreams and goals that he says he still hasn't fulfilled.  He would like to be able to improve his quality of life and, for that reason, he works every day with hope and faith in God that some day he will achieve this.  WIlmore will invest his loan in buying supplies such as tires, mirrors, upholstery, radios, lubricants, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, mirrors, upholstery, radios, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 48 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest son and daughter are students while his youngest son attends public school. He supports his family by operating a meat trading business with help from his wife. He is a professional accountant. He worked as an accountant. 

Enkhbold started his meat trading business in 2006. Now he has 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital and he supplies beef tongue and prime beef loin to 24 restaurants. He purchases beef from herders. With this loan of 2,000,000 MNT, he will purchase a large amount of beef from herders during this period when prices are lower.

Enkhbold wants to expand his business and be able to support his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beef

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea forma parte del Banco comunal “El Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a la orfebrería, trabajo artístico realizado sobre utensilios o adornos de metales preciosos, o aleaciones de ellos, mezcla sólida homogénea de metales. Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 25 años, ya que su padre ha practicado éste oficio toda su vida, por lo que también ha sido heredado, además su padre cuenta con su propio taller y joyería. Po lo que Andrea aprovecha de fabricar su artesanía en éste taller, para lo cual debe comprar el gas y oxigeno para fundir los metales.
A Andrea le va muy bien en éste negocio, tiene  bastante clientela frecuente, entre estos se encuentran trabajadores de los hospitales y consultorios. 
Con el crédito comprará metales como oro y plata, además de pagar el gas y oxigeno que utiliza en el taller de su padre. 
Sus metas son tener su propio taller y joyería, para fabricar y vender sus productos. Además anhela comprarse una camioneta para el traslado de mercadería y maquinarias. Junto con esto pretende incursionar en otro rubro que también le permita generar otros ingresos, éste rubro sería el de producción y venta de comida para los almuerzos de algunos obreros de la construcción, lugar donde trabaja su marido.
Andrea vive junto a su madre, su marido y sus tres hijos de 18 años, 9 años y 3 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, que ésta sea más confortable. Además pretende dejar su negocio como herencia a sus hijos. 
Andrea está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha servido para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con las demás socias, existe mucho respeto en el grupo.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Andrea is part of the communal bank "El Progreso" and lives in the communal area of Independencia in the city of Santiago. She works in artistic metalworking, creating utensils and adornments out of precious metals and alloys - a solid mix of several metals. She has worked in this area for 25 years, inheriting the skill from father who has been practicing the craft all his life. Her father has his own workshop and jewelery store. Andrea takes advantage of this workshop to create her  handcrafted articles, so she must pay for the gas and oxygen used to work the metals.

This business is going very well for Andrea. She has quite a few frequent clients, including workers from the hospitals and medical centers. With this loan she will buy metals like gold and silver and pay for the gas and oxygen she uses in her father's workshop.

Her goals are to have her own workshop and jewelery store to make and sell her products. Also she hopes to buy a van to move her merchandise and machinery. Along with this she also plans to begin work in another area that will allow her to generate more income. This will be the production and sale of meals for the lunches of some of the construction workers from her husband's workplace.

Andrea lives with her mother and her husband and their three children - 18, 9, and 3 years old. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her children so they can be more comfortable. She also hopes to leave her business as an inheritance for her children.

Andrea is pleased and grateful for the credit provided by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. Regarding the meetings with the other members, there is a great deal of respect in the group.

Independencia is one of the 34 municipalities that make up the city of Santiago (capitol of Chile), located in the center-north sector. It grew around the end of the 19th century as a traditional area of the city. Its main axis is Independence Avenue, the old route of the ancient Road of the Inca and the northern entrance to the city of Santiago. Given its abundant indigenous population the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile is located here. Independencia also boasts of important historic constructions, including six historic monuments of Chile.

loans.use: buy metals like gold and silver and pay for the gas and oxygen she uses in her father's workshop.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine was born in 1991 and is married to Mr. Gilbert Yem. They live in Elemighong and is blessed with one child who is below the age of fifteen. They live in a two-room house with three persons per room. Celestine had her first loan in 2009 which she used to start a business buying and selling beans.

Celestine is requesting a second loan to purchase more beans to sell and also to do farming in the Elemighong neighborhood. Her personal contribution to her business is 25,000 FCFA . She thinks her business will succeed since there is a high demand for the items she sells in the market and because of her willingness to do the business. This trade will help the community since she buys beans in and around the neighborhood to take to the market. 

Celestine has faced some challenges in her life, such as not having been educated because her father was unable to do so. What she hates thinking about is the death of her brother. She will use the profit from this loan to send her child to school and to assist her family with other problems. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it makes her work hard to become rich one day if she abides to GHAPE rules and because repayments can be made bit by bit. 

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy beans for resale and seedlings for farming

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins. Gaudiosa has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from dried fish sales. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Baltazar Vidal

texts.es: Baltazar Vidal de 36 años de edad, reside en su hogar con su esposa, una hija de 6 años y un hijo de 10 meses. Baltazar es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, ya que con muchos esfuerzos ha hecho crecer una pequeña tiendita en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad como: huevos, azúcar, arroz, leche, golosinas, etc. para él su familia lo es todo y es la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día para darles todo lo que se merecen. Su sueño es ver a sus hijas en mejores condiciones y darles el estudio para que logren ser profesionales. Para poder cumplir su sueño necesita seguir manteniendo activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito con la esperanza que de esta manera logrará lo que tanto desea. Con el crédito espera comprar diversidad de productos como: azúcar, huevos, aceite, arroz, leche, golosinas, frijoles, papel, etc. Para poder surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Baltazar Vidal is 36 years old and lives together with his wife, his 6 year-old daughter and his 10 month-old son.  Baltazar is a hard-working and entrepreneurial man.  With a lot of effort, he has managed to grow his small store where he sells a range of basic household products such as eggs, sugar, rice, milk, candies, etc.  For Baltazar, his family means everything and they are the reason why he works hard every day, so that he can provide them with everything they deserve.  His dream is to provide his children with better living conditions and an education so that they can become professionals.  In order to achieve his dream, he needs to keep his business running for a lot longer since it is his main source of income.

Baltazar took the decision to request this loan with the hope that it will help him to achieve what he wishes for so much.  He hopes to use the loan to buy a variety of products such as sugar, eggs, oil, rice, milk, candies, beans, paper, etc. to stock his store so that he can offer his customers a variety of products.  In this way, he hopes to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, oil, rice, milk, candies, beans, paper, etc.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with seven children, five girls and two boys. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of buying and selling cows. She faces the major challenge of fluctuations in price at the market. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase one cow and pay transport charges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and pay transport charges.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en: Jemma works hard to support her family. Jemma is married and has a trisikad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines. Jemma requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment. Jemma has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jemma would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a single man who owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

For the past nine month he has operated business of driving a boda boda (motorcycle). His potential customers are passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. Especially during rainy season, it becomes difficult for her to operate. He dreams of purchasing his own motorcycle in the future.

With the KES 15,000 he wants to renovate his house and purchase 1000 blocks. He decided to join Yehu to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his house and purchase 1000 blocks.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 55 years old and is a married woman with 8 children. The oldest child is 39 years old and the youngest is 15.

Lily is a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. Lily's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Lily runs their sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods and shampoo. Lily also makes sure her family has food on the table and that her children are healthy.

Lily has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds. In the future, she hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 60 years old and a married man who has three children. At his age, he still enjoys raising pigs for fattening because he would like to send his children into higher levels of education.

Domingo had been engaged in the hog raising business for 20 years and he is grateful because he is able to maintain his business through the income he obtained.

He would like to ask for additional capital in the amount of 15,000 PHP to be use in buying three piglets and a supply of feed for his livestock business. He hopes that he could obtain this amount to further increase his profit for the education of his two children. He would be thankful if he could improve his business and their standard way of living.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and feed for his livestock business

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata tiene 44 años, está casada y tiene 04 hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en su propia casa, ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Rosa. El trabajo al que se dedica es el de cultivar cacao, café y plantas de barbasco, cuyos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado y gracias a ello ha logrado sostener económicamente a su familia y cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Es así que cada mañana le ofrece los cuidados a sus plantas, ya que de ello depende para obtener una producción de calidad. Tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde comercializa sus productos. En adelante espera sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con terrenos sin cultivar. Este será su octavo crédito con MFP, y afirma que será cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, contratará jornaleros para que la ayuden en sacar la maleza de entre sus plantas y cosechar.
texts.en:
Honorata is 44 years old. She’s married and has 4 children under her care. They live together in her house, located in the city of Santa Rosa.  She cultivates cacao, coffee, and barbasco root (a native plant). These products have a high demand in the market. Thanks to this, she has been able to financially sustain her family  and cover her children’s educational costs. 

Every morning,  she takes care of her plants to have a high-quality crop. She has been farming for 20 years and considers it very difficult to carry her crop to the city of San Francisco, where she sells her produce. In the future, she hopes to sow more cacao plants, since she has more land that could be farmed.

This will be Honorata’s eighth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP) and she confirms that she will pay her installments. She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles to hire day laborers to help her remove the weeds from her plants and with the harvest.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is a 41-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 18, 17 and 15. She sells dried fish for a living, earning about 4,000 PHP per month. Concordia also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at her town's market.

Concordia has requested a loan to buy pig feed and more fish to sell. She hopes for her ventures to prosper. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more fish to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells motorbikes, bicycles and spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits, buy a plot of land for his family, and pay for his kids' school fees. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to transition into a wholesale business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is 49 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is married with five children aged 19, 17, 14, 11 and eight years, respectively. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past 21 years and has a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Kamene will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits to add to her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and continue with the green grocer business which will help her improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits to add to her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, nuevamente se decidió a  tener otro crédito, porque tiene el plan de incrementar sus ventas y tener más clientes, para esto comprara  mercadería como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, el propósito de él es ofrecer a sus clientes  variedad saisfaciendo sus gustos y demandas.
Los financiamientos anteriores le han ayudado a ampliar su negocio, tener más clientela, este avance le permitió mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en: Miguel decided once again to have a loan because he plans to increase sales and have more customers.  To do so, he will buy merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, blouses and underwear aiming to have more variety available to offer his customers meeting their demand and particular tastes.  Previous loans have helped him expand the business, to have more clientele and this advance helped him improve his family’s economic condition.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
SONIA'S GROUP Está conformado por cinco mujeres responsables y trabajadoras que quieren el bienestar de sus familias. En este grupo la persona que preside es Sonia le han elegido porque es una mujer con grandes aspiraciones además es sociable, cariñosa y amistosa. Sonia tiene 28 años vive en Salcedo con su esposo y sus tres hijos.

Sonia trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos blancos para engorde y venta. Es la primera vez que le solicita un crédito a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de crías de cerdos blancos para su crianza y engorde lo cual le generará más ventas y buenos ingresos que le permitirá mantener y dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran criadero de cerdos y ver a sus hijos ser profesionales.

Las demás personas del grupo se dedican a sembrar y cocechar, el crédito les ayudará a comprar semillas y abono para que su producción sea excelente y puedan tener buenos ingresos y de esa manera puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
SONIA'S GROUP is made up of five responsible and hard-working women who want their families to do well. The group leader is Sonia. She was chosen because she is a woman with great aspirations, and is sociable, kind, and friendly. Sonia is 28 and lives in Salcedo with her husband and three children.
Sonia works alone, raising white pigs for fattening and later sale. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Fodemi. She will invest it in the purchase of young white pigs for raising and fattening. This will generate her more sales and a better income, which will allow her to support her family and give her children an education.
Her dream is to be able to have a large pig farm, and for her children to be professionals.
The other  group members are farmers. This loan will help them to buy seeds and fertilizer so that they have an excellent harvest and are able to make a good income, thus improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young white pigs for raising and fattening.

loans.name: Lizeth Amparo

texts.es: La señora Lizeth no esta casada pero tiene una hija, es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus papas, tiene una tienda de barrio en el domicilio de sus papas donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad como también variedad de productos de belleza como  cosméticos, ella estudia una carrera universitaria donde también ofrece los productos de belleza a todos sus amigos en general. La tienda de barrio es muy conocida en el lugar debido a que no hay mas tiendas en el barrio y también porque es una tienda muy surtida, la Sra., Lizeth, con el dinero del crédito comprar mercadería para su tienda como refrescos y dulces como también productos de belleza que se encuentran de promoción, La Sra. Lizeth se sacrifica mucho ya que estudia y trabaja, con mucho esmero para darle una vida mejor a su hijita ya que esta es la única actividad que tiene para sacar a su hijita adelante, su deseo es el de poder terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesion y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Lizeth is a single mother with one daughter, and she lives with her parents. She runs a corner store out of her parents home where they sell staple products and cosmetics. She is also studying at university and sells beauty products to her fellow students. Her corner store is well known in the area because there are not other options in the neighborhood, and it is well-stocked. Mrs. Lizeth will use the loan money to increase the inventory for her store like soft drinks, sweets, and cosmetics, which are currently on sale. Lizeth makes great sacrifices to both work and study and provide a better life for her daughter. Her dream is to complete her university studies, work as a professional, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her shop like soft drinks, sweets, and beauty products.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a garment worker while her husband, Sopheng, is a construction worker. They have been married for five years and have one young daughter. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophorn is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Reuy's Group

texts.en:
Reuy is 50 years old, married, and has four dependent children. Three of her children are working in Thailand while the last one is still in school. Reuy is a farmer who has been farming on her rice field for more than ten years to earn her living in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district. To better feed her family, she supplements her income by raising pigs and selling rice soup to raise additional income. Now she earns around ten U.S. dollars per day from her business and saves around four U.S. dollars per day. 

Having been with VisionFund for six loan cycles, Reuy leads a group of six female members who have also been with VisionFund from one year to seven years. They are applying for another loan, as a group. She wants to use the entire loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crops. This loan will enable her to make more rice and she hopes to make good income and set aside some money to afford a bigger house. She also wants keep her fourth child in schooling.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her rice crops.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is a 52-year-old married man who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business for 6 years. Teofilo is able to provide for his family through his business. He requested this loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

In the future, Teofilo hopes to have a progressive business. He also desires for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children. She also takes care of additional family members.She has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for three years and works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income from farming. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to increase her sales so as to expand her capital base. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio es Felizmente  Casado, de profesión Productor Agropecuario actividad que ejerce desde sus ancestros quienes lo enseñaron a trabajar de esa manera,  tiene 47 años de realizar dicha actividad, legado que le ha dejado a sus hijos con los que han ido trabajando a la par de él y hoy algunos ya son independientes.
Desde que inicio su negocio El señor Julio lo que es la Agricultura en pequeñas areas  se esforzó por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es la Crianza de Ganado tanto de leche como para el trabajo agrícola, siendo las ambas de gran fortaleza económica tradicional desde sus padres y de esa manera mantener su familia la que es independiente por su propia cuenta y hoy vivir la vejez de manera satisfactoria y realizada con sus hijos formados con sus familias propias, además tiene un area de bosques las que tiene de manera  organizada una de la necesidad es la compra de  medicamentos y consulta medica ya que se encuentra enfermo con un virus  que andada dando para s mejorar su salud
texts.en: Julio is happily married and works as a farmer.  He learned the business from his ancestors. He has worked for 47 years in this line of work, a legacy that he has left to his children who have worked alongside him. Some of his children are now independent. Since Julio started his business, he has worked hard to improve his farming business and also start another business, raising cattle, both for producing milk and for farm work. Both of his businesses have traditionally been of great financial help since his parents' time. In this way he has supported his family, which is independent, and now he can live his old age in a satisfactory and fulfilled way, with his children grown and with their own families. Julio also owns an area of woodland. One of his needs is to purchase medicine and a medical exam in order to improve his health now that he finds himself ill with a virus.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her peanut butter business.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.en:
Freddy has a small farm on land that was given to him by his parents. He has been a farmer his whole life and only has a elementary education. He and his wife, Maria, work on the farm where they cultivate rice and produce milk. They do not have children yet because they do not have financial security. He hopes that in the near future he will be able to make his land be more efficient so he can build his family.

The Primero de Agosto Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Freddy is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank. All bank members are part of the Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia, and they will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Maria Estanislada

texts.en:
I’ve been selling clothes and domestic appliances for 2 years within my community. This business helped me to buy my medications and help my family with monthly expenditures. In my country, it is impossible to find a job when someone is old as I am, therefore this business is my way to earn my living.

I need now to buy more products because I have several orders from my clients. I need your help to do these purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Arnaud Braud, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 2 años que me dedico a la venta de ropa y electrodomesticos en mi comunidad. Este negocio me ha ayudado para comprar mis medicinas y ayudar mi familia con los gastos de consumo mensual. A mi edad es imposible encontrar un trabajo en mi pais, asi que este negocio es mi sustento de vida.

Ahora necesito comprar mas productos ya que tengo varios pedidos de mis clientes. Ahora necesito la ayuda de ustes para poder hacer estas compras.

loans.use: To buy clothes (blouses, skirts, nightdresses, pants etc…)

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en:
Sefulu L.’s family is one of those families evolving out of deep poverty with no proper house as yet. She joined us last month and she is one of the ladies who really needs our help. With no access to loans from other banks, Sefulu is using every opportunity to support the SPBD programme which is her only hope of getting credit to improve her micro-business prospects.

As you can see in the picture, Sefulu’s cabbages will soon be ready to be picked and brought to the market, at which point she must have more under cultivation. She has three kids who are not yet in school, and she is dealing with feeding and taking care of them.

Sefulu is hard-working and she is willing to extend and improve her business in the future for more income for her family.

loans.use: Buy cabbage seeds, spades, knives and a crowbar

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: I am Noreen A.. My husband works at a local steel factory for a meagre pay that is insufficient for us to manage our day to day expenses. Thus, in order to better meet the expenses and send the children to school I started a jewelry business. I get artificial jewelry from the local wholesale market on order and embed required gems in it. I am able to get three to four orders a month and for every order I get a profit of $35. I want to expand my business and buy a machine on which jewelry is made. This way I will no longer have to work for someone else and my profits will increase significantly. With the increased profits I hope to change the current school and send my children to a better one.

loans.use: Buy a jewelry machine

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: I moved to Vehari, a small town near a fairly large and industrial city of Faisalabad, after I got married 10 years ago. I have four small children all of whom are in school except the youngest one who will hopefully start next year. I need $200 to purchase a Rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) so that I can drive around the city. There isn’t much public transport available in the city so it would be easy for me to obtain business.

loans.use: Purchase rickshaw

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru:
Habibullo H. is married with three children and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has been a Microinvest client since September 2007. Habibullo owns a small souvenir sore. In the days leading up to New Year's (traditional for giving presents in Tajikistan), he drew in many clients and now has a rapid turnover. He wants a loan to increase the quantity of goods sold, with the goal of increasing his profits.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холматов Хабибулло,женат имеет 3 детей,проживает в городе Душанбе,Таджикистан.В Микроинвесте был зарегистрирован в сентябре 2007 года.Он является владельцем одного маленького сувенирного магазина.В предновогодние дни он привлек огромное количество клиентов и сейчас имеет быстрый оборот товаров. Он хочет получить на увеличение количества товаров с целью получения больше прибыли.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sadiah

texts.en: Sadiah, 58, is married to A. and has one child. To help support her family, she sells coconut rice, fried snacks, cakes, and other foods door to door around the villages. She earns $15 a day. She has joined MBK and would like a loan of $100 to increase her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for snack foods sold door to door

loans.name: Nhom Chi Yen- Vong Nguyet - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Yen, 39 years old, is the president of her town's women's union. Not only a frequent participant of community activity, she is also a very good worker. She took out a loan before with Binh Minh CDC to breed poultry. The income was used to help out the family as well as pay for her children's schooling. Her family's earning is roughly 130000 Dong per day. Mrs. Cuc need this loan to buy breed-pigs. Mrs. Thao would like to take out a loan to buy foodstuff for her farrow of ducks while Mrs. Tam need money to buy more hens. Similarly, Mrs. Toan and Mrs. Binh both need money to buy cattle-feed while Mrs. Hue is going to use this money to open a bicycle repair shop. Mrs. Xuan will help her husband with breeding pig. Last but not least, Mrs. Viet would like to start her own recycling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Yến, 39 tuổi là đội trưởng phụ nữ của thôn. Chị không những làm công tác xã hội tốt mà còn là một người tăng gia sản xuất giỏi. Chi vay 2006000đồng từ chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc để chăn nuôi gà tạo thu nhập cho gia đình, phục vụ hai con đang đi học. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 130000đồng/ngày. Chị Cúc vay để mua lợn giống. Chị Thảo vay để mua cám cho đàn vịt đẻ trứng. Chị Tám vay vốn để mua gà tăng gia sản xuất. Chị Toàn vay vốn để mua cám cho lợn. Chị Huệ vay vốn để mở cửa hàng sửa chữa xe đạp. Chị Xuân vay vốn cho chồng ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Bình vay để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Việt vay để mua bán đồ sắt vụn.

loans.use: Mua cám chăn nuôi, đi chợ đồng nát, mở cửa hiệu

loans.name: Rehema's Sisikwasisi Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 31 years old and is a widow with 1 child, age 11 years old. Rehema owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $245 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Scolastica, who has a businesses dealing in soap, sugar and shoe selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
The members of the Hard-working communal bank are natives of the town of Santiago of Atitlan. The people of Santiago of Atitlan are very traditional. They preserve their culture even today. As can be seen in the photo, the women dress with the typical suit of the area that consists of a blouse or embroidered dress, a short or long skirt, a cinch or strap and a perraje or scarf. In many towns the tradition is no longer seen so well preserved as in Santiago.

Another interesting aspect of the town where these women live is that some years ago the population was harshly affected by Hurricane Stan. On that occasion, due to the storm, the town was cut off; the roadways were completely closed and the people went for a long time without access to drinking water and fresh food.

Santiago of Atitlan is a town touched by the art. There are many jewelers, weavers, designers and painters at present living in this area. Inside the “Workers” group all the associates work with weavings. Half of the group works weaving embroidered dresses in looms that are tied at one end to their waist. The waist loom technique has passed down from generation to generation. The majority of women begin to learn to weave before the age of ten years approximately.

The other half of the group do embroidery. As can be seen in the photo they make designs of flowers and birds. The time that it takes a woman to embroider an embroidered dress depends exclusively on the work. For example, an embroidered dress that is completely embroidered such as that of the third lady from the left can take three months, while an embroidered dress that is not embroidered entirely like that of the first lady on the right can take an artisan from three to four weeks. The profits can vary from 15 dollars to fifty dollars, depending on the embroidered dress.

Competition is very tough in Santiago due to the high number of artisans, nevertheless these women can do well. The loan is a very useful tool that they can utilize to invest in their business and to make it more profitable since they can buy the thread wholesale or hire labor. If we support them, we are going to give them the opportunity to be noticed and to do well. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Las integrantes del banco comunal Trabajadoras son oriundas del pueblo Santiago de Atitlan. La gente de Santiago de Atitlan es muy tradicional, ellos hasta el día de hoy preservan su cultura. Como se puede ver en la foto, las mujeres están vestidas con el traje típico del área que consiste en la blusa o huipil, corte o falda larga, cincho o correa y un perraje o bufanda. En muchos pueblos ya no se ve la tradición tan preservada como en Santiago.

Otro aspecto interesante del pueblo donde habitan estas mujeres es que hace unos años la población fue duramente afectada por la tormenta Stan. En dicha ocasión, debido a la tormenta el pueblo estuvo aislado, las vias de tránsito estaban completamente clausuradas y la gente estuvo por mucho tiempo sin acceso a agua potable y a comida fresca.

Santiago de Atitlan es un pueblo tocado por el arte. Hay muchos joyeros, tejedores, diseñadores y pintores actualmente viviendo en esta área. Dentro del grupo las Trabajadoras todas las clientas trabajan con tejidos. La mitad del grupo trabaja tejiendo huipiles en telares de cintura. La técnica de telar de cintura se ha pasado de generación en generación. La mayoría de mujeres empiezan ha aprender a tejer antes de los diez años aproximadamente.

La otra mitad del grupo son bordadoras. Como se puede ver en la foto ellas tienden a bordar flores y aves. El tiempo que toma una mujer en bordar un huipil depende exclusivamente del trabajo. Por ejemplo, un huipil que está completamente bordado como el de la tercera señora contando desde la izquierda puede demorar hasta tres meses, mientras que un huipil que no está bordado enteramente como el de la primera señora contando desde la derecha puede tomarle a una artesana de tres a cuatro semanas. Las ganancias pueden variar entre 15 dólares a cincuenta dólares, dependiendo del huipil.

La competencia es muy dura en Santiago debido al alto número de artesanas, sin embargo estas mujeres pueden salir adelante. El crédito es una herramienta muy útil que ellas pueden utilizar para invertir en su negocio y hacerlo más rentable ya que pueden comprar el hilo por mayor o contratar mano de obra. Si nosotros las apoyamos vamos a darles la oportunidad a destacarse y salir adelante. ¡Apoyémoslas!

loans.use: To buy thread wholesale and hire labor for their business making traditional embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Mean Oun Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mean O. lives in Samrith Chey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is the leader of a six-person business group. Mrs. Mean O. is a mat maker and her husband, Mr. Leang Meas, is a fisherman. He doesn't have enough fishing equipment for his fishing business. In order to improve her husband's business, Mrs. Mean O. needs to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets for his business.

Previously, Mrs. Mean O. has obtained a loan from AMK to start her mat business. Mrs. Mean O. is 40 years old and is the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while five others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fish nets for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Makhammad

texts.en: Makhammad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Djabrayil region. He is married and settled with his 2 children in the Absheron region. He is a history teacher at school. He has been in the history tutoring business for 11 years. Now he  is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Mariama Bagna

texts.fr:
Mariama Bagna D. is 36 years old and cares for four children. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian village bank for six and a half years, and deals in dyed thioub fabric and palm oil. In her desire to improve the standard of living, health and education of her children, she has requested a loan that would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariama Bagna D., 36 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des thioubs (tissus teintés) et des effets de toilette dans une cantine. Elle commercialise aussi de l’huile de palme. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Buying and selling thioub dyed fabric and palm oil

loans.name: Doem

texts.en: This is the second time Mr. Doem O. has taken a loan in order to improve his living conditions. He is a fisherman in Preak Svay Village in Kandal Province. He is a 39-year-old widower with three children who are all attending the local school. Since his family is in poor conditions, Mr. Doem O. decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets for breeding in order to meet the needs of his family. Previously, Mr. Doem O. obtained a loan to buy fish nets for his current business. He has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en:
Wahab M. is 41 years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions and frozen foods. In order for her to cut costs and increase profit, Wahab travels to the Republic of Benin to buy frozen foods, a journey of about and hour and a half by car.

Wahab is a LAPO client and has been running her business for the past six years. She needs a loan for $700 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent S. is 42 years old. He is married and the father of two children who are currently in school. He has been in the furniture and interior decoration business for eighteen years. He is a specialist in dining sets, beds, upholstered chairs, kitchen decoration etc. His experience, skills and designs are first-class. He gives his customers a new look in their homes, offices, and kitchens. He hopes to increase his savings to provide his children with quality educations. He is a member of the community group called Saamu, which means "Receiving Group." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of furniture and upholstery materials.

loans.name: Rafaela Leonor

texts.es:
La muchacha Rafaela Leonor Z. Téllez tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada esta Joven tiene 3 hijos su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 11 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria, su otro hijo 7 años esta cursando el 1 grado de primaria y su niña de 2 años que no estudia su compañero de vida labora como cobrador de transporte, sus deseos y sueños de esta joven es de mantener su negocio activo por lo que la situación en el país esta totalmente muy  inestatable, y en sus deseos esta el obtener una mejor vida para ella y sus hijos y en  por eso busca el medio de mantener a sus hijos por lo que trabaja en la empresa ARNECOM  y agradece a la Fundación león 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.




El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 8 años, la actividad económica a la que ella que se dedica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos como lo es: pantalón, short, camisa cremas y  perfumes, ella inicia este negocio  por cuenta propia con la venta de perfumes por lo que decidió incrementar su producción de venta en productos como lo es: venta de oro laminado, perfumes y el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de la variedad de productos por los días festivos que ya se aproximan y así ofrecerá a sus clientes una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Rafaela Leonor Z. Téllez is 34 years old and married. This young woman has three children. Her oldest son is 11 years old and in his first year of secondary school. Her second son is seven years old and in the first year of primary school. Her daughter is two years old. Rafaela's husband works as a bus driver. Since she was a child, Rafaela has dreamed of maintaining an active business, given that the situation in the country is very unstable. Rafaela would like to obtain the best life possible for herself and her children. Because of this she searches for a means of maintaining her children, which is why she works in ARNECOM, and why she thanks the Fundación león 2000 and its partner organizations. Rafaela has had this organization for eight years. She sells clothing and cosmetics such as shorts, shirts, creams, and perfumes. Rafaela began this business by selling perfumes on her own. She decided to increase her sales by adding products such as gold jewelry and perfumes. The loan is for Rafaela to buy a variety of products for the upcoming holidays, so that she can offer her clients a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. A. is a 28-year old woman who lives in Rongo, Kenya, where she runs a poultry business. She raises the chickens at her residence and sells them from a chicken coop stand near the Rongo matatu stage. (Matatus are large vans that function as buses, so a matatu stage is similar to a bus station.)

Originally, Christine raised poultry for domestic use, as food for her husband and herself. When she discovered that there is a high demand in the area for poultry, Christine decided to make what was a side project into a major business. Christine employs one woman to help sell the chickens. Local restaurants are her main customers, though individual consumers are also strong buyers.

A large cock will sell for around 600 Schillings while a medium one will sell for 300. The poultry business is booming and Christine can barely keep up with demand, selling about 30 chickens in a day. She wants to be able to expand into a bigger business, with a bigger coop and more chickens. Christine is requesting a loan of $150 USD in order to expand her current chicken coop and purchase more poultry. It is cheaper to raise the animals rather than purchase them, so she wants to be sure to have enough chickens in order to be able to be selling a large amount, while still producing enough eggs to raise chicks from.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and to expand chicken coop

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: S. Annet is the member of Kisimba in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted lady with a drugstore business selling medicines like panadols, anti-malarial syrups and tablets, in the service of the people in her locality. She has been in her lending group for 5 years and her reason for joining was to boost her drugstore's business. With her profits, Annet has been able to buy 2 cows that produce milk, a number of goats including young ones, plus a bicycle that she uses to collect grass for her animals. She has a plan of buying a plot of land, once she is able to accumulate enough savings. Her children are able to go to school and she is happy with where she is now. She needs a loan to help with buying more medicines, syringes, needles, cotton wool and others items to restock her store.

loans.use: To buy more medicines, syringes, needles, cotton wool and other items for restocking her drugstore.

loans.name: Emma Estela

texts.es:
Emma tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, nació en un municipio del país, localizado a 40 kilómetros de la ciudad de Guatemala.  Empezó su negocio de venta de artículos de primera necesidad hace 4 años cuando se traslado a vivir a una comunidad de las orillas de la ciudad de Guatemala.  Cuando ella comenzó su negocio, no había otro negocio en su comunidad, por lo que el mismo era muy importante para los vecinos de dicho lugar.  Ella comenzó vendiendo frutas y verduras, luego vendió pan, arroz, fríjol y otros productos de consumo diario.  Su negocio ha ido creciendo a medida que las ganancias se lo permiten, ahora vende además algunas herramientas que se necesitan en dicho lugar, tales como clavos y palas.

Emma necesita el préstamo para surtir más su tienda, ya que sus clientes le demandas más productos.  Ella confía que el préstamo le ayudara mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Emma is 56 years old and married. She was born in a small rural town, about 40 km from Guatemala City. She began her current business selling groceries and basic consumer goods 4 years ago, when she moved from the countryside to one of Guatemala City's suburbs. She began selling fruit and vegetables and then later, bread, rice, beans and other daily necessities. When she started this business, it was the only one like it in her community and because of this, her business became a very important one in that neighbourhood. Over the years, Emma's store has slowly grown larger and today, she even sells some tools commonly needed in the community, like nails and shovels. Emma needs this loan so that she can further expand the range of products on offer in her store, just like her clients have asked her to do. She is confident that this loan will be a great help.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy goods for her store

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar M. Akram Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is a 31-year-old married woman and a citizen of a Borewala, Pakistan for the past 16 years. Naseem baji is an uneducated lady because she belonged to a poor family and her parents couldn’t bear her educational expenses. Naseem baji is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education because Naseem baji wants to give her children all the things that she didn’t get. Her wish gives her strength to move ahead and work for it. She has a buffalo and she gets milk from it and than goes to the milk shops to sell the milk. She earns the required income and can easily pay the school fees for her children. Naseem baji is the wife of M. A., who runs a grocery shop in the community. People used to come to him to buy groceries. She successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Razia baji would like a loan to buy paint for her paint shop. Ameena baji would like a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Zahida baji would like a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.
