Tasleem akhtar baji would like a loan to pay off the remaining installments for her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Суярова Диляфруз проживает в районе Джилликуль. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет среднее образование. Работает в магазине "Ориеи" , который находиться в центре района. Работает в сфере бизнеса уже три года. Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот  , она планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilafruz S. lives in the area around Jilikul. She is married and has two children. She has a high school education. She works in a shop called “Oriei,” which is in the central part of the region. She has worked in business for three years. To increase her sales, she plans to take out a loan for twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Suluaiman

texts.en: Suluaiman I. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He has a business center where he makes photocopies and does spiral binding, laminating and typesetting for his customers.  He is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase one photocopier and a computer. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more one photocopier and a computer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes E. started her sari-sari store business with the very minimal capital of 5,000 PHP. Her customers are neighbors, friends and relatives. She is 44-years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lourdes is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. Three of them are working already, one is married and the last is still studying.

Last July, 2008, she became a member of Paglaum MPC and now she is able to acquire additional capital for her business. She is coping well with the challenges. It requires hard work and patience. Her aspiration is to have a bigger store and to be able to sell farm fertilizers and feeds.

loans.use: Additional capital for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86588&_tpos=14&_tpg=2
Amelia es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas.
Amelia  es casada tiene 45 años, tres hijos de 24, 18 y 13 años, el ultimo está estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Amelia  trabaja en el cafetín de una empresa dando desayuno desde hace cinco años.
Amelia necesita un préstamo de  1800 soles,  para azúcar, cajas de leche, embutidos, para dar desayunos.
Desde que Amelia esta en Finca agradece por los prestamos, porque puede atender mejor a su clientes, y su economía ha mejorado.
 Es sueño de Amelia es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86588&_tpos=... Amelia is a member of the community bank Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). Amelia is married and is 45 years old. She has 3 children of 24, 18, and 13 years of age. The last is studying in a state school. Amelia works in the café of a business where she has served breakfast for the past 5 years. Amelia needs a loan of 1800 soles for sugar, boxes of milk, and cold cuts for the breakfasts. Since Amelia has been with FINCA, she has been grateful for the loans, because she is able to attend better to her clients and her personal finances have improved. Amelia’s dream is that her children would become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, boxes of milk, and cold cuts for the breakfast she sells

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji J. makes a living selling groundnut paste, and has applied for this loan to buy more groundnuts to make into paste. She is 39 years old and married. Her husband is an information technology officer, and they have two children, both of whom are in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more groundnut to make into paste and sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 24 years old and sells bread in the Plaza de Armas, the main square in Urcos. She makes the bread every day at home, starting at 3 AM. She makes all types of bread, such as chuta (a typical Cusco specialty), and sells it for 5 soles a bag. On a typical day she can sell a quintal of bread, which is about 46 kg. 

Luz will use the loan to purchase sugar, butter, flour and other ingredients. Her goal is to buy a bread-making machine instead of having to use her oven. She is a member of a 44-person lending group with Asociación Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer, and also participates in the group savings account.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milicent N. was born in 1960. She is a married mother of three children. She lives with her family in Runyenjes Embu. She is the proprietor of a cereal-selling business that she initiated in 2004. Millicent’s hard work, determination and excellent skills have led to her success.  Her profits pay for the household expenses as well as secondary school fees for two of her children. She plans to use the funds from her next loan to buy more grains, particularly maize.

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Cesiloa

texts.en:
Cesiloa is a member of the Tuamke borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 49-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are 20 and 18. She also cares for 1 other dependent.

Cesiloa started her own clothing business selling clothes, 5 years ago. She works 5 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Cesiloa’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes to sell. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Cesiloa hopes to expand her business, save money, and get more food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is 25 years old and he is married with one child who is currently in school. He is a dealer in mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and service work for his customers. He says the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication.

He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests the loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories. He hopes the loan would enable him to increase savings to expand his shop. With the loan he believes he can buy assorted phones so that his customers can make a choice from them. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina J. is currently in the business of selling various hot drinks at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more wines, beers and many other drinks. Thirty-nine years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, Regina hopes to be able to build a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more wines, beers and many other drinks to sell

loans.name: Blanca Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada para su familia  procreo 7 hijos cinco mayores de edad, que trabajan y dos están estudiando, su esposo trabaja como contador y da gracias a Dios por el apoyo que su esposo ha dado a su familia, ya que muchas familias Nicaragüenses son madre soltera. Reside en el barrio Anexo Villa Fraternidad en la capital de Managua y se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, tiene ocho años administrando este negocio que inicio con fondos propios y luego otorgo con financiamiento para obtener más inventario y captar clientes nuevos. Este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara ropa, perfumé y zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos, con esto espera obtener ganancias y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios. Da las gracias a la institución por los prestamos ya que con los prestamos anteriores ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda y a si como aumentado el inventario de sus ventas. A futuro espera tener un modulo de variedad.
texts.en:
Blanca, 46, is a hard working woman who puts forth much effort for her family. She has seven children. Five of them are working adults, and two are in school. Her husband works as an accountant. She thanks God for the support her husband has given her family because many Nicaraguan families have single mothers. She lives in the Anexo Villa Fraternidad neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She sells clothes and shoes. She has been running this business, which she started with her own funds, for eight years. Later, she got financing to get more inventory and obtain new customers. This is her fifth cycle with Afodenic. She will use it to buy clothes, perfume, and shoes to offer her customers a variety of products. She expects to get income from this and help her children with their education. She is grateful to the Institution for the loans. With previous loan she has made improvements to her house and increased her sales inventory. In the future she hopes to have a stand selling a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, perfume, and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of African 'waxcloth' for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
The business activity from which Gladys makes a living is the sale of provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She started this business six years ago.

Gladys is 41 years old and married with three children. She hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Antonet

texts.en:
Selling groceries is the business activity from which Antonet makes a living. She is 33 years old and married with four children. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers in her community of Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. 

She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mrs. Mylin T. and her husband Ronnie T. of Barangay Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya, want to be successful in order to give their only son a better future. They endure many hardships in their efforts to survive.

Ronnie is a security guard in one of the companies in Solano while Mylin manages a small "sari-sari" (variety) store in their village. She sells different grocery items and snacks. She is able to earn a net income of PHP 5,000 a month, which they use to meet their daily needs; any money left over is saved to provide for the future of their son. Mylin wants to acquire more additional items to sell but her capital is not enough; consequently, she wants to borrow PHP 9,000 from the Kiva lenders to be used in acquiring the said additional items. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she can improve her small business.

loans.use: purchasing new products for her "sari-sari" (variety) store

loans.name: Port

texts.en:
Mr. Port M., age 36, is a construction foreman. He has many employees who help him to deliver his services. Port M. is married and three school-aged children. His wife, who appears with him in the photograph, is a chef for local wedding parties. 

Port M. has been very busy at his business because there being many customers who need him to build their houses, but he is still lacking the materials of construction. Because he doesn’t have money yet, he decided to ask a loan from Kiva through HKL to buy more materials so he can improve his services.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his construction business

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn A. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 36 years old. Alyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Alyn owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Alyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Alyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Alyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Tuyasaihan

texts.en: Tuyasaihan is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a "ger", which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest son, Tumendemberel, works in order to help with the family earnings. Her second daughter is in university while the other two daughters attend a local secondary school. Tuyasaihan operates a dairy product selling business in her town. She started her business in 2006 with a working capital of 80,000 tugrugs (~56 USD). After years of successful business operations she has used her savings to educate her children. Over the years she has built a great reputation among her many customers and has been able to increase her working capital to 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Tuyasaikhan attributes her success to her good accounting skills. She has many plans for the future and says, "I want to expand my business and improve our quality of life." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning T. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle possède d'une table au marché où elle vend divers produits alimentaires tels que du piment séché, des œufs frais, du sel, du poisson frais etc. Son objectif est l'achèvement de sa maison en construction.
texts.en:
Téning T. is 58 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the village bank in WALIDANE for five years and has had ten loans which she has managed well and repaid. She has a stall in the market where she sells diverse food products such as dried peppers, fresh eggs, salt, fresh fish etc. Her aim is to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her business

loans.name: Xenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La joven Xenia Díaz es Maestra de Educación Primaria desde hace 9 años y la cual tiene a su cargo a los niños de preescolar, pertenece a la Escuela los Laureles ubicada en la comarca Sirama de donde ella es originaria, ella es casada, mayor de edad y con un niño de 2 años de edad.

Expresa estar contenta con la institución Ceprodel porque le ha permitido poco a poco mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y mejorar su nivel de vida con cada uno de los créditos que se le han otorgado, hasta la fecha han sido 3 crédito, ya que ella esta con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The young Xenia D. has been an elementary school teacher for nine years and also takes care of preschool children. She works at Los Laureles school, located in the Sirama region, where she is originally from. She is married and has a 2-year-old son. She is very content with the Ceprodel institution, because it has allowed her, little by little, to improve the conditions of her home and her quality of life with each of the loans it has granted her. So far, she has received three credits, and has been with Ceprodel for two years.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement, timber, and zinc)

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn J. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Ronelyn is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Ronelyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ronelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Ronelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ronelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
-------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Like other farmers, Divina believes that proper financing is a must in farming. A 47-year-old married woman, she works hard to make her farm productive to be able to cope with the increasing needs of her household. She also joined CEVI last year to have financial support for her farm. She is thankful to have gained access to the microfinance’s program. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos. She will use this loan to acquire farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Nheth

texts.en:
Mrs. Nheth L. lives in Kor village in Kandal province. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, and the other two are students in the local school.

Mrs. Nheth L. stays at home, where she cooks and cares for her children. Her husband, Mr. Phea Pon, is a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. Because her children work far from home, Mrs. Nheth L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, married and living with his wife and three children, runs a cereals shop with one employee in his hometown to earn a living. In this business for two years, Daniel was previously employed before he ventured into his enterprise.  His wife is a business lady and together they are able to provide for their family and pay school fees for their children.  

Daniel, who hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation and improve their living standards in the future, has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of cereals.  He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious. 

(photo has been taken away from the business)

loans.use: To add stock of  cereals

loans.name: Mrs. Chroeb Chuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has nine members who live in Thmey village in Kandal province. All the members will use their loan for different purposes so that it can improve their business. 

Mrs. Chroeb C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She and her husband, Mr. Pharoum Sang, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops on to sell to support their family. They have some problems because their field has infertile soil and it is far from the irrigation system, but they do not have money to fix the problems. Thus, Mrs. Chroeb C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Marcelina's Group

texts.en:
Marcelina L. is from the village of San Mariano. She is 53 years old. Marcelina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marcelina L. Group.

Marcelina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan Marcelina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina B. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Angelina is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Angelina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and chicken

loans.name: Cristo Asencion De Rumichaca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca” actualmente se encuentra en el VIII ciclo y está conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca. La comunidad se encuentra a una hora y veinte minutos de la Cuidad del Cusco como quien se dirige a visitar las ruinas de Ollantaytambo de la ciudad de Urubamba. En cada reunión tres socias coordinan para preparar una comida para todos los integrantes del banco comunal.
      
Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta de chicha, venta de ropa, venta de arboles de eucalipto, venta de artesanía, venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y venta de hortalizas. Otros socios brindan servicios de albañilería, carpintería, transporte urbano y  empleado de un hotel. 

Ermitaña, tiene 45 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos, nació en la comunidad de Rumichaca y vive en Pintacha en Urubamba.  

Ermitaña nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca”  somos 11 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. 

Su actividad económica principal de la señora Ermitaña en la venta de chicha de jora, ella tiene una picantería que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ella empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano preparando la chicha y después empieza a vender a las 10 mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ella vende de lunes a viernes y a sus clientes le gusta lo que prepara la chicha. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ermitaña requiere el préstamo para maíz para elaborar jora y también requiere para comprar cerveza.
texts.en:
The “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca” community bank is currently in its 8th loan cycle and is made up of 11 hardworking entrepreneurs who are always looking for opportunities to grow. Through their daily work, they are building a better future for their children. The bank's meetings take place monthly in the community of Rumichaca. The community is an hour and 20 minutes from Cusco city, traveling along the same route as if you were visiting the Ollantaytambo ruins from Urubamba city. At each meeting, 3 members prepare food for the whole group. The members sell chicha, clothing, eucalyptus trees, handcrafts, groceries, and vegetables. Other members raise small livestock (guinea pigs), or provide services such as bricklaying, carpentry, public transportation, and hospitality. Ermitaña is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She was born in the community of Rumichaca and now lives in Pintacha, Urubamba. She tells us: "In my bank, Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca, there are 11 members. They have chosen me to represent the group and talk about my work." Ermitaña sells chicha de jora (fermented beverage made from yellow maize). She has runs a picantería (restaurant serving shared plates, like a Peruvian tapas restaurant) in her home. She begins to work very early each day, preparing chicha and selling it from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Ermitaña sells Monday through Friday and her customers love the chicha she makes. She has been running this business for many years and it is going well. Ermitaña needs a loan for maize and beer to make the chicha.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize and beer to make chicha de jora.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio O. is from the village of  Gingoog City. He is 60 years old. Elpedio is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elpedio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Elpedio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elpedio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elpedio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elpedio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan P. is from the village of Villaverde, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Joan is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joan owns & operates a business planting & harvesting decorative plants for sale. Joan has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.en:
Maria Natividad G. B. is 35 years old. She lives with her parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 3 children, who are ages 8, 6, and 2. 

Maria is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Maria also works in agriculture and raises pigs. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Maria plans to use the loan to raise pigs. She would like to have a larger farm within the next five years. 

She enjoys her community's festivals for the patron saint San Jose.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Johari

texts.en:
Johari (PK-10257) is a 49-year-old male living in the town of Melaya, Bali. He is married and has two school-aged children.

Johari owns and operates a business selling bamboo walls (made from the inner part of bamboo) and fences (made from the outer layer of bamboo) for housing to local community members. He has been engaged in this business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Johari joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials.

Johari is now requesting a new loan of 3,500,000 IDR which will again be used to purchase raw materials to make bamboo products. The loan will be his 2nd from MUK. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees and to save for their higher education. He hopes to expand his business, with his brother's help.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make more bamboo products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing firewood and tools

loans.name: Sapakamapie Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sapakamapie” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka town.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Salaymatu B. who is the leader of this group. Salaymatu was born in northern Sierra Leone; she is thirty-five. She is married to a seaman and the couple has six children – one in primary school, four in secondary school, and the other is not attending school.

Salaymatu who has been a businesswoman for twenty years now sells fried cakes. With this loan, she will buy bags of rice and flour to produce more cakes to sell.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and flour to produce more cakes to sell

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom A. S. is a resident of Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan that is famous for its sugar production. She has a two-room brick house there and lives in it with her family. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She not only manages her household responsibilities well, but also contributes to her family financially by selling shawls. She has adopted this part-time business to help her pay the utility bills.
 
Her husband, A. S., is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a business of selling cement. He receives orders from different construction companies and earns a profit by filling them. He has been serving his clients for the past eight years, and by providing them good quality cement he has gained their loyalty. His earning allows him to smoothly run the finances of his family.
 
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy cements packs in bulk quantity that will enable him to fulfill the orders of his customers in a timely manner.
  
Kalsoom is confident that with the help of this investment, her husband’s income will be increased and her family will be enjoy a better standard of living. 
She is a new loan applicant and hopes the loan will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy cement packs in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Four people make up this group loan. Mrs. Kong S. is a 32-year-old married woman and the group leader who was selected by the members of this group loan, located in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province.

S. earns her living by operating two business ventures:  grocery selling and compact disk selling in the local market, which allows her to earn a little income to support the family. In order to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions, S. will use the loan that she asked for from AMK to buy more groceries and more compact disks to resell. S. is a widow with two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and more compact disks to resell

loans.name: Phouk

texts.en:
Phouk L. is 56 years old and raises pigs in the village of Takeo province. She has been raising pigs since 2000, and is able to make about 2 USD in daily profit. Her husband is a musician who, on average, makes a daily profit of 2 USD as well. Phouk L.'s husband makes his highest earnings during the wedding season, which is November through May. 

Phouk L. is asking for a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Amanda Guadalupe

texts.es: Amanda Guadalupe L.  D. L., D. treinta y nueve años D. edad, resiD. en la capital del país San Salvador y vive en casa propia junto a su mamá, hermana e hija Isabel. Ella tiene instalada en su misma casa D. residencia una pequeña tienda, la que atienD. todos los días D. la semana, en la que suministra jabones, detergentes productos D. consumo diario y golosinas. Además es muy conocida por sus vecinos por dedicarse D. viernes a domingo a la venta D. pupusas a base D. maíz ó arroz que contienen en su interior: queso, frijoles, ayote y chicharrón, las que son preparadas al gusto D. los clientes; además D. antojitos típicos por las tardes D. casi todos los días, como pastelitos rellenos D. carne, enchiladas y atoles. Ella se esfuerza mucho por sacar adelante día a día  a su familia, la que se ha integrado muy bien a fin D. sacar adelante las tareas D. la casa y atender ambos negocios. Ya su hija estudia el sexto grado en el colegio, ella representa la mayor fuente D. inspiración para Amanda,  son mas D. seis años que Amanda Guadalupe tiene D. haber instalado dichos negocios y ahora ella ha podido percibir el incremento en sus ventas, su esmero, paciencia y energía positiva esta siendo recompensado, ella tiene grandes sueños y es por ello que se encuentra solicitando un crédito a Apoyo Integral con el que pretenD. tener otros productos en su tienda y mayor cantidad D. materiales para la producción D. sabrosas pupusas y antojitos típicos, a fin D. obtener mayores ganancias y asegurar el bienestar D. toda su familia.
texts.en: Amanda Guadalupe L.  D. L., 39, lives in the capital city of San Salvador.  She lives in her own home with her mother, her sister and her daughter, Isabel.  Amanda has a small store set up in part of her home, where she works every day of the week selling soap, detergents, daily consumer products and sweets.  In addition, she is very well-known by her neighbors for selling pupusas from Fridays through Sundays.  These are typical Salvadoran snacks maD. of a base of corn or rice that are filled with cheese, beans, squash and pork, which she makes according to the tastes of her customers.  In addition, she makes other traditional snacks in the afternoons almost every day, such as: pastries filled with meat, enchiladas and atoles (a hot drink maD. with corn meal.)  Amanda works very hard each day to proviD. for her family: she manages her family life and the household chores and at the same time takes care of both businesses.  Her daughter, who is in sixth graD., is her main source of inspiration. It has been more than 6 years since Amanda Guadalupe  started up these businesses, and now she has been able to increase her sales so that her dedication, patience and positive energy are paying off.  She has great dreams, and for this reason she requests a loan from Apoyo Integral, with which she aims to have other products in her store and a greater quantity of supplies to make her delicious pupusas and traditional snacks.  Her goal is to obtain better earnings so that she can ensure the welfare of all of her family members.

loans.use: to buy sweet buns, cookies, cereals, staple grains and supplies needed to make pupusas and other traditional Salvadoran snacks.

loans.name: Carmen Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
La señora Carmen esta en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y está muy contenta porque gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de la  Fundación Espoir ha podido mejorar la producción. Tiene 50 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es agricultor.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a las faenas del campo, desde muy de mañana ellos con la ayuda de de dos personas más a quienes les pagan un sueldo se van al campo a cultivar la tierra y a recoger los frutos que la tierra y el duro trabajo les da, ellos cultivan plátano, mangos y verduras las mismas que una vez que la recogen las llevan al mercado de Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que a veces llevan hasta dos cargas por semana de plátano y que este se vende a muy buen precio.

Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas y abono para obtener mayor producción. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, can be found in Manabí’s capital Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  The members of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank meet here every two weeks.

She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning and she’s very happy because thanks to loans from Fundación Espoir she has been able to improve production.  She’s married and has four children who are now adult and independent.  Her husband is a farmer.

She and her husband farm.  With the help of two salaried employees they head to the fields very early in the morning to till the soil and harvest the fruit that the earth and their hard work produces.  They farm bananas, mangoes and vegetables which, once gathered, are taken to market in Portoviejo.  She tells us that sometimes they take up to two loads of bananas per week and that it sells for a very good price.

This loan is to buy farming supplies and manure to obtain better production.  Her dreams are to continue working and that both she and her loved ones enjoy good health

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and manure.

loans.name: Deya

texts.en:
Deya is a 23-year-old man from Bethlehem who is engaged and is getting married next summer, Deya works in Palestine 48 land, which is located on the other side of the wall and he works in a restaurant in the evenings in order to finish preparing the house and cover the wedding expenses. 

Deya urgently needed money to pay for house appliances so he took a loan from FATEN to cover the cost. Deya appears in the picture here in FATEN's office in Bethlehem

loans.use: To pay for new house appliances

loans.name: Mutaz

texts.en: Mutaz is a 24-year-old man from Palestine. He is an employee who is getting married next summer. In order to have his wedding on time, he came to FATEN and took a $1,000 loan to finish preparing the house. Mutaz bought a kitchen table and sitting room chairs and couches with his loan money.

loans.use: to finish preparing the house for his wedding next summer

loans.name: Rodrigo Franco

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo U. tiene 37 años de edad, está casado con la señora Claudia del Aguila, actualmente ellos viven junto a sus padres haciéndoles compañía, ayudándoles a tener una vejez tranquila; aunque aún no tienen hijos a su cuidado, ellos están trabajando mucho para cuando llegue el momento les puedan dar todo lo necesario. 

Ellos viven en la zona de pacata baja, muy cerca del servicio nacional de caminos.
Rodrigo es una persona muy trabajadora y junto a su esposa quieren salir adelante. Él quiere el préstamo para el equipamiento y refacción de los vehículos que cuenta para que puedan brindar un mejor servicio de transporte como taxi. Rodrigo está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de contar con mejores medios de trabajo.

Rodrigo entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para poder acceder a una vivienda propia y así goce de un mejor bienestar para él y toda su familia y espera que muy pronto sea más grande.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodrigo U. is 37-years old and he is married with Mrs. Claudia del Aguila. They live with his parents to help them have a quiet old age. Although they don't have any children in their care, they work very hard to have all that they need when the time comes. 

They live in the region of Pacata Baja, very close to the national transportation service.  Rodrigo is a very hard working person and he wants to get ahead, together with his wife. He requires the loan to purchase accessories and carry out the necessary repairs to the cars he has to provide a better transportation and taxi service. Rodrigo is very grateful to those individuals who, through Kiva, provided him with the opportunity to have a better source of support for his business. 

Rodrigo's plans for the future are to have a new loan to build a house of his own, to be able to provide a sense of wellbeing for himself and his family, hoping that his family will grow very soon.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and pay for repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 40 years old, married, with two children; ages 10 and 17. She sells motorcycle spare parts. Jane has been in the business for two years. She left employment and started her own business so as to earn better income. She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has managed to improve her business and pay school fees for her children. Jane dreams of importing motorcycle spare parts in the future. She has requested 75,000 KES to add stock of spare parts.

loans.use: To add stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, tiene 33 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su esposo Víctor Alfonso quien está trabajando como Electricista, tienen dos hijos Eliseo D. 11 años y Ariela D. 2 años D. edad.
María tiene el negocio D. venta D. celulares y accesorios desD. hace un año, esta idea surgió por la necesidad D. ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos para el hogar, y poder crear condiciones más favorables para sus hijos, el horario D. atención es D. 7:00am a 5:00pm. Actualmente necesita la compra D. teléfono y accesorios para abastecer la vitrina ya que debe estar actualizándose con lo nuevo en el mercado, por lo que solicita un préstamo D. $500.00 dólares para realizar la inversión.
Su objetivo es surtir el negocio, atraer a los clientes con más mercadería y nuevos estilos, ya que trabajando día con día espera mantenerse como comerciante para generar un futuro mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Corinto, a department of Morazan; she is 33 years old and lives with her husband Victor Alfonso who works as an electrician.  She has 2 children, Eliseo who is 11 and Ariela who is 2 years old.  Maria has a business selling cell phones and accessories for a year now, an idea that arised from the need to help her husband with income for the home and to create more favorable conditions for her children.  Business hours are from 7AM to 5PM.  She actually needs to purchase the phones and accessories to stock the showcase since she needs to be up to date with the newest in the market; which is why she request a $500.00 (USD) loan to make the investment.
Her objective is to stock the business and attract clients with more merchandise and newer styles. Working daily, she hopes to remain as a merchant and generate a better future for her family.

loans.use: Purchase cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El solicitante es taxista el auto que maneja es propio es casado su esposa trabaja de manera independiente en afocat por lo que gana comisiones y apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares presentan experiencias crediticias sus pagos son puntuales el dinero que solicito en la otra entidad fue destinado para mejoramiento de su vivienda , cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y crediticias esta solicitando el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su anidad de transporte es por ello que se propone el crédito .
texts.en:
Juan Jose is a taxi driver who has his own vehicle. He is married and his wife works as an independent commissioned agent for AFOCAT (a company that offers accident insurance to taxi drivers). She helps with the family expenses and they both have credit experience. Juan Jose and his wife have been prompt in repaying the money they requested from another institution for making improvements to their home. He has good work-related and credit references.

Juan Jose is requesting this loan so that he can maintain his mode of transport.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Rachna

texts.en:
Mrs. Rachna B. (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband is a policeman. She has asked for a Kiva loan several times, and she is now requesting another loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her business.

The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Triy

texts.en:
Triy H., age 23, and her husband, Sokpheurng, age 25, are local farmers who live in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband help each other to grow rice and vegetables on their existing farmland, and they earn a profit of around 2.5 each day to help support the family expenses. Growing crops is an annual action with which they have had great success. This couple has one small child.

Triy H. would like to ask for a loan to buy a piece of farmland from her next-door neighbor. With this loan, she will enlarge her rice crop in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland in order to enlarge her rice crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Blasius

texts.en:
Blasius is a 30-year-old man who lives in Labat Village. Blasius is married and has been blessed with 4 children namely: 
Martha who is 11 years old and in the 5th grade of elementary school, Anita who is 8 years old and in the 2nd grade of elementary school, Arni who is 7 years old and in the 1st grade of elementary school and John, 6 years old and in kindergarten. Prior to selling bananas, Blasius worked as a truck driver for 4 years. He decided to stop doing this job and then started his banana business with his own capital. Blasius is happy operating this business. 

Blasius said that this business has good prospects for his family income. So, Blasius dreams of improving his business to generate more income. He is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase more bananas to sell in Inpres Market. Blasius hopes that TLM will give him the opportunity to receive a business loan for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas

loans.name: Kazi Ni Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s is single with one child who is still going to school.  She has been running two businesses, selling bites and second hand clothes for 7 years now.  She works from 6.30am to 5.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the food she sells and started selling clothes.  She also started building her house and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is asking for a loan to buy and sell more clothes.  Her dream is to one day finish building her house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Kazi ni Kazi" which has 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy and sell more clothes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 27 años, está casada con Rudy, de 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jack, de 9 y Anahi, de 3 años. Los tres como una gran familia, vive en casa de su mamá, ubicada en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Las labores de Margarita son múltiples, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a la “cajonería” (lugar donde se hacen cajones de madera, que se utilizan para envasar las  frutas), y en todo este tiempo pudo juntar dinero necesario para poder abrir un restaurante de anticuchos, hamburguesas y salchipapas (papas fritas con salsas) y desde entonces tiene gran acogida. Como mujer joven y trabajadora, tuvo una buena idea y ahora no solo vende anticuchos, sino también pollo crocante. Pero, sus ganas de luchar son increíbles, ya que hace tan solo 2 años que incursionó en la agricultura, donde siembra plátano y café. Ahora ella quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas y espera dentro de muy poco concretar un acuerdo de venta, pero sin descuidarse de su negocio. Para ello tiene pensado comprar una casa propia, donde pueda decorar su restaurante de manera más llamativa. Su principal preocupación en esté momento es sacar el máximo provecho a la cosecha de café, ya que solo en está temporada existe gran demanda del producto en el mercado, por ser fecha de maduración. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de saber que recibirá el apoyo financiero. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Margarita, de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícola donde está pensando sembrar mayor cantidad de café.
texts.en: Margarita, 27, is married to Rudy, 28, and together they have two children: Jack, 9, and Anahi, 3.  They all live together as a family in the house of Margarita's mother, located in the town of Puente Paucartambo (in the central Peruvian jungle.) Margarita is involved in several activities.  For 10 years she has worked at a crate business (a place where they make wooden crates used to pack fruit), and over this time she was able to save enough money to open a restaurant where she sells beef kebabs, hamburgers and salchipapas (a dish of sausage and fried potatoes.)  This business has been well received by the public.  As a young enterprising woman she had a good idea, and now sells not only beef kebabs but also fried chicken.  But she still has an incredible desire to get ahead, because two years ago she also started a business in agriculture cultivating bananas and coffee.  Now she wants to buy more farmland and hopes very soon to conclude a sales agreement, but she will also continue to tend to her restaurant business.  To do this, she is thinking about buying her own house where she could set up a more appealing locale for her restaurant.  Her main worry at this moment is to extract the biggest possible harvest from her coffee crops, since in this season there is a high demand for this product in the marketplace, and this is the time when her crops are maturing.  Margarita belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro," and this is the group's 5th loan cycle with MFP, from which Margarita is pleased to know that she will receive financial support.  She is once-again committed to making her payments on time, as she did with her previous loans.  Also, she appreciates being part of her communal bank because all of the members are cooperative and responsible people.  Margarita will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase 2 hectares of agricultural land where she plans to plant a larger quantity of coffee.

loans.use: to buy 2 hectares of land where she will cultivate coffee

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, 44 years old, is a married woman from the town of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She has 4 children. Her eldest child is 19 years old while her youngest child is 13. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 6 years now.

Her average income for the businesses is PHP 10,000 per month. Analyn needs a loan to support her livelihood. The loan will help her buy fertilizers and rice seed.

In the future, Analyn hopes to send her children to college. She believes also that, through God’s provision, she will be able to raise her family well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Katui

texts.en:
Katui is a hardworking 59 year old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been operating a salon for the last four years. She supplements her income by running a cafeteria. In the next five years, she wants to have expanded her business so that she is able to live out her dream of having a salon in the city centre.

Katui wants a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dryer, blow dryer and hair accessories.

loans.use: to buy a dryer, blow dryer and hair accessories.

loans.name: Solat

texts.en:
Solat and her husband live about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children: three sons and three daughters.
 
Solat and her husband raise bananas and flowers. In addition, she also sells Chinese noodles and coffee in front of her house when she is free from farming. 

She is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to carry bananas and flowers to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry bananas and flowers to market.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita sells second-hand clothing to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years now. Anecita is married and works hard to help support her family. 

Anecita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to offer for sale.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Abahujumugambi /rhh 2 Group

texts.fr: Bosco est le client d.ACB,il est le membre du groupe Abahujumugambi.Il  est marie, il a 31 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 8 ans et 9 ans et 1 enfant va à l’école ,il a la nationalité Rwandais, il 5 ans des études primaire. C’est son première cycle de prêt avec ACB, et avec le prêt il va acheter des fertilisants (urée, NPK)et payé main d'oeuvre.la stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les activités actuelle de l’agriculture de riz. Pour son ambition il voudrait être grossiste, paye les frais des scolarités pour ses enfants et paye le frais médicaux pour la famille.
texts.en: Bosco is a client of ACB and member of the Abahujumugambi group.  He is 31 years old and married with three children between 8 and 9 years old, one of whom is in school.  He is of Rwandan nationality and has five years of primary studies.  This is his first loan with ACB, and with the loan he will buy fertilizer (urea, NPK) and pay labor costs.  His strategy for business growth is to improve his present rice cultivation activity.  His ambitions are to become a wholesaler and pay his children’s school fees and healthcare costs for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea, NPK) and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 53-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her youngest child still goes to school.

Lolita is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Lolita works hard to improve her business and provide for her family. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Lolita hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun (pictured here) produces hammocks and sells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. Her husband, Chim, sells piglets. They have three children, one son and two daughters. One is married and other two are in school. They live in a village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokhoeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help provide capital for her husband to purchase additional piglets for sale.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase additional piglets for sale.

loans.name: Moras Group

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene la edad de 43 años el es originario de una localidad donde la principal actividad económica es el cultivo de aguacate, además entre otros frutos ya que su tierra es muy buena para cultivo. Manuel como es conocido en su comunidad es casado y dependen de el 6 personas su esposa y 5 hijos menores de edad casi todos estudiantes de primaria. Manuel se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en diferentes tianguis de la región, el tiene con ese negocio aproximadamente 8 años, dice que a diario a las 3 o 4 de la mañana sale a comprar parte de la fruta que vende, el va a comprarla a la central de abastos a una población que esta cerca de su localidad y otra el la cultiva en sus huertos de aguacate, guayaba, mispero, lima, limón, toronja, mandarina, chile manzano etc. don Manuel esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su puesto de frutas y legumbres el comprara, zanahorias, jitomates, cebollas, chiles verdes, calabazas, chicharos, garbanzos etc. el tiene fe con el crédito que le están haciendo su negocio mejorara por que tendrá mas surtido. El sueño del señor Manuel es tener un vehiculo donde pueda trasladarse mas rápidamente con sus productos y no gastar tanto en pasajes.
Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman José Luis, Antonio, José Eduardo todos ellos lo invertirán en sus puestos de frutas, para así darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida a su familias.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 43 years old and is originally from a place where the main economic activity is growing avocados and some other fruits too. He land is very good for cultivation. José Manuel is well known in his community. He is married and his wife and 5 younger children, almost all of them primary school students, depend on him. 

José Manuel sells fruits and vegetables in different open-air markets of the region. He has had this business about 8 years. He says that every day at 3:00 AM or 4:00 AM in the morning he leaves to buy some of the fruit he sells. He goes to the supply center in a little village that is near his town and the rest he grows in his back garden of avocados, guavas, loquats, limes, lemons, grapefruit, tangerines, apples, hot peppers, and other produce.

Jose Manuel is asking for a loan in order to continue investing in his fruit and vegetable stand and he will buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, green peppers, squash, peas, and chickpeas, and other items. He believes the loan is going to improve his business because he will have more supplies. His dream is to have his own vehicle, which can travel more rapidly with his products, and to not have to buy so many passenger tickets. 

The other three members of the group are called José Luis, Antonio, and José Eduardo and all of them will use their loans to invest in their fruit stands, which help them to provide a better quality of life for their families.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 12 children. Gina has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell. Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin, a borrower from Iraq, is 29 years old, married and has one child. Amin has been the owner of a women's accessories and clothing shop since 2006. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has extensive experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are many potential customers passing by.

Amin is requesting this $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. His goal is to gain more profits so that he can provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a married woman with three children. Imelda is 44 years old, residing at Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Imelda owns and operates a farm, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP with this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase pesticides and costs paid in banana planting. Imelda has been a member of GDMPC for almost four years. In the future, Imelda wants to build a jewelry store and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and costs paid in banana planting

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz para fortalecer el negocio, ella quiere seguir mejorando cada día, por eso se interesa por cancelar oportunamente y recibir de estos beneficios crediticios cada vez que los necesite.
Los préstamo le han dado fuerza para mejorar las ventas y su condición familiar también ha mejorado.
texts.en: Ana is asking for a loan to buy firewood and corn to strengthen the business.  She wants to continue improving every day.  This is why she’s interested in repaying on time so that she can receive these credit benefits every time she needs to.  The loans have given her strength to improve sales and her family situation has improved also.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Pierre Angulaire Plus Group

texts.en:
“Pierre Angulaire Plus” is a Community Bank made up of 11 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Godelive. These members are united for the same goal- to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Godelive sells drinks in the area located in the mid-eastern area of Kinshasa. She started her business in 1997. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. Her business has also been reinforced by six different loans she received from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC and has repaid them all properly. She intends to use the next loan to add more crates of drinks. The business gives her a profit of 100 USD every week. 

Godelive is 55 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages are between 14 and 31 years old. Two of them attend school. Godelive's ambition is to open a crate drink facility.

loans.use: to purchase crates of drinks to resell at a profit

loans.name: Viviana's Group

texts.es:
Viviana's group es un grupo de socios que está conformado por cuatro personas: dos mujeres y dos hombres los mismos que van a invertir el dinero en la compra de semillas y productos agrícolas ya que necesitan sembrar para obtener utilidades. En la fotografía la señorita que está con gafas y el señor de mochila no son clientes son los conyugues de los socios.

Viviana es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y muy entusiasta. Viviana es casada, tiene un hijo de 9 años. Vive con su familia en la Ciudad de Ibarra de la Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. 

Viviana trabaja con su esposo y sus socios en la siembra de productos agrícolas, como fréjol, maíz y otros productos. Es su primer crédito en Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de semillas de fréjol, abono, fungicidas entre otros, para sembrar y en un tiempo obtener producto de buena calidad y poder salir al mercado a vender ya que este es el sustento para mantener a su familia.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo ya que les gusta ser emprendedores.
texts.en:
Viviana’s group consists of four members, two women and two men. They will invest their money in seeds and farming supplies that they need in order to generate a profit. In the photograph, the woman with sunglasses and the man with a backpack are the spouses of two of the members and are not part of the group.

Viviana is a cheeful, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has a nine-year-old son. Viviana and her family live in the city of Ibarra in Imbabura Province in northern Ecuador.

Viviana works with her husband and the other members of the group in growing agricultural products such as beans, corn, and other crops. This is her first loan with FODEMI and will invest her loan in the purchase of bean seeds, compost, fungicides, and other supplies for planting. Over time, she hopes to obtain a good quality product and sell it at the market so that she can sustain her family. Her dream is to continue growing because she enjoys being an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, compost, fungicides, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он в основном продает женское и мужское нижнее белье, а также и детскую одежду. В этой области он два года. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Murodali is engaged in sales in a market.  He has a shop where he sells mostly men and ladies underwear as well as children's clothes.  He has been in the business for 2 years.  He is a single 23-year-old man.  He lives with his parents.  He is taking out a loan to buy the seasonal clothes.

loans.use: To buy children's winter clothes

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 61 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Iluminada has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Iluminada has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Shazia Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Shazia Parveen is 26 years old, married and a mother of four children. Two of them are in school while the other two are too young to attend school. 
She is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her husband in his shoe making business by making shoes. They work with each other so that her husband can finish the orders on time and be able to feed her family.  
Besides this, she completes her household responsibilities very efficiently. She provides comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She also gives time to her children so they never feel ignored. She is raising them with great care and discipline. 
She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, a shoe-polisher and nails in a larger quantity to be able to make more shoes so as to generate more revenue. 
He has almost fifteen years of experience in this work and Shazia is hopeful that the loan investment will bring better profits to his business. 
Note: “One of the members has an embroidery business. That’s why they are showing the embroidered dress”.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and a shoe-polisher for shoe making business

loans.name: Media

texts.en:
Media is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 

Media is providing "trisikad" or pedicab services. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools for the trisikad.

Media has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Media hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the "trisikad" (pedicab).

loans.name: Rubia Esmeralda

texts.es: Rubia Esmeralda de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene en variedad para damas, caballeros y niños, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas entre otros; tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, comercia de forma ambulante y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Rubia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, desde hace mucho tiempo quiere acrecentar el negocio pero no posee del suficiente capital para invertir en los artículos por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Rubia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: ropa por mayor

loans.name: Shantilata

texts.en: Shantilata is a 32-year-old woman living with her husband and two daughters in Odisha, India. Her husband is ill, so he is unable to go outside and work to earn a livelihood. Shantilata is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She has taken on all the burdens and responsibilities of her family. She earns money by maintaining the account books of different self-help groups in the locality. Self-help groups are those groups formed for micro-finance loans. She also does some tailoring and stitches dresses for her neighbors. Her childrens are studying in school. She has been struggling to provide basic needs for her family, support her sick husband, and send her children to a good school from the limited income she is earning from these varied jobs. She has a plan to set up a new business of making paper plates in her house for which she has requested a loan amount of 35,000 INR. She learned this activity from her parents, she says that "I would be able to earn more after setting up this business, and give my children a quality education and see them independent".

loans.use: to set up a new business of making paper plates in her house.

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.en:
In 1993 Eufemia began her own business with the purpose to help her husband and give to her children an education; she started to selling Tostadas and candy (the Tostada is popular snack among Mexicans. It is like a tortilla toasted with hot pepper and lemon). Little by little she has gone growing in her business with her few earnings. Now Eufemia has a groceries store and every day is increasing her sales. She is a married woman and her husband works as machinist. They have three children to take care and their names are: Aleyda, Rafael and Carlos with 19, 17 and 13 years respectively. The children help with the necessities of the family business.

She requires a loan of $650 USD to purchase merchandise that will allow her to have a greater variety of productsin her store. Eufemia hopes to have a good opportunity to make to grow her business and offer to her children an education and a better quality of life. She and her family thank your affection and your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

En 1993 Eufemia inicio su negocio con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo y dar a sus hijos una educación; empezó vendiendo tostadas y dulces, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con las pocas ganancias, actualmente y con el transcurso de los años Eufemia tiene una tienda de abarrotes que día con día esta aumentando sus ventas. Ella es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como maquinista, tienen tres hijos por cuidar y sus nombres son: Aleyda, Rafael y Carlos de 19, 17 y 13 años respectivamente, los cuales ayudan con las necesidades del negocio familiar.

Ella requiere un préstamo de $650 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita tener un mayor surtido de productos en su tienda. Eufemia espera tener una buena oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio y ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Ella y su familia agradecen tu cariño y tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en: Even though Taufau's husband died, she never gave up and does her best to continue her business. She has four children; two are working while the other two are still in school. She works six days a week selling handicrafts such as titi fau (for hula dance), necklaces, lavalava printing, and samoan bags. She requests a loan to buy fabric paints so she can increase her stock and income.

loans.use: 1 dozen fabric paints

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe C. is married and has five children, ages 31, 29, 27, 25, and 23. Seven years ago, because of personnel changes at his job, Guadalupe found himself unemployed, and in order to obtain the necessary resources for his family he started his own business selling groceries. One of his daugters works with him looking after the business, and together they have succeeded in making the business grow and get better and better.

Now Guadalupe is soliciting a loan for $150, which he will use for maintenance of the refrigerators he uses to store the products he sells in his store. This will permit him to offer better service to his customers and keep their preference. He agrees to pay back this amount over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can improve the lives of Guadalupe and his family. Support him in the growth of his business. He is sincerely grateful for your trust and help.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Guadalupe C. es casado y tiene 5 hijos, de 31, 29, 27, 25 y 23 años de edad. Hace siete años, por reajuste de personal, Guadalupe quedó desempleado y para obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, una de sus hijas colabora con él en la atención del negocio, juntos han logrado hacerlo crecer y surtirlo cada vez mejor.

Ahora Guadalupe solicita un préstamo por $ 150 dólares que empleará en el mantenimiento de los refrigeradores que utilizar para la conservación de los productos que vende en su tienda, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.
