Tú puedes mejorar la vida de Guadalupe y su familia, apóyalo en el crecimiento de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Refrigerator maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish selling business

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband helps with her business. Her daughter lives in the USA and Maria looks after her young granddaughter. Due to this and because of her age, Maria could not find a job, and so decided to start her own business. She started off selling soft drinks and some snacks from home. The shop has been steadily growing thanks to the small amount of capital with which she started and the effort and help of her husband. They started 10 years ago, but they wish to continue until their granddaughter is older so that they can give her a good education and better quality of life.

Maria would like a loan of $1100 to buy merchandise so that she can have a larger variety of products to offer her clients. She will repay this loan in 6 months. Maria and her family thank you for the support that you can offer them to help them, especially their granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María es una mujer casada y su esposo la ayuda en el negocio, su hija se fue a vivir a los Estados Unidos de Norte América y le dejo a su pequeña hijita, por lo que se quedo a cargo de su nieta y por ello y por su edad ya no le daban empleo por ello es que decidió poner su propio negocio empezando a vender refrescos y algunos abarrotes en su casa. Ella con el pequeño capital que empezó fue surtiendo poco a poco su tienda y crecer con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposo, fue ya hace 10 años que tiene su negocio pero desea continuar creciendo ya que su nieta está más grande y desea poder brindarle educación y mejorar su calidad de vida.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,100 para comprar mercadería y poder tener mayor surtido de productos que le solicitan sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para poder sacar adelante a su familia en especial a su nieta.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 18 years old. He lives in the region of Borj El Barajneh where he offers phone connections to the inhabitants. Walid does not limit himself to this networking service; he also sells magazines and newspapers, etc. He therefore needs $600 to buy enough merchandise for the coming year. Walid wants to be independent and is working hard for that. He is determined for the success of his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products and diversify the product line

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Queen S. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with five children, aged 7,10,13,18, and 22. In 2006 Queen established a business selling fish, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: I Ketut Surja

texts.id:
Manistutu village is a village with a fertile land, the Subak organization (Subak is a traditional way where a group of farmer get together to organize irrigation for their land) is running well. In this village I Ketut Surja lives with his wife and children. Ketut Surja is a farmer, planting paddy seed. The land that he works on is quite large so he needs additional workers to work on his land. However so far the product of his land is not so good. This is because the limitation from capital point of view where Ketut cannot afford to buy high quality paddy seeds, good fertilizer and good pesticide. At the moment Ketut is only using local paddy seeds and adds fertilizer and pesticide once and a while as they are quite expensive. With the loan from Dinari, Ketut Surja is hoping that his harvest will improve as he is using a good quality seeds, fertilizer and also good pesticide. If his harvest successful he will be able to improve his family's welfare.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Desa Manistutu merupakan desa yang subur, pengaturan Subak ( organisasi petani dalam hal pengaturan air ) nya sangat bagus sehingga pengairan disawah menjadi lancar. Didesa inilah I Ketut Surja tinggal bersama istri dan anak-anaknya. Ketut Surja menekuni usaha sebagai petani yang bercocok tanam dengan menanam padi. Lahan yang dikerjakan cukup luas,sehingga ia memerlukan buruh untuk mengerjakan sawahnya ini. Namun hasil padi yang dipanen selama ini tidak bagus. Hal ini disebabkan karena keterbatasan dana yang dimiliki oleh Ketut Surja, sehingga dia tidak bisa membeli bibit dengan kwalitas unggul ,maupun cara pemberian pupuk dan pengobatan yang bagus. Ketut Surja hanya menggandalkan bibit lokal saja ,dan pemupukannya pun hanya sekedar, pemberantasan hama tidak dilakukan secara tuntas mengingat harga obat-obatan meningkat drastis. Tapi sekarang dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari Ketut Surja berharap panennya tidak gagal lagi,karena bibit yang digunakan merupakan bibit unggul dan cara pemupukan serta pengobatan padi pun sudah dilakukan dengan baik. Apabila panennya berhasil otomatis ekonomi keluarga pun akan menjadi lebih baik dan sejahtera.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, paddy seeds and pesticide (Membeli pupuk, bibit padi berkwalitas dan obat - obatan anti hama)

loans.name: Ong

texts.en:
Mrs. Ong S., 54, sells beef and fish at an open-air market earning approximately five dollars per day. Her husband supports the family by raising pigs and cows which occasionally supply his wife’s butchery stand.

The couple has four children. The oldest is an English teacher with a salary of $30 a month; the second oldest helps sell beef and fish in the market; the third in line is employed by a garment factory earning $60 a month; the other child is a student.

Mrs. Ong S. has humbly applied for a loan to purchase more oxen to increase her family’s livestock. This will increase her inventory and her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more oxen to increase her family’s livestock.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat C. lives in the Ampil Village of Kandal Province. She is 57 years old and is the mother of three children, one of whom is working and can generate an income of approximately $2.75 per day while the other two children are studying at a local school. She is a subsistence farmer and a seller of fish. Her husband, Mor Mean (pictured on the right of the photo), is a fisherman who usually gathers fish for his wife to sell at the market. Typically, Mrs. Sat C. can earn approximately $1.85 per day, but she would like to start an animal husbandry business in order to improve her and her family's standard of living. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy cows, which she will breed, feed, and tend to.

loans.use: To embark upon a new business venture (animal husbandry) by purchasing cows.

loans.name: Eneleka

texts.en:
Eneleka operates a small grocery store where she sells drinks, snacks, twisties, lollies, tins of herring, and various other products needed by her customers. She has already made two other expansions to her shop. She lives on the seaside of one of the villages. She is a 34-year-old mother of eight children; six live in Samoa and two reside overseas, but they all support their mother's business.

Eneleka's goal was to improve their standard of living, and for her children to get a better education and better access to proper health care. Eneleka joined SPBD in 2004; she is now on her 3rd loan. She puts the profits from her business into her savings account with SPBD to assist in refilling the stock of the business if any week is too slow.

loans.use: Purchase a new supply of goods

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.en:
Nematjon I. first applied to MicroInvest in 2008. Mr. I. is engaged in the family livestock business. He has a good flock and 30 years’ experience raising livestock. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. He is the father of 3 children and is a very good family man. Mr. I. dreams of having a big livestock business to leave to his children. He would like to significantly increase his business income.

Therefore, Mr. I. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US to purchase a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. is 25-years-old, married with one child. She lives in Benin City with her family. She is a hairdresser by training. She went to school for 12 months and she started her own salon business in 2004. She has been a LAPO client for the past 2 years. Kate is requesting the loan to purchase more hairdressing materials and weavons for resale.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hairdressing materials for resale

loans.name: Maria Antonia's Group

texts.en:
Antonia is married and a 48-year-old mother of 5 children. She has a grocery store at her home in the Vista Alegre neighborhood. She also travels to the regional fairs where she sells fruit. 

María is separated. She is 56 and has 3 children. She travels to the regional fairs 3 times a week where she sells sweets and breads she first buys wholesale in the Ayacucho bakeries.

As for Lidia, she is married, is 59 and has 6 sons. She sells groceries in a stall at the F. Vivanco market in Ayacucho. On Saturdays she travels to fairs to sell groceries.

Antonia, Maria and Lidia belong to the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 300, 200, and 600 Nuevos Soles to buy oranges, apples, bananas, lollipops, gum, biscuits, rice, and sugar.

They would like their children to be professionals. They also dream about being in good health and expanding their businesses.

loans.use: to buy oranges, apples, bananas, lollipops, gums, biscuits, rice, and sugar for their businesses

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị Đua thuộc diện hộ nghèo của xã Tiên Dược, bởi gia đình chị rất đông con,  ruộng ít lại không có vốn để làm ăn. Năm 1994, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương, với số tiền 300.000 đồng ở vòng vốn đầu tiên chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, gà cho thu nhập ổn định.Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức tối đa mua lợn, bò, gà về chăn nuôi và sau khi xuất chuồng đều cho thu nhập khá, kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định và có tích lũy. Từ năm 2002 gia đình chị  mạnh dạn chuyển sang  làm kinh tế trang trại, chăn nuôi bò, lợn, và buôn bán bò thịt hàng tháng cho thu nhập bình quân 3-3,5 triệu đồng. Hiện nay các con chị đã lớn và xây dựng gia đình ra ở riêng, còn 2 con ở cùng bố mẹ cũng đã đi làm trong khu công nghiệp Nội Bài. Nhờcó đồng vốn vay của Quỹ để làm ăn đến nay gia đình chị đã trở thành hộ có kinh tế ổn định và chị là một điển hình làm kinh tế giỏi của xã Tiên Dược huyện Sóc Sơn – Hà Nội. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay19.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư mua bò và thức ăn chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Before becoming a TYM member, Mrs Đua and her big family were one of the poor families of Tiên Dược village because of her numerous children. They had a small piece of land and no capital to start any kind of business. In 1994, she joined TYM fund and contracted a loan of 300.000 VND. She started raising pigs and chickens. All her subsequent loans were used to buy piglets, calves and chicks. It yielded good profits and enabled her family to have a steady income and some savings. Since 2002, she and her family changed their business plan, they started farming cows & pigs. They also sell beef. Their income was 3.000.000 - 3.500.000 VND a month. Today her children are grown up and have their own family. 2 of her children are still living at home, they work in the industrial zone "Nội Bài". Thanks to TYM, she and her family have raised above poverty having a steady income. She is a model entrepreneur for Tiên Dược village, Sóc Sơn district, Hà Nội. This time she is requesting 19.000.000 VND to buy calves and feed for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Maloafan

texts.fr:
Madame N. Maloafan est née en 1957 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de céréales et des ignames dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé. Il a une grande expérience dans ce commerce puisqu’elle a commencée depuis 1992.
Elle a une fois bénéficiée du crédit auprès de WAGES et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement du crédit.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de d’acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs du haricot et 50 tubercules d’ignames. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Maloafan N. was born in 1957 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four. Her business involves selling grain and yams in the Agoè Assiyéyé marketplace. She has a great deal of experience in commerce, since she started in 1992. She once was a recipient of a WAGES loan and performed well in repaying it. This second loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 10 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of beans, and 50 yam tubers . Thus, with the income from this business, she will be able to assist her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in grain and yams

loans.name: Bocar

texts.fr: Bocar D. est un menuisier qui habite dans le quartier de ouakam. Il a plus de dix ans d'expérience dans ce métier. Il fait un travail de qualité et il a une clientéle fidéle. Il fait des chiffres d'affaires en moyenne de 400 000 f cfa par mois. Il gagne bien sa vie et entretien sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit pour augenter son fond de roulement
texts.en:
Bocar D. is a cabinet-maker who lives in the Ouakam district. He has over ten years of experience in this trade. He does quality work and has loyal customers. Having average sales figures of 400,000 francs CFA per month, he is earning his living and supporting his family. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpentry

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 42 años, es conviviente, tuvo 5 hijos y que ahora solo viven con ella 3 de ellos. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ahora que tiene su familia siembra en grandes cantidades papa, para ella sembrar papa le ha sido muy rentable porque es un producto que en su temporada lo cotizan a un buen precio en el mercado y  gana al doble de su inversión, pero en temporada baja, casi no recupera nada. Ella sigue sembrando porque no tiene otra alternativa en qué ocuparse, ni mucho menos otros ingresos, lo único es que siembra diversas variedades de productos para compensar sus ingresos. Viene trabajando en su segundo préstamo con MFP, demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará  el fertilizante que llaman 18 y nitrato, nos dice que sin este fertilizante, 18, no hace fruto la planta y no se cosecha como debería ser.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, is a common-law wife and has 5 children: two are grown and three still live with her. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl. Now that she has a family, she grows large quantities of potatoes. Potatoes are a profitable crop for Maria, because in high demand season, the revenue she gets is twice the investment; but in low season, she does not recover much of her investment. Even in this case, Maria keeps on growing potatoes because she does not have any other work to do, nor any other source of income. She tries to grow different types of vegetables to balance her income. The loan she is requesting is the second from MFP. She has made her payments on time. This time, the loan will be used to buy a fertilizer called 18 and nitrate. She tells us that the fetilizer 18 is needed to make the potatoes grow larger.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizante para sus cultivos

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es: La  Sr. Arelis tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Hialeah de la capital de Managua, madre soltera, tiene una hija de 16 años de edad que actualmente estudia. Sus planes para su familia dejarle un patrimonio a su hija y mejorar en la actualidad el nivel de vida de su familia. Doña  Arelis posee su pequeño negocio de venta de mariscos, cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, hielo y helado en su casa de habitación desde hace cinco años, iniciándolos con fondos propios. Sus metas para su negocio es ofertar mayor volumen de producto y comprar  nuevos productos con esta solicitud de préstamo como cosméticos, ropa variada. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar mayores cantidades de mercadería y así captar nuevos clientes, lo cual generaran mayores utilidades y mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Arelis is 43 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, the capital city. She is a single mother with a 16 year old daughter who studies in school. Her plans are to leave a legacy for her daughter and improve the standard of living for her family. Arelis owns a small business selling seafood, cosmetics, clothing, shoes, ice and ice cream from her home. She has had her business for 5 years, beginning with her own funds. Her goals for her business are offer a large volume of products and buy new products. With this loan she will buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she will be able to buy larger quantities of merchandise and in this way gain new customers, which will generate more income and improve her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for children and adults and cosmetics

loans.name: Nazirsho

texts.ru: Зайниддинов Назиршо проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 35 лет, холост , детей не имеет. Живет с родителями.Один обеспечивает пожилых родителей, а так же семью брата. Имеет средне -специальное образование. По профессии портной. Шьет брюки на заказ , а так же для продажи. Кредит необходим для того , чтобы купит оверлог. Это упростит ему работу , а также улучшить качество производимой продукции. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazirsho Z. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 35 years old, not married and has no children. He lives with his parents. He supports his elderly parents and also his brother's family. He has specialized secondary education and is a tailor by profession. He makes custom pants for clients and also for resale. He needs a loan to buy overlock sewing machine. It will make Nazirsho's job much easier and also increase the quality of his production. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Abdulali

texts.en:
Abdulali Q. is 45 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as: cookies, candies, macaroni, detergents, and many others in his grocery store which he built 10 years ago. Currently Abdulali has about US$ 500 in inventory. His monthly net profit is about US$ 100.

Today Abdulali is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to generate more income

loans.name: Jesús Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Roberto D. es padre de familia tiene dos hijas a las que quiere y desea darles lo mejor. 
Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorros a podido construirles un cuarto, pero le esta haciendo falta el techo y el quiere mejor ponerlo de concreto ya que es mas duradero y seguro para ellas. Pero no a podido terminar la mejora y por eso nos está solicitando un préstamo para terminarles la recamara a sus niñas y así tengan su propio espacio en la casa. Planea pagar esté crédito con los ingreso de su trabajo como jefe de mantenimiento técnico en una fabrica. Cuando visitamos el domicilio de Don Jesús Roberto el no se encontraba estaba en su trabajo solo estaba su esposa la señora San Juana Sánchez que nos atendió y aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Jesús Roberto D. has two daughters who he loves and wants to give the best to. With much effort and his savings he has been able to construct a room for them. It still needs a roof and to be reinforced with concrete, which is more durable and safe. But he has not been able to finish the construction and that is why he is requesting a loan to complete his daughters' bedroom, providing them with their own space in the house. He plans to repay this loan with his earnings as chief maintenance technician at a factory. When we visited the house Jesús Roberto was at work so only his wife, San Juana Sánchez, appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paving house with flagstones

loans.name: Otaqul

texts.ru: Алимардонов Отакул проживает в районе Вахш. Занимается фермерской деятельностью. Имеет дехканское хозяйство, а так же занимается животноводством. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Обратился к нам за кредитом , потому что хочет закупить комбикорм для своих животных. Это поможет завезти комбикорма оптом и сэкономить  деньги  на транспортировке. Погасить кердит сможет в  ечение 5 месяцев.
texts.en:
Otaqul A. lives in the Vahsh region. He is in the agriculture business. He owns an animal farm. He is married and has 4 children. He would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase feed for his livestock. Additional funds will help him to buy a large amount of feed at wholesale prices and save money on transportation costs. He plans to pay off his loan within 5 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: New dry fruits purchasing.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Mrs. Ceferina P. is 59 years old, separated, and blessed with 5 children – all of them have finished their schooling and have their own job. Selling of fish is her primary activity and the source of household income.

Mrs P. has been the sole breadwinner of the family. Because of her determination and hard work, her daughter is now a certified public accountant. Now, she needs additional capital of Php5,000 in order to sustain and maintain her regular customers. She's planning to own a stall in the market and to have savings for future needs.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
La familia esta compuesta por tres integrantes, Raúl, su concubina y su único hijo de seis años.
Raúl es empleado de una empresa de la localidad "MOLCRUZ" de donde recibe mensualmente un ingreso que le permite mantener a su familia, paralelamente cuenta con ingresos que le generan el alquiler de su motocicleta misma que funciona cmo mototaxi, por otra parte su esposa cuenta con una tienda de bariio donde ofrece todo tipo de abarrotes y que también cuenta con un punto de llamadas Viva. El nivel de la competencia es medio ya que existen otros negocios y con similares rubros. El crédito solicitado será destinado para capital de trabajo en su negocio de abarrotes. Esta es su cuarta operación con la institución y en todo el tiempo de trabajo con la misma demostró ser un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
This family is comprised of three members: Raul, his wife, and their only son, who is six years old. Raul works for a local business, Molcruz, where he is paid a monthly wage that allows him to support his family while also relying on income generated by renting out his own motorcycle, which functions as a "mototaxi." His wife also relies on (income from) a neighborhood market that sells all sorts of groceries as well as runs telephone booths. There is a little bit of competition because there are other businesses around that are similar. This requested loan will be used for operational expenses at the grocery store. This is the family's fourth loan through this Kiva partner, and in all their time working with the organization, the family have shown themselves to be excellent clients.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en:
The committee of women named “Renacer” (“Reborn”), formed on January 17th, 2009 thanks to Mrs. Daniela R. D., the current Director of Finances. She works making and selling food. She contacted the advisor in order to enter into a committee of enterprising women. Once she became a member of the program, she was able to gather 16 women, who are now working in their second cycle in the program. 

The average credit give to each participant is 480,000 Gs, which goes to different activities such as the sale of: food, hardware, grocery store items, clothing, lingerie, fruit, vegetables, meat, and honey cakes. 

The “Reborn” group is an excellent group whose members work supportively with each other. All of the participants attend weekly meetings and do their activities for the well-being of the group. 

1. Carmen P. - Dressmaker
2. Daniela R. D. - Diner
3. Josefina R. - Grocery store 
4. María M. - Pig farmer 
5. Justa B. - Drink sales 
6. Josefa A. - Cake sales 
7. Gladys A. - Clothing sales 
8. Lourdes M. - Candy sales 
9. Cynthia N. - Clothing and honey-cake sales 
10. Gloria P. - Drink sales 
11. Liliana A. - Clothing sales 
12. Elsi A. - Food sales 
13. Inocencia A. - Small grocery store 
14. Aureliana A. - Drink sales 
15. Teresa G. - Meat and vegetable sales 
16. Lorena P. - Food sales

loans.use: To purchase items for their individual enterprises

loans.name: Francisca Jeronima

texts.es: Francisca Jerónima López R. tiene la edad de 36 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Tiene la actividad económica de la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Francisca inicio este negocio por necesidad y deseos de superación, cuando empezó solamente vendía mangos, naranjas y melones todos los días se levanta temprano para ir al mercado y vender sus frutas además recorre mucho lugares para ofrecer sus productos a diferentes clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de naranjas, tomates, cebollas y aguacates. Los sueños de Francisca son de que la salud de su Mama mejore ya que para ella so es lo mas importante.
texts.en:
Francisca Jerónima López R. is 36 years old and cares for two children. For over 16 years, she has sold fruits and vegetables. Francisca started this business out of necessity and a desire to overcome adversity. When she started she only sold mangoes, oranges, and melons. She gets up early to go to the market and sell her fruit, going all over town to offer her products to different customers. Her dream is for her mother's health to improve; this is the most important thing in Francisca's life. The loan Francisca needs will go to the purchase of oranges, tomatoes, onions and avocados.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia trabaja como costurera, confecciona chamarras y tiene un ingreso mensual; el esposo es chofer de taxi y así logran sus fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de su familia. Viven en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingavi – Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (telas, cuero, forros, hilo, etc.), que requiere para confeccionar chamarras en mayor cantidad y así incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Lidia works as a seamstress making jackets and has a monthly income. Her husband is a taxi driver and they use these sources of income to support their family. They live in a rented house in the Villa Ingavi – Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan for the purchase of raw material (fabrics, leather, lining, thread, etc.) that she needs to make more jackets and increase her income.

This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed qualifies her for the approval of the loan for which she has applied.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, leather, lining, etc. to make jackets.

loans.name: Kumriniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 




Кумринисо 6 лет торгует детской одеждой на рынке города Вахдат. У нее много постоянных клиентов. Ей 39 лет и у нее 3 детей. Она берёт кредит для расширения бизнеса продажи детской одежды. Привозит она товар из оптовых рынков. Для закупа летних маек для мальчиков и шорт она подала заявку на займ. Кумринисо на снимке на месте деятельности.

loans.use: Закуп летних детских одежд

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, age 36, sells garment cloth, shoes, slippers and lace materials at the community market center. Lace material is very useful for room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. She started her business 10 years ago.

Mercy is married and the mother of four children. Currently, all her children attend school in the community where they live. Mercy works very hard to look after herself and her business. Her inventory is low because of inadequate funds. For this reason, she requests loan support to help make her business progress. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Grupo Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras se encuentran a 35 kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapán, viven especificamente en una comunidad llamado Tierra Colorada, el cual se organizo hace más de 5 años, entre las razones importantes de estar organizadas esta de superarse economicamente y ellas han optado por la elaboración de canastillas de plasticos que a traves de su comercialización generan ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias, este es un producto que contribuye con la protección de la naturaleza ya que los materiales son muy resistentes que evita la utilización de bolsas plasticas que son una fuente de contaminación a la naturaleza, a raiz de querer ampliar su capital de trabajo ellas han decidido trabajar con la institución ASDIR, a travez del crédito de Bancos Comunales lo que permitirá aumentar su producción y por ende el aumento en la generación de sus ingresos.

loans.use: Comercio y capital de trabajo

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Los Pinos Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres los Pinos son originarios de la comunidad de Coxom a ocho kilometros del municipio  su principal actividad de las integrantes del grupo es la elaboracion de güipiles  ellas vienen trabajando hace siete años con cinco miembros del grupo a principio del febrero del dos mil nueve se incorporan dos personas mas que son hijas de las integrantes, con el unico objetivo que ellas aprende el arte para que dicho grupo no desaparesca.  En dicho trabajo la dificultad que se afronta es la falta de capital  y por ser personas muy sencillas no se tiene acceso ha la banca  ellos escucharon por una emisora local que ASDIR da creditos en grupos  visitan las oficina para solicitar un credito que lo invertiran en la compra de telas, conos, bastidores, moldes ya que tiene un pedido por las fiesta del municipio, el grupo viene trab
texts.en:
The women’s group Los Pinos are originally from the community of Coxom, 8km outside the city. The main activity of the group members is making Güipiles (traditional clothing). Five of the group members have worked together for seven years. In the beginning of February 2009, they added two more members who are the daughters of current members. They want the girls to learn this traditional art so that the group continues. Lack of capital is a problem for the group. The women live simply and so do not have access to bank loans. They heard from a local radio station that ASDIR provided group credit, and visited the office to request a loan to invest in fabric, spools of thread, frames, and patterns. They are already working on an order for the municipality's festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L. is from Catadman, city of Ozamiz. She is 49 years old and married with three adult-aged children. To make a living, she operates a buy and sale business. She buys RTW’s like t-shirts, pants, sandals and sells it to her neighbors and friends. She is also a dealer of avon products like perfume, lotion, and beauty products and other cosmetics supply. She has been engage in this business for 5 months and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In June 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living condition and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase more Avon products like perfumes, lotion and beauty products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of the barrower’s family.

loans.use: use to purchase more beauty products and cosmetics supply

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 31-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children.

Nimer owns a grocery store in which he sells candies, raw materials, canned food, cheese, soft drinks and juices, bread, cleaning home products, etc. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store to increase his stock. This is the first time that Nimer has requested a loan.

Nimer is special in his work because he sells a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Nimer knows how to suit his clients’ demands – for example, if a client wants something and Nimer doesn’t have it, he does his best to find it. When Nimer first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing this business because he took over his father’s store; his father had owned the store since 1975.

In the future, Nimer plans on expanding his business by opening another grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres  du Nyetaa sont au nombre de quatre femmes,  toutes mariées dans des foyers monogames,  ayant en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants, elles habitent  le quartier Djaka (Kirango)  de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, d’amitié et  sont membres d’une même association traditionnelle « Traoré Ton » qui donna son nom  à leur actuelle association. Elles font presque toutes la même activité à savoir  l’achat et la vente du poisson sous diverses formes  (frit, séché, fumé, frais etc.)
Le groupe Nyetaa est à son 5ème prêt de groupe, après avoir bien remboursé les quatre précédents prêts sans aucune difficulté.
Ce nouveau prêt servira à utiliser, 40 paniers de poisson frais, 12 barres  de glace.  Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger. Une bonne partie de ce poisson est séchée soit sur du gravier soit sur de la paille ou sur des « seccos ».Le reste du poisson se vend sous toutes les formes : les poisson frais   se vendent sur place à Kirango et à Diamarabougou Markala, le frais  conservé dans de la glace se vend à Ségou ( au marché château) et  Bamako, le poisson séché dont une partie est conservée jusqu’à la décrue où elles gagnent plus d’argent  est surtout vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, Boussin et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, le fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant à une  clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, sur place au bord du fleuve, aux marchés de Kirango et de Diamarabougou (Markala) ou en ambulant à travers les quartiers du village. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 52.800 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux  et  à participer aux évènements sociaux. 
Leur ambition est d’avoir une concession  à travers l’épargne en animaux pour les enfants.
texts.en:
The Nyetaa Group consists of four women, all of whom are married and living in monogamous relationships. They have an average age of 29 and an average of three children each. They live in the Djaka (Kirango) neighborhood in Markala (in the fourth administrative region of Mali). The women met through family ties, marriage and friendships, and they are all members of the same traditional association, "Traoré Ton", from which they have taken the name of their current association. They all have the same business activity: buying and selling fish in various forms (fried, dried, smoked, fresh etc.). The Nyetaa Group is on its fifth group loan, having paid back the four previous loans with no problems. This new loan will allow them to purchase 40 baskets of fresh fish and 12 blocks of ice. They stock up on fresh fish locally, on the banks of the Niger River. A good portion of this fish is dried, either on stones, straw or "seccos". The rest is sold in different ways: the fresh fish is sold locally in Kirango and Diamarabougou Markala; the fresh fish conserved on ice is sold in Ségou (at the castle market) and Bamako; the dried fish, some of which is kept until the waters recede when it is worth more, is mostly sold in Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango, Boussin and at the weekly fair in Ségou; the smoked fish is mainly sold in Ségou. The sales are generally transacted in cash to a clientele made up of both men and women, and are carried out locally beside the river, in the Kirango or Diamarabougou (Markala) markets or door-to-door in village. The women expect to make an average monthly profit of 52,800 FCFA, which will allow them to take care of some small family needs and to participate in social events. Their ambition is to save enough money to buy their children a plot of land on which to raise animals.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Sacrifice and patience are needed in order to achieve success in life, says Rolando E.. He buys scrap materials within the village of Rizal Santiago and is also engaged in a rice-farming business. Rolando is married to Criselda and they are blessed with three children: Rowena - 11 years old; Remar - ten years old, and Lea - nine years old.  Rolando is requesting a loan of  Php6,000 to buy more scrap in order to generate a bigger income for his family's needs.

loans.use: Additional capital for business growth

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. lives in the village of Hda Alejandria in Barangay La Granja, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She is 46 years old, married, and blessed with 3 children between 11 to 23 years old, with the oldest already in college. Her dream is for her children to finish their studies and help her to improve their lives. 

Many years ago, she worked as a bookkeeper in a sugar cane plantation, but she lost her job when the farm was divided among the long-time laborers through the government's agrarian reform program. Her employer offered to transfer her to their home office in the city, but she refused the offer because she wanted to stay close to her family.

The new development in her life prompted her to start her own business to help her husband support their family. In 2003, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to get access to capital so that she could open a general store. Because of her business background, she proved to be a good entrepreneur and her business soon flourished and expanded to include RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes and electronic loading (of pre-paid credits for text messaging) of mobile phones. She was also able to invest in a poultry business, starting with just 12 chicken. She now raises 41 chickens, which contributes a lot to her family's income. Her net profit per month averages PHP 6,400 (~ $139 USD). 

She used her previous loan of Php 7,000 as additional capital for her general store. That loan was fully repaid without delay. Now for her 16th loan, she is borrowing Php 19,500 to buy additional chicks, feed, and vitamins for her poultry business. She plans to use the income from her loan to pay for her children's education and other family expenses.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the  lives of thousands of women through Project  "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is  empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a  life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has  earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Adijat is 50 years old and is married with four children. Her youngest child is 10 years old. Her husband works in a government electrical company and he also supports the home.

Adijat is a smart and hardworking woman. She sells drinks and eggs at retail prices and hopes to own a shopping mall in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Adijat is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and eggs to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo O. H. de 62 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar. El señor Ricardo posee un negocio de estructuras metálicas, negocio en el cual le va muy bien ya que se destaca por ser una persona muy responsable en su trabajo, el cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y se esmera mucho por brindar el mejor servicio. Debido a que es gracias a este negocio como él junto a su esposa sobreviven, el solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de metal, esto debido a que cuando las personas le hacen los pedido Ricardo debe poseer la materia prima para la elaboración del producto. Es por ello que él espera poder mejorar su negocio a través de dicho préstamo y de esta manera contar con una estabilidad económica, la cual es tan necesaria para todo ser humano.
texts.en:
Ricardo O. H. is 62 years old and resides in Colon, in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker. Ricardo has a metal workshop business, a business which is doing very well since he stands out as a person who is very responsible in his work. He delivers all of his orders on time, and he takes great pains to provide the best service possible. Since this business is the sole economic support of Ricardo and his wife, he is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of metal, so that he will have the raw materials on hand to make products when people come with orders. He hopes to be able to improve his business as a result of this loan and thus have economic stability, which is so necessary for every human being.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy metal

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke Y., 54, is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She now has two grown sons who work in building houses in Phnom Penh and another son who is a worker in the rubber plantation. Her sons provide their small incomes to contribute to the family. Ke Y. has a partner in her husband, Bun Vorn, who is 60 years of age and a construction foreman.

To earn a living, Ke Y. owns a small store next to her house where she operates a grocery business. She built a new house a year ago but the construction process is not entirely completed due to the lack of money. Therefore, Ke Y. requested a loan to be used to finish building her new house.

loans.use: To finish building her new house

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is the owner of M.’s Senior Care Services, a geriatric care management company. Originally from England, Patricia started her career working as a registered nurse and she transitioned into the geriatric care industry after immigrating to the United States with her American husband in 1996.

Confident in her entrepreneurial, organizational and medical knowledge and skills, Patricia opened M.’s Senior Care Services four years ago in order to provide care management for the frail and elderly while maximizing her earning capacity by being her own boss. “I tell my prospective new clients that my business is like ‘being a daughter for hire’,” says Patricia.

Ready to take her business to the next level, Patricia plans to hire a part-time office administrator, build a website, invest in new geriatric care equipment, and upgrade her marketing materials. She has already hired a part-time gerontologist to work with her. However, Patricia was dismayed when her own bank turned her down for a business loan. The Small Business Administration referred Patricia to Opportunity Fund, her local micro-finance institution, where her business was analyzed and approved for a loan.

A $5,000 loan will help Patricia to achieve her goals, grow her business and realize her dreams. “Hiring our first full-time employee and dedicating more of my time to management are the baby steps I need to take to see my business take off. Within three years, I hope to see myself managing the office and employing two full time care managers to serve our clients.”

loans.use: To buy new equipment and marketing materials

loans.name: Bless

texts.en:
Bless T. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Bless owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Bless has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Bless joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bless has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bless is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Bless from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora C., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Widowed and blessed with five children, she is determined to earn a good income so that her family can have a better life.  She is involved in three different types of businesses: her variety store (the main business), her direct selling business, and a buy-and-sell business.

Leonora has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow seven times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 35,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital by buying more quantities of products for each of her three expanding businesses. She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buying more quantities of products for each of her businesses

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and bread at home and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Wani is 23 years old. Her husband is a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Zara Liduvina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Ensueños está ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues, su clima frío es propicio para el cultivo de papas, habas, fréjol, y algunas frutas y verduras, también nos invita a disfrutar de la belleza de sus templos, su centro histórico donde podemos apreciar el arte colonial y  moderno, además de la calidez  de su gente siempre amable y cordial con el turista.

 En éste banco encontramos a la señora Zara C.  con apenas 19 años se encuentra casada y ya tiene un bebé de un año tres meses, viven en casa de sus suegros porque aún no tienen casa propia;  su esposo trabaja en una lavadora de autos y ella en su gabinete de belleza gracias a que estudió por tres años en una academia de la localidad,  su horario de trabajo es de 08H30 a 18H30 compartiendo con las actividades propias del hogar, cuidado de su bebé y también se da tiempo para vender productos cosméticos de las  líneas Yanbal, Esika, L´bel, nos comenta que lleva siete años como consultora de belleza lo que le ha permitido contar con su clientela fija.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal gracias a la invitación que le hizo una amiga socia activa del banco. Con el dinero del crédito solicitado comprará tintes, bigudíes,  líquidos permanentes, así como perfumes, cremas, esmaltes, tratamientos,  y más productos cosméticos  Yanbal, Esika, Lébel para damas y caballeros. Tiene como máximo sueño tener su departamento independiente para poder vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
The Ensueños (Dreams) Community Bank is located in the city of Azogues. Its cold climate is favorable to cultivating potatoes, beans and some types of fruits and vegetables. It is also known for the beauty of its temples and is a historic center where people can appreciate colonial and modern art, not to mention that its people are always friendly to tourists. In this community bank we find Zara C., who at only 19 years old is married and has a 3-month old baby. She lives in the home of her in-laws since she doesn't have her own home. Her husband works at a car wash, and she works at a beauty parlor thanks to studying for three years at a local school. She works from 8:30 a.m. until 6:30 p.m. and still fulfills her household duties, cares for her baby and also takes time to sell cosmetic products from the Yanbal, Esika and Lébel product lines. She tells us that she has seven years of work experience, which has allowed her to have a fixed clientele. This is her third loan cycle with the community bank, which she joined at the invitation of a friend who is also an active member. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase dye, curlers and permanent solution, as well as perfumes, creams, nail polish, treatments and more cosmetic products from Yanbal, Esika and Lébel for women and men. Her biggest dream is to have her own place where she can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dye, curlers and permanent solution, as well as perfumes, creams, nail polish, treatments and more cosmetic products from Yanbal, Esika and Lébel for women and men

loans.name: Mrs. Phorn Sus Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in the village of Ta Pech in Kandal province have have made a village bank loan group. Mrs. Phorn S. was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Phorn S. is widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is enrolled in a local public school. She is a farmer who owns 0.75-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family. In the rice field she has faces a problem in that her field is far from an  irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Phorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine (irrigation pump).

loans.use: To buy a water machine

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mr. Ouch Y. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. He is 53 years. He owns a rice mill in the local village and he is a white wine maker too. His wife, Mrs. Sarum Sem, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family and she is a pig breeder, too. Since their businesses are going well, they want to expand. So to improve their businesses, Mr. Ouch Y. is seeking a loan to buy more rice to mill to He will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food. He is a father of five children. Two of the children are helping their parents, and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more rice to mill

loans.name: Hasfa

texts.en:
Hasfa is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She resides in and rents a three roomed house.  The family has access to electricity but do not have piped water. Hasfa also takes care of additional family members.

She owns a stall selling sugar canes in Kalerwe market and sells to all categories of people but on wholesale only. She buys these sugar canes in  Kawolo in Mukono district and uses public transport to and from Kawolo for the sugar canes. Hasfa goes for sugar canes once a week.

She wants to use this loan to buy one lorry load of sugar canes. Hasfa has been in this business for 10 years. Hasfa receives an average of 20 customers a day. Her business challenges includes transportation and defaulters.  She aspires to increase on her capital base and start going to Kawolo twice a week. She joined MCDT to get more capital for her sugar cane business.  Her monthly expenses includes rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy one lorry of sugar canes

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Khen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Lekh Buon village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chantha K. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chantha K. was born in 1968. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Vet Houn, is a construction worker. Their home does not have a lavatory to use. Mrs. Chantha K. is asking for a loan to construct a lavatory for her family's use. She is a mother of five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, two attend the local public school, and the youngest one is six years old.

loans.use: To construct a lavatory

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, D. 36 años D. edad, convive con su pareja y fruto D. ellos tienen dos hijos, Jorge y Sofía que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en L. localidad D. Quimbiri, ubicada en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, donD. tienen su propia casa. Elena emprendió en un nuevo negocio, que es L. venta D. ropa para  todas L. edades según a los gustos y preferencias D. sus clientes. Nunca espero que le resultara tan rentable este trabajo, tener que caminar y ofrecer sus productos D. puerta en puerta a sus clientes, asimismo realiza promociones a nuevos clientes insatisfechos. En tanto su esposo tiene su propio negocio que es un Bar – Recreo, permitiéndole tener los ingresos necesarios para L. familia, pero Elena aspira a tener su propio negocio, es por ello que mantiene su trabajo y confía que más adelante piensa tener su propia tienda ropas, con el propósito  D. que pueda exhibir su producto. Por lo general trabaja en las localidades D. Quimbiri y San Francisco desD. las 9:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 8:00 D. L. noche, durante L. semana, excepto los domingos que es el día que descansa y pueD. pasar más tiempo con su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar D. manera puntual, además, agradece a su grupo comunal por los beneficios que éste le otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en L. compra D. mercadería para que así pueda cumplir con sus compromisos D. entrega hacia sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Elena is 36 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, Jorge and Sofía, who are of school age. Together they resiD. in their own house in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. Elena started a new business selling clothing for all ages according to the likes and preferences of her customers. She never thought this type of work would be so profitable. Elena travels door to door offering her products to her customers, as well as promoting to potential customers who are dissatisfied with what they have. Her husband has his own business operating a bar and recreation center, which allows them to have the necessary income to support their family. However, Elena hopes to have her own business where she can continue to work and establish a clothing store for exhibiting her merchandise. She usually works in the towns of Quimbiri and San Francisco from 9am until 8pm every day except Sunday, which is the day she takes to rest and spend free time with her family.

This is her first loan with MFP. Elena commits to submitting her payments on time. She is grateful to her Communal Bank for the benefits it provides. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise so that she can fulfill her delivery commitments to her most demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to fulfill her outstanding orders

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek Y., 60, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Yet is a housewife and her son is motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to open a tailor shop for one of her children. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina J. is 39 years old and resides in Binangonan, which is located in the Province of Rizal. She lives with her husband, who works as a laborer, and their five dependent children. Felomina has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. Felomina’s business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward against poverty. Felomina dreams of the best for her family: to have expanded business and to have a happy family.  She has shown herself to be hard working and strong-minded to make her dreams come true. She hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve the overall quality of life for her entire family.

loans.use: To buy more food products and basic necessities for her store.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Inés vive en la ciudad que nació, junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos.  (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 20 años,  Inés vivía en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedicaban a la venta de pan. Mientras Ines vendía en la calle sus hijos vendían en los días de visita en el penal de “Quenqoro”. Inés y sus hijos también vendían empanadas pero no resulto el negocio porque no conseguían obtener el mismo sabor del pan de la zona entonces tuvieron que regresar a Ocongate. 
   
Inés tiene 61 años y se dedica a la venta de comida en la plaza de armas de Ocongate de forma ambulatoria. La pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta todos los días excepto el día sábado. Inés los días sábados lleva comida a un colegio no escolarizado pues tiene contrata con los dirigentes para vender comida en el colegio. Inés en sus horas libres se dedica a la  artesanía como por ejemplo confecciona chompas de lana de alpaca y otras cosas más.  

Con el próximo préstamo que Inés recibirá, ella desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Inés was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. She’s a member of Asociación Arariwa Cusco’s “Las Margaritas Ocongate” communal bank. She currently lives in the city of her birth with her husband and five children. (Ocongate is located two hours from Cusco). Twenty years ago she lived in Cusco with her children. She and the children sold bread. While Inés sold in the streets, the children sold during visiting days at “Quenqoro” prison. Inés and her children also sold turnovers but the business didn’t succeed because they just couldn’t get the bread to taste the same in the area so they moved back to Ocongate. Inés is 61 years old and she sells prepared food in an itinerant manner in Ocongate’s main plaza. She can be found tending her food stand every day except Saturday. On Saturdays Inés takes food to an unaffiliated school because she has an agreement with the directors to sell food at the school. In her free time Inés is a craftsperson. She makes Alpaca wool jackets and other items. Inés will use the next loan she’ll get to buy ingredients like: rice, sugar, pasta and other items. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given through this means and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like: rice, sugar, pasta and others.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn P. is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 41 years old. Carolyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carolyn runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carolyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,100 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Carolyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Carolyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Carolyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who both currently attend school. She has been running a business selling matooke (green plaintain) for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase matooke.  With the help of the loan, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food. In the future, Alice hopes to own a house.        

Alice is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning more about financial literacy.

loans.use: to but more matooke

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of slippers

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann Y., 55, grows and sells mango trees in Kandal province. She is married with two children, one of whom is a student and the other of whom is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. She typically makes about $5 USD each day, and would like a loan to create another business for her daughter who works at a garment factory. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to open a hairdressing shop for her daughter. This business will bring her family more profit.

loans.use: To open a hairdressing shop

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people make up this village bank loan; Mr. Eng V. is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of this village loan, located in Anlong Slat village, Kandal province. All the member of this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.
 
V. earns his living by fishing near the local village. For this business, he owns a fishing boat, but he does not have fishnets. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets and fishing gear to support his business. His wife, Mrs. Hort ChanT., is 30 years old and works as a lottery seller for a commission in the local village. With both these occupations, they are able to earn a small profit to support their famiL.. This couple has one child who is two years old.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and fishing gear

loans.name: Mehnaz's Group

texts.en: Mehnaz is from the city of Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its culture and history. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her household. She is not able to support her husband financially by working but always trys to help him improve his business any way she can. That’s why she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s spare parts business, which supports the family. With the loan, he will buy spare parts in larger quantities to meet the urgent orders of his customers. Mehnaz hopes that by investing the loan money into her husband’s business, he will make more income and improve his business conditions.

loans.use: To buy parts for a spare parts business

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Kang S. is a 64-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Kang S. is married to Kim Krich, age 66, who works with her in the farming business. This old couple is blessed with two children, one of whom is single, still living under their roof. The other one is married, and works as a construction worker. Besides this farming business, Kang S.’s husband is a bicycle repairer for all passers-by in the village. He can earn a profit from this business - on average $5 per day - in order to share responsibility for other expenses for the family’s needs. So Kang S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase some equipment for repairing bicycle, which will allow her husband’s business to grow well. Kang S. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for repairing bicycle.

loans.name: Norwin Antonio

texts.es:
Norwin de 36 años de edad es soltero, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad, labora como fontanero en ENACAL Santo Tomas desde hace 2 años, ademas hace trabajos extras de fontaneria a personas que le buscan despues de su jornada laboral.

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pues con las lluvias y los vientos se le ha dañado el techo de su cuarto y quiere cambiarlo, ya que desea evitar cualquier enfermedad a su pequeño hijo. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia las condiciones basicas del hogar y que su hijo crezca y sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Norwin is 36 years old, single, and has a 5 year old child.  He has worked as a plumber in ENACAL Santo Tomas for two years.  He also does extra plumbing work for people who find him after his work-day.  

He is asking for his first loan to improve his home.  Rain and wind have damaged the roof of his room and he would like to change it since he doesn't want his young child to get sick. 

His dream is to provide his family with good living conditions and that his son grows up to be a good person.

loans.use: Change the roof on his home

loans.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Mara Cecilia R. A. es una laboriosa mujer que vive en el barrio el Bosque de la turística ciudad de Cartagena. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 12 años. Se dedica a producir y vender  almuerzos a empleados y obreros de algunas construcciones. Antes de ésta actividad, ella se dedicaba a lavar y planchar ropa a domicilio, pero en una ocasión, uno de sus clientes le propuso que preparara varios almuerzos para algunos obreros extras que habían contratado en una empresa, y ella aceptó. Le fue tan bien, que se ganó en un día lo que devengaba en tres días de lavado y planchado. Actualmente ella genera el 70% de los ingresos de su hogar.El negocio funciona en su casa, esto le permite estar cerca de su familia todo el día, pero planea el próximo año alquilar un local para independizar la microempresa y trabajar con más comodidad. Hoy en día vende un promedio de 30 almuerzos a un precio de $ 4.000 COP cada uno. El margen promedio de ganancia es del 40%. Para lograr los despachos oportunamente debió contratar los servicios de su hermana que le ayuda en picar verduras y relajar las carnes. Este es el primer crédito que la señora Mara tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se propone invertirlo en su totalidad en la compra de víveres al por mayor para obtener descuentos por volumen de compra y pago en efectivo. La señora Mara dice que el éxito de su negocio está en la calidad de sus comidas, porque las prepara con muchas verduras frescas que le dan un toque original y nunca le hacen daño a nadie. El plato que más le encargan es arroz de coco con pescado frito, patacón y ensalada de aguacate. Esa es la comida insignia de la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena.
texts.en:
Mara Cecilia R. A. is a hard-working woman who lives in El Bosque neighborhood, in the tourist city of Cartagena.  She lives with her husband and two children aged 16 and 12.  Mara makes and sells lunches to employees and workmen on construction sites.  Before she started this business, she used to wash and iron people's clothes in their homes but one of her customers once suggested that she make some lunches for some extra workmen who had been hired in a nearby company and she accepted.  Mara's business did so well that she managed to make in just one day what she normally made in three days of washing and ironing.

Mara currently makes 70% of her household's income.  Her business is located in her home which allows her to be near her family all day.  However, next year she plans to rent premises so that she can make her small business more independent and work more comfortably.  Mara sells an average of 30 lunches at 4,000 Colombian pesos each.  Her average profit margin is 40%.  In order to make her deliveries on time she had to hire her sister to help her chop vegetables and cure the meat. 

This is the first loan that Mara has taken from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will invest all of it in buying foodstuffs wholesale so that she can obtain discounts by buying in bulk and paying cash.  Mara says that the success of her business lies in the quality of her meals because she prepares them with a lot of fresh vegetables which gives them an original touch.  They never harm anyone.  Her most requested dish is coconut rice with fried fish, fried plantain slices and avocado salad.  This is the flagship dish of the beautiful city of Cartagena.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs wholesale

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad M. owns a poultry and goat farm. He sells chicken for butcheries and produces milk for sale. Muhammad took out a loan from FATEN to purchase chicken feed and more chickens to raise as he doesn't have enough liquidity to cover all the farm expenses at the moment.

Muhammad is the father of three daughters and four sons. Some of the sons are old enough to help him on the farm while the rest are still students.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Ana María C. D. R. es D. estado civil casada, su esposo es jubilado y tiene dos hijos; el menor D. ellos en edad escolar. 
Cuenta con casa propia en la que funciona también su negocio.
Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, verduras y perfumería entre otros.
Tiene experiencia crediticia y requiere del préstamo para así poder invertir en su negocio y para gastos personales. Además tiene capacidad D. pago.
Maneja buenas referencias por parte D. los vecinos indicando que es una persona muy trabajadora y con deseos D. superación para brindar una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana María C. D. R. is married, her husband is retired and they have two children, the youngest of which still goes to school.
She lives in a house she owns and where she has established her shop as well.
She sells groceries, vegetables and perfumery products among other items.
She already has experienced with loans, and the one she is requesting will be used to invest in her activity and to pay for personal expenses. She is also able to comply with the repayments.
She can count on good references on the part of her neighbors, who say she is a very hard-working person who desires to improve her life and to offer better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Dame Enyonam  est  âgée de 51 ans et mariée. Pour arriver à participer  au foyer,  elle fait le commerce  de charbons de bois.  Elle s’approvisionne  au Nord du Togo à Bassar et revend à la devanture de sa  maison. Elle a commencé son activité en 2007 et réside quartier hedzranawoe.  Elle demande  un prêt  pour  acheter  25 nouveaux sacs  de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Enyonam H. is 51 years old and married. She sells charcoal to help with the household expenses.  She gets her supplies in Bassar, in northern Togo, and sells them in front of her house. She started her business in 2007 and lives in the Hédzranawoé district. She is requesting a loan to buy 25 new bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food  for resale

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Don Francisco de 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos dos de ellos cursan la educaciòn secundaria y el mayor fue vecado por ser exelente alumno y estudiarà en la universidad de Leòn, el Sr. Francisco es una exelente persona, educado, trabajador y con un alto espiritu de superacion, lo que tiene le ha costado esfuerzo propio; trabaja para Lacteos  Nueva Guinea donde se desempeña en el area de mantenimiento.  

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva para un crèdito que invertirá en construcciòn de un cuarto para su hija con lo que le dará mayor privacidad y comodidad.  
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en:
Don Francisco is 38 years and has three children. Two of them are in high school and the oldest is studying at the University of León and was recognized as an outstanding student. Sr. Francisco is an excellent, polite, and hardworking individual who has a tremendous desire to succeed through his own efforts. He works for New Guinea Dairy in the maintenance department.
