Como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio Taller D. Costura, ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les atienD.  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza.
 
 Con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles, compró retazos, telas en metros, hilos D. diferentes colores, en la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the "Honestidad y trabajo" ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín, Peru. She is married, 47 years old and has four children, two of whom are still in school and dependent on her. Bertha has been making clothes for 13 years and little by little has generated income and saved her money. Previously she had maD. a living selling groceries. Since she had the talent for sewing, she didn't hesitate to start doing it for a living, and with the help of Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos she decided to start her own sewing shop out of her home. She tells us that the business is going very well, and she works on orders that her clients request in advance. She tends to her customers with the friendliness and charisma that she is known for. With her initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased meters of fabric, threads of different colors, and other odds and ends, and has continued with the business ever since. With the current loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase meters of fabric of different styles and colors, scissors, big spools of threads of various colors, sewing needles, pins and buttons. Today she feels like a very accomplished woman with a strong desire to keep moving forward and realizing her dreams. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meters of fabric of different styles and colors, scissors, big spools of threads of various colors, sewing needles, pins and buttons

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en: Olaide loves her business of selling foodstuffs. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to grow her business. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is married with 2 children. Her children attend school and they are making progress. Her husband sells stationery to help support the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 27 years old and single without children. She is a hard working girl and she is determined to excel in her business. She is a hair stylist and she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a hair dryer to boost her business. She hopes to expand in her business and make more profits. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer to boost her business

loans.name: Lweza South Nakifubi Devine Group

texts.en: N. Devine is a 45-year-old businesswoman. She is married with six children of whom more than one is going to school so she has three dependants. She owns a retail shop which she has been operating for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, etc. for sale. Her future hope is to obtain a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, etc. for sale

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
KARIN MILAGROS, TIENE 27 AÑOS, , ES CASADA TIENE UN PEQUEÑO HIJO. DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "SAN FRANCISCO", FORMADO POR SEIS PERSONAS MÁS, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE TRES AÑOS, INICIÓ EL NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. DESAYUNOS, EMPEZÓ CON MUY POCO D. FORMA AMBULATORIA, VENDIENDO SOLO CAFÉ Y MATES, LUEGO FUÉ COMPLEMENTANDO CON SANGUCHES. AHORA OFRECE TAMBIÉN ALGUNOS PLATOS D. COMIDA Y HA PODIDO CONSERVAR LA VENTA D. 40 DESAYUNOS AL DÍA.
CON SU NEGOCIO HA PODIDO IMPLEMENTAR UN ESPACIO EN LA CASA D. SU MAMÁ PARA TENER UN LUGAR FIJO D. VENTA.
SU PROXIMA META ES IMPLEMENTAR UN LOCUTORIO, POR AHORA CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO EMPEZARÁ COMPRANDO SALDO PARA LLAMADAS Y DARÁ EL SERVICIO AMBULATORIAMENTE.
texts.en:
Karin Milagros, 27, is married and has a son. She’s been a member of the “San Francisco” group, which has six additional members, for 3 years; she was elected group president. She started selling prepared breakfasts thirteen years ago; she started out with very little peddling her meals in the streets; her only menu items were coffee and teas. Later on, she added sandwiched and now prepares complete dishes and manages to keep a daily 40-meal production. Her business has maD. it possible for her to establish a fixed location in her mother’s house for her sales. Her next goal is to set up a portable phone booth; she will use the funding to buy phone credits and will proviD. the service moving place to place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in a portable phone booth.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is from the village of Membuli, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Marites is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a variety retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which, will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nazir Ahmad

texts.en:
Nazir Ahmad, son of A. K., lives in Bagrami, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young man aged 24 and still single. He has a carpentry shop where he is busy seven days a week from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Nazir Ahmad likes to support his family members and to also save for his future. He needs the loan to purchase good quality wood and to design more wonderful furniture according to his clients' requests. He expects to make his repayments on time and to join for another loan cycle very soon to progress more.

loans.use: To purchase good quality wood and to design more wonderful furniture

loans.name: Thac Qua Group

texts.en:
Nhuan T. N., a 60-year-old mother of three grown children, is a farmer and has also sold rice in the market for many years, earning a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong. The leader of a 5-member loan group from SEDA, Nhuan has participated in SEDA since 2006 and always repaid her loans punctually, her last one in the amount of 5,014,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND for her business.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Dai T. N., 57, wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND for her business. Thuong T. N., 32, would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to purchase additional wood supplies in order to manufacture his furniture products. Nhoi T. H., 47, wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to breed pigs. Ngao T. N., 43, wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in livestock.

loans.use: For her small business

loans.name: Haor's Group

texts.en: Five people living in Ampil Tuek village in Kandal province make up a group loan. Mrs. Haor S. is the group leader selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Haor S. was born in 1956. She is the mother of four children who all are married and she is a widow with an eight member household. She owns a general store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Mrs. Haor S. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro G. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo construir la barda alrededor de la casa. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto al frente de la vivienda. 
Desea que sus hijos tengan un logar especial en la casa para realizar sus trabajos de la escuela. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica como mecánico. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Maria Del Socorro Vazquez esposa del señor Genaro G. ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Genaro G. is grateful for your help with the previous loan which enabled him to build the wall around his house. He is requesting another loan to be able to start building a room at the front of the house. He would like his children to have their own space in the house to do their schoolwork. He intends to pay the loan back with the income he earns from his job as a mechanic in a factory. The person shown in the photo is Maria Del Socorro Vazquez, who is Genaro G.’s wife, because he was at work when we visited his home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: One-room extension on the ground floor of the house

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer C. is from the village of Brgy.Bonfal East,Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. He is 30 years old. Elmer is single. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport business. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elmer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elmer from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Yut

texts.en: Yut S., 49 years old, owns a small shop located inside a secondary school where she sells various cakes to the student. She typically makes around US$ 2 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Another source of family income comes from her husband’s job, who is a professional teacher. Yut S. has a piece of farmland, on which she hopes to plant a rice crop to provide food for the family and to sell. Because she doesn’t have capital, Yut S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed for farming.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita S. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Rosita is married and has an adult child. To make a living, Rosita provides an entertainment service with video games like Rambo, Pacman, Roadrunner and more. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga A. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 50 years old. Dominga is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Dominga owns & operates a business raising pigs to fatten and sell. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP whenever she sells a pig.

Dominga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Dominga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth and quilt making supplies

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.es: Aida Patricia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que se siente muy agradecida por los financiamientos.  Ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, su actividad económica es la venta de leña, se dedica hace más de 7 años a este negocio, por lo que siempre está pensando en proporcionarles a sus hijos lo más necesario. Por lo que es muy reconocida por sus vecinos, amigos y familiares que llegan a comprar. Este crédito es para la compra de leña. Ella sueña con mantener activo su negocio, ya que es su medio de vida.
texts.en: Aida Patricia has worked with Fundación for a long time and is very grateful for the loans she has received. She has two young children to take care of. She has been in the business of selling firewood for over 7 years and is always focusing on providing her children with everything they need. Her neighbours, friends and relatives all know she is trustworthy and buy from her. This loan is to buy firewood. She wants to keep her business moving, as it is how she earns her living.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is from the village of Purok 4 Canubay, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. She is 35 years old. Arlyn is married and has one child. To make a living, Arlyn is involved in a retail business (sari-sari store business) in her local communtiy. Arlyn has about 12 years of experience in this business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In June 5, 2000 Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She previously repaid a loan in the amount of 7,000PHP, and is requesting a new loan of 14,900PHP, which will be used for additional inventory capital for her business. She will the profit to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her coconut business.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Namhia

texts.en:
Namhia T. is a 48-year-old single mother with four children. She lives with her children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent for the past 17 years. Her younger daughter, age 22, attends university and her youngest daughter, age 13, attends a local middle school. 

Namhia operates a food retail business in her town. She began the business in 2009 selling her sibling's products and has since expanded her business by gaining her own working capital. After years of operation, she has built a stable business and has gained a positive reputation among her customers. Her earnings have enabled her to support her family. For the future, she hopes to continue growing her grocery trading business.  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT  loan to purchase a large amount of food, goodies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru: Косимов Убайдулло проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке города. Имеет торговую точку, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Убайдулло хочет улучшить финансовое положение в семье. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: K. Ubaydullo lives in the city of Kulob. He's thirty-five years old, married, has three children and a high school level of education. He's worked as a salesman for fifteen years. Currently, he owns a small shop in the city's central market, where he sells foodstuffs. Ubaydullo wants to improve his families' financial standing and, so, is asking for a loan in order to increase his goods turnover.

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim (Photo: far right) is a widow who started a cloth selling business to bear the financial burden of her family after the death of her husband.  She has been in business for 12 years.  

She is a mother of two sons who are married who sell clothes. They have a shop in the market and they earn a good income.
 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business.  With the loan, she will buy winter season clothes in bulk and increase her sales and household income.
 
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Noé Eduardo

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a Noé, tiene 42  años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres en la cual además de el también vive una hermana con sus cuatro hijos. Su papa se dedica a la carpintería.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la casa de su papa, dice que es pequeña pero que tiene de todo desde arroz, azúcar, hasta carne, pescado y también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00. Nos cuenta que tiene su tienda ya por 1 año y que a pesar de que al principio no tenía muchos clientes después le fue muy bien y ahora ya tiene muchos clientes que hasta se reúnen en  las noches en su local.
 
Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución para obtener los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The members of the La Unión Hace La Fuerza (Strength from Unity) communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the locals make that are famous throughout the country.

We find Noé here.  He is 42 years old, single and lives in his parents’ house where a sister and her four children also live.  His father is a carpenter.

He has a small grocery store installed in his father’s house.   He says it’s small but stocked with everything from rice and sugar to meat and fish.  He also sells certain remedies and kitchen supplies.  He works every day from 6am until 8pm.  He tells us that he’s had the store for a year now and that even though at the beginning he had few customers he later did well and now has lots of customers that even get together at night in his store.

This loan is to stock the store: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  This is his second loan in the communal bank which he likes because of the ease with which the institution grants loans.  His dream is to have a larger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Galo Evaristo

texts.es:
Galo Evaristo A. G. tiene 42 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con el papá  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Galo Evaristo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y G..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte y la música.
texts.en:
Galo Evaristo A. G. is 42 years old.  He is single and lives with his dad in Moncache canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the '27 de Octubre' community bank are located in Santa Sofia.  All the members work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Galo Evaristo is a farmer.  He grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in Briones shopping area and makes his sales in Vaca and Garcia shopping area.  He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.

The support of this loan will help Galo Evaristo to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house and plot of land.  He likes taking part in sport and music.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio M.'s main source of income comes from manufacturing and selling lampakanay products [cattail fiber, used for bags, baskets, ropes and furniture] to local businesses and community members. He is 47 years old, married and has ten school-aged children. They are from the village of Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Sergio is just starting this business. In 2011, Sergio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Sergio is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use additional income to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, oil and drinks.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, es separada y  vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desD. entonces sigue cultivando sus terrenos que ha heredado D. sus padres, lo que principalmente siembra es la papa y el maíz así como también algunas hortalizas como la cebolla, lechuga y zanahorias que después D. su cosecha lo lleva a vender a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. su zona. Sus 3 hijos la apoyan  en todo este proceso D. cultivo que requiere  fertilizar y cuidar las plantas y así se ahorra  en la mano D. obra y tener un poco más D. ganancias. La siembra en años anteriores  no le fue muy bien debido a los cambios climáticos pero a pesar D. esta dificultad  siempre tiene disponible  el alimento necesario para su familia además parte D. lo cosechado, aprovecha para preparar comidas que venD.  todas las tardes  cerca D. su casa. En adelante va a incrementar las semillas que va a sembrar. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar sacos D. abono para su campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, separated, and lives in her own home with her three children. She has been farming since she was a young girl and continues to cultivate the land she inherited from her parents. Rosa grows mainly potatoes and corn, but she also has other crops such as onions, lettuce, and carrots. After harvesting her crops, she sells them to merchants at the different markets in the area. Her three children help with the entire farming process, including fertilizing and caring for the plants. This saves her the cost of labor so that she can keep a little more of her earnings. Her harvests in previous years have not been good due to changes in weather. Despite these difficulties, Rosa has always been able to proviD. the necessary food for her family by setting asiD. part of her harvest. She also prepares food to sell every afternoon near her home. Going forward, Rosa wants to acquire more seeds so that she can begin planting.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Rosa is very happy to know that she has financial support, so she always demonstrates responsibility with her payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. She also thanks everyone who approved her loan request because the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in sacks of compost for the planting season.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: El Control (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Control esta formado por 9 mujeres que son muy unidas, responsables y trabajan en diferentes actividades que les ha permitido  mejorar su situación económica. Viven por la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, es muy visitada por propios y extraños, su gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señora. Laura Azucena Gómez vive por el sector de Punta Corral, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por una vecina. Tiene 34 años, es casada y  tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad quienes estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su papá con quien comparte los gastos.
Doña Laura se dedica a la  cría de patos, también lava ropa en diferentes casas varios días a la semana.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un derecho de agua potable para su hogar. Su meta es que su esposo tenga su mecánica propia en donde pueda trabajar.

La Señora Transito de los Angeles Gómez vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que pertenece a la parroquia de Turi, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia y trabaja, su ultima hija estudia en una academia de belleza. Su esposo labora en la construcción y es maestro de albañilería, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia. 
Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la cría de pollos y cerdos, actividad que la realiza en su casa.
Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la comprar de un derecho de agua potable que le hace falta en su hogar. Su meta es tener algún negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Control is made up of 9 united and responsible women who work in different activities which have allowed them to improve their economic situation. They live in the Turi parish, which is characterized by being the viewpoint over the city of Cuenca and is well-visited by both locals and foreigners. The people of this parish work in commerce, agriculture, and animal husbandry.

Mrs. Laura Azucena Gómez lives in the Punta Corral sector and this is her first loan in the communal bank after being invited by a neighbour. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 9 and 6 years who study at the city's primary school. He husband is an industrial mechanic. They don't have their own house which is why they live in her father's house and share the expenses with him. Laura raises ducks and washes clothes in various houses on different days of the week. She is going to use the money from her loan to buy the right to potable water for her home. Her goal is for her husband to have his own workshop to work in.

Mrs. Transito de los Angeles Gómez lives in the community of Punta Corral belonging to the Turi parish. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children aged 20, 18, and 15. Her oldest son is married and lives independantly, her second oldest son studies and works, and her youngest daughter studies at beauty school. Her husband works in construction and is a master bricklayer. With both of their work they have managed to build their own house. This member does the household chores and raises chickens and pigs, an activity which she carries out at home. This is the first loan she has requested in her communal bank and she is going to invest it in the purchase of rights to potable water, which is lacking in her home. Her goal is to have a home-based business.

loans.use: To buy the rights to drinking water

loans.name: Sofia Karem

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Sofia;  La socia tiene 26 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene 1 hijo de 3 años; la socia tiene un restaurante en el cual ella misma elabora diferentes platos, la socia cocina, la socia suele comprar insumos al por mayor, ella compra fideos, azúcar, arroz, aceite todos los productos al por mayor para que le pueda salir a costo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO” [The Friendship of Ollantaytambo] community bank. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, province of Urubamba, departament of Cuzco.

The member is named Sofia. She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage and she has one 3 year old son. The member has a restaurant where she makes different dishes. She usually buys her ingredients wholesale. She buys noodles, sugar, rice, oil- all products wholesale so she can get them at cost. Sofia is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients wholesale.     

Sofia is satisfied with the loan and committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 33-year-old single mother of two children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in textiles and tailoring for seven years. She started with a capital of 600,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings. 

Her hardship is bad debtors. 

Her vision is to diversify and start selling shoes. Annet intends to use the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy  clothes to resell

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim L., age 43, is a resident of the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city, where she earns a living by cultivating rice and vegetable crops on land she owns. Her husband provides irrigation services from the water system to local farmers who wish to pump water into their farm fields. The couple has three school-aged children, one of whom is married. Two are employed in a local factory. 

Chim L. will use this loan to purchase a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. Thus, this loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of her neighbor’s farmland that she will rent out to farmers for a fee

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis de 29 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad por medio de un amigo en la venta de gafas y lentes desde ese entonces sigue con su negocio de ventas.

El compra su mercadería cada 2 semanas y trabaja diariamente de 8H00 am  a 8H00 pm. su esposa también se encarga del negocio haciendo las compras. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias. El anhela comprarse un carro y que sus hijos sigan estuduando y que sean jovenes del bien.
texts.en:
Luis, 29, is a hard working man who started his activity through a friend who was in the glasses and sunglasses sales business.  Since then he’s continued with his sales business.

He buys his merchandise every two weeks and works from 8am until 8pm.  His wife also takes care of the business making the purchases.  With help from the loan he wants to buy more merchandise for his business and increase profits.  He hopes to buy a car and that his children stay in school and that they be upstanding young people.

loans.use: to buy glasses and sunglasses.

loans.name: Divaajur

texts.en: Mr. Divaajur is 42 years old and single. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the Capital city of Mongolia with his younger sister's family. In 2002, he moved to the capital city from Zavkhan province, which is situated in the far west of the country. He was in search of a better life. In 2002, he bought a minivan and started running a transportation business. He carries people in the suburbs of the city where buses are insufficient. A few years ago, he divorced his wife and currently supports his two kids by sending some money to them every month. The transportation licensing authority sets strict health and safety requirements on vehicles carrying people. Therefore, Mr. Divaajur services and repairs his minivan on a quarterly basis. This time, the loan he is requesting will be used to buy some spare parts and to service his minivan.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts and service his minivan

loans.name: Mireya Del Socorro

texts.es: Mireya Del Socorro de 40 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Su negocio consiste elaboración y venta de nacatamales y repostería recuerda que inició desde pequeña por sus padres, pero al poco tiempo notó que este negocio tenía mucha demanda, desde luego que siguió con esta actividad. Actualmente  su negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos económicos, además tiene más de 22 años con este negocio ya que siempre esta brindado un buen servicio y esto les gusta a sus clientes. Con el crédito que solicita comprara cerdos y hojas, masa, tomate, cebolla, bolsas y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Mireya Del Socorro, 40, is a single mother of two children who work independently.  Her business consists in the manufacturing of Nacatamales (Nicaraguan style tamales) and pastry.  She remembers that she started out while still little with her parents but gradually noted that this business was in high demand so she continued with it.  

Currently, the business is her main source of income.  She’s had the business for 22 years because she’s always provided good service and her customers like this.  She will use the requested loan to buy pigs, banana leaves, “masa” (dough) or tamales, tomatoes, onions, bags and other things.

loans.use: to buy pigs, banana leaves, masa for tamales, tomatoes, onions, bags and other things.

loans.name: Indiana

texts.en:
Indiana comes from the village of Partskhanakanebi, in the Imereti Region. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband Zaza and her parents.

Indiana and Zaza lead the farming activities of the family. They have a greenhouse with a total area of 180 square meters. In the period from November to April they grow greens in the greenhouse. In the summer months the greenhouse is used for tomato growing. Greens are sold to the wholesalers and the tomatoes are sold in the open market of Kutaisi (a nearby town). 

Along with the greenhouse the family owns 1000 square meters of land, where they grow vegetables such as eggplant, peppers, and greens. Their harvested vegetables are sold in the Kutaisi market.

Also the family has a pig, the piglets of which are sold in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is approximately 800 Laris. 

Indiana requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. After fertilizing the family will get more and better quality vegetables and greens, and consequently more income. In the future Indiana plans to reinvest the profit in the business. Part of the profit will be used for improvement of family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a caring lady, staying at home and carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband operates a dry cleaner shop. In his shop, he provides cleaning and clothes pressing services to his customers at reasonable rates. He is very good at his services and deals with his customers very well. 

Lubna is a mother of three sons. All of them are very young and have not started their education yet. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy an iron, hangers and plastic covers (for packing clothes) with the loan money. This will help him provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. 

Lubna is a new loan user and this is her 1st loan application to Asasah. She is hopeful that the loan investment will enable her husband to improve the financial condition of his business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Lubna.

loans.use: To buy an iron, hangers and plastic covers.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Dario; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de albañil y también es electricista, el trabaja en construcción construyendo diferentes casas, el socio quiere ampliar el trabajo de albañil y seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar maquinaria y herramientas para su trabajo.
                                                 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Darío, 28, is a member of the “El Diamante de Urubamba” (Urubamba’s Diamond) communal bank located in Urubamba District, Cusco Province and Department.

He has a spouse.  He alternates his daily chores working as a bricklayer; he’s also an electrician.  He works in construction building houses.  He wants to expand his bricklaying work and continue improving his work.   He is asking for a loan to buy machinery and tools for work.

He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy machinery and tools for work.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is blessed with four healthy, school-aged children. For the past two years, Chona has been running a business where she sells beauty and personal products in her local community. Her work helps provide for her family’s daily needs. Chona earns 8,000 PHP a month.

Chona is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more beauty and personal products to sell, such as shampoo, lotion, makeup, and deodorant. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year, and helps her clients care for themselves. Chona is looking forward to expanding her business and creating a display space at her home.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty and personal products to sell

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en: Chuc was born in 1960. She lives in Phan Xa village. She has two children. One of her children is a worker and one is a student. Her husband is a guard. He has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Not only does she breed pigs, but Ms Chuc also sells clothes in the market. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. Since 2004, she has participated in SEDA and always repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy clothes to resell. Her profits will be used to purchase items for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Banco Comunal Victoria De David Group

texts.es: Este Banco se llama Victoria de David. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un préstamo. La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, tiene dos hijo de 11 y 7 años bajo su cargo. Inicio hace 3 años por cuenta propia, ya que necesitaba un medio de ingreso para brindarle apoyo a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como sabanas, pintura de labios, pinturas de uñas, polvos y cremas. Con las ganancias quiere poder crecer su negocio y completar una mini fabrica. Los otros integrantes del grupo tienen sus actividades económicas que por medio del financiamiento le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: This communcal bank is called Victoria de David.  The group is comprised of nine members and this is their second request for a loan.  Mrs. Juana sells general merchandise.  She has two children, ages 11 and 7 under her care.  Three years ago she started her own business because she needed to earn an income to help support the family.  She is requesting a loan to buy sheets, lipstick, nail polish, powders and creams.  With her earnings she wants to expand her business and build a mini-factory.  The other members of the group will use the loan to help boost their businesses.

loans.use: To buy sheets, lipstick, nail polish, powders and creams.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 43 year-old married lady who sells used clothes at the old market in Malindi. She  has been in this business for the past year, and she earns a monthly income of  KES 30,000, which she uses to help look after her family as well as to run her business. 

Patience has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD.  This is her second loan.  She intends to use the loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for her business with the aim of expanding it, due to the rise in her clientele in the region. 

She hopes to use some of her anticipated profit to continue running her business as well as to continue saving a portion of it so as she will able to run her own boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Pan Sellers Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in the village of Kafe, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 52 years old. Married to a businessman, Kadiatu has three children – two in secondary school and one in college.

For 30 years now, Kadiatu has been selling dishes, plastic bowls, knives, cups, spoons, etc. This is not the first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have benefited from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of previous SMT/Kiva lenders loan, they have been able to expand their respective businesses, make better profit, and provide support to their children. 

With this new loan, they are going to further expand their businesses. Kadiatu is going to use her share of the loan to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current items.

loans.use: to buy dishes, plastic bowls, knives, cups, spoons, etc. and items in bulk.

loans.name: Ma. Hazel

texts.en:
Maria Hazel is a 37-year-old married woman with 3 children ages 19, 14 and 5. She and her husband are both farmers. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. Ma. Hazel works hard to help her husband provide for their needs and send their children to school.

She applied for this loan so she could buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Ma. Hazel is hoping for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Joycy

texts.en:
Joycy is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has one child. 

Joycy has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from MSE and NATASHA. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy merchandise from MSE and NATASHA to resell.

Joycy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Joycy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from MSE and NATASHA to resell.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
FeryA. is a 30-year-old lady who has four children. Her husband works in a private company.

FeryA. is a housewife, who has found that she has a lot of free time during the day, so she decided with her husband to also support the family financially to have a medium-sized yard and buy a good number of goats, sheep, and chickens and start a trading business re-selling them to other farms, or butchers.

Being in the business for more than a year has given her the courage to expand and bring in more goats and chickens, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats and chickens to raise and resell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is a 36-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling engine oils and charging batteries for six years. He started with 300,000 shillings and now has 1,600,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. His personal goals are educating children and expanding the business into new markets and moving the business to a more permanent location. Abdul needs the loan to buy engine oils and poultry birds.

loans.use: to buy engine oils and poultry birds

loans.name: Rosa Catalina

texts.es:
Rosa, por necesidad en su negocio, se deciD. por un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra D. quintales D. maíz, ya que le gusta mantener disponible para poder aumentar la producción en cualquier momento, pues la demanda no es igual todos los días.
Ella ha tenido una evolución positiva, después D. comenzar a invertir los préstamos, el negocio ha mejorado mucho y sus ingresos tambien, teniendo ahora una condición mucho más estable.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to take out a new loan as her business needs it.  She will invest her loan in buying 100lb sacks of corn as she likes to have this available so that she can increase her production at any moment because her demand is not the same every day.

Rosa has progressed well.  Since starting to invest her loans, her business has improved a lot and her income has too.  She now has much more stable conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del banco comunal Bellavista, del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 45 años D. edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Los ocho años que vienen trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta D. churros (dulces con manjar blanco) en un colegio del centro D. la ciudad, su herramienta D. trabajo es una carretita donD. fríe los churros para luego envasarlo.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 paquete D. harina, 2 kilos D. mantequilla, 1 caja D. leche, ½ saco D. azúcar, una sombrilla granD. que la necesita para poder cubrirse del calor. 
Esta actividad la realiza muy lejos D. su casa, todo los días tiene que trasladarse al centro D. la ciudad, su carrito tiene que guardarlo cerca D. su trabajo y tiene que pagar guardianía.
Su esposo es motocarrista (transportista) y es el que la traslada todo los días, D. esa manera se ahorra en pasaje.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. poder seguir trabajando y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the “Bellavista” communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 45 years old, married and has three children.

During the eight years she’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans she’s been selling ‘churros’ (sweets maD. from ‘manjar blanco’ [a sweet, white spread or pastry filling maD. with milk]) in a school downtown.  Her work tool consists of a little cart where she fries the churros and then packages them.

She will use her 2500 new sol loan to buy: 1 package of flour, 2 kilos of butter, 1 box of milk, ½ sack of sugar and a large umbrella she needs to protect herself from the heat.

She does this activity quite far from home so she has to head downtown every day and has to store her cart near where she works and has to pay a fee to store it.

Her husband drives a motor cart and he gives her a riD. to work every day so she saves on transportation costs.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy an umbrella, flour, butter, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa de su padre, la cual está ubicada en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III Dist Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Olga vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Olga se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años en su domicilio. El ganado cuando alcanza tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con corrales apropiados para dicha crianza.

Olga desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, sobredoto en estas semanas que es cuando la demanda aumenta debido a la proximidad de las fiestas navideñas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has 1 child. She lives in her father's house which is located in the village of El Porvenir Hualtaco III, in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura region, located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the departamento of Lambayeque. Olga lives in the rural area of the district and has no basic services.

Olga has bred sheep for the last 4 years at home and has the appropriate breeding pens. When the livestock attains the ideal size and weight, she sells them at the local market. 

Olga wants to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced food to expand her business of breeding and selling livestock, especially during the coming weeks when demand is high due to the approaching Christmas festivities. This is why she has sen fit to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles (PEN)

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Haide has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Haide has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Vevincia

texts.en:
Vevincia, a 57-year-old married mother of four, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a rice retail business in the Philippines for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Having borrowed and repaid 28 previous loans from NWTF, Vevincia is now requesting a new one for PHP 29000 to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Serine

texts.en:
Serine lives with her husband and child. The family gets its main income from agriculture: land cultivating and cattle-breeding. Serine would like to increase the number of cattle, as well as cultivate the land. 

With the loan's help she plans to purchase a calf, forage, and flower seeds. Serine will develop agriculture and increase the family's income from meat, milk, and flowers sales. This will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, forage, and flower seeds.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre dedicado a impartir clases, ya que por vocación estudio la profesión de maestro de educación primaria del cual tiene 10 años de ejercer dicha actividad, tiene una relación estable donde ha procreado 3 hijos a los que le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo personal, este señor tiene la necesidad de  cambiar el techo y construir paredes, por el cual visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que lo utilizaría en la Zinc, Hierro, Ladrillo, Cemento, arena y Piedrín. Y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en:
Robert is a teacher. He studied to be a primary school teacher and he has 10 years experience in this field. He has a stable relationship that has produced three children who give him everything he needs for his development as a person. 

Robert needs to replace his roof and to build new walls. For this reason he visited CEPRODEL to ask for financing that he would use to buy corrugated roofing, reinforcing bar, brick, cement, sand and gravel. In this way, he will improve his conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as corrugated roofing, reinforcing bar, brick, cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Kadyamadare Group

texts.en:
Kadyamadare group found in February 2015 for the purpose of pooling resources to achieve bigger goals. The group is mainly into poultry production majoring in layers production and now they want to buy broilers to improve their cashflows.
Shakemore a member of the group who has been in the poultry business for the past 7 years is in the process of molding bricks for extending his living house and poultry house and would like use the money from this project to buy the cement for building. He also want to pay school fees for his two children who are in primary school.

loans.use: To buy 600 day old chicks, feeds and drugs to raise the birds

loans.name: Madat

texts.en:
51 year-old Madat is a refugee from war-affected territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli who is the only bread-winner for his family of 6.

“Sure, the initial stage of my refugee life was not sweet at all. I had two choices – either to live up and adapt to new circumstances or give up and lead my family to famine. So, my passion for sewing I’m involved in since 1982 helped me to go through all hardships and to support my family”-says Madat. His start in the clothing business began with applying in 2004 to Norwegian Microcredit, local microfinance organization, for aloan of 600 USD and sewing the first trousers for his client.

Now he plans to change his outdated ironer to a new one and diversify the variety of fabrics he uses. A new ironer will speed up and simplify his work. Thus he will be able to increase his incomes and afford delivering himself such little joys, maybe ordinary for others but not for him, as buying brand new TV set, video facilities and other household wares. He is confident in himself as well as his capacity to repay the loan and justify the trust of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new ironer and new fabrics

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two children. After finishing school he decided to become self-employed and started a small business selling men’s and women’s footwear in the local market. He has been in business since 1996. His wife Oksana is actively involved making it a family enterprise. Alexander is an entrepreneur of integrity. He has promptly repaid every loan he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2003. Financial assistance has promoted the stable growth and expansion of his trade. Currently, Alexander and his wife have two vending kiosks offering a variety of casual and performance footwear at compelling prices. Alexander is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase the assortment of inventory he has available. He is planning to purchase walking shoes, sneakers, flats, sandals and leather shoes for the spring season. Alexander is hoping to invest generated profits into the purchase of a vending facility that will help him better focus on his market niche. His caring customer service and dedication to his business will definitely help Alexander move forward with his goals and be successful.

Олександр – одружений, в нього двоє дітей. Після технікуму він вирішив відкрити власну справу та почав торгувати чоловічим та жіночим взуттям на одному з місцевих ринків. Він займається цим бізнесом вже з 1996 року. Його дружина Оксана активно допомагає з торгівлею і вважає цей бізнес сімейним. Олександр – дуже порядний та чесний підприємець. Він вчасно сплатив усі позики, які отримав від «Надії України» з 2003 року. Фінансова підтримка сприяла стабільному зростанню та розширенню його торгівлі. Зараз Олександр з дружиною є власниками двох торгових кіосків з продажу різноманітного повсякденного та спортивного взуття за помірними цінами. Олександр просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товару в своїх торгівельних точках. Він планує закупити кеди, кросівки, босоніжки, туфлі та шкіряне взуття напередодні весняного сезону. Олександр сподівається використати отриманий прибуток для того, щоб придбати ще одне торгівельне приміщення, що, в свою чергу, допоможе йому задовольнити попит споживачів у цьому сегменті ринку. Його привітна манера обслуговування та відданість власній справі обов’язково допоможуть Олександру досягти мети та бути успішним бізнесменом і надалі.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya has had her men’s clothing business at the market in Nikopol for nearly nine years. Her business has provided much-needed income for her and her husband, Igor, as they’ve raised their two children – a daughter, 24, and son, 21. Currently, Natalya offers a variety of men’s clothing from shirts and dress coats to sweaters and shoes. She is looking at the possibility of opening a second sales location and making some changes to her product selection to try and separate herself more from her competitors.

Natalya has benefited from the lending services provided by Nadiya Ukraine and has established a reputation for honesty as she worked with our organization. She has requested a loan to purchase some new clothing items to sell. This loan will provide further assistance to Natalya as she seeks to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs Ban L. is 39 and lives in Phnom Penh, in Cambodia. She takes care of her 5 children. Her husband is a securty guard.  He earns 3 dollars a day.
Mrs Ban L. would like to purchase  a motorbike for her husband who works far from their house. In the future, she would like to sell fruit. In the picture you can see Mrs Ban L. with three of her children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Serkardar

texts.en: H. Serkerdar  is 43 years old and married with three children. He is a farmer by trade, but is currently a refugee from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory in the Khojavand region of eastern Azerbaijan. Right now, he and his family live in Baku. He started his meat business in 1997, when he purchased one sheep with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but time-consuming and takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary he earns is not enough to cover all of his family's expenses. Serkerdar would therefore like to borrow $500 to buy 7 small sheep plus some food for them. He will repay the loan within 12 months and hopes that it will expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 7 sheep

loans.name: De Las Nieves

texts.es:
Senora De las Nievas A. de Caballero is married and has one son. He is in his third year studying science at the National University. Her husband also works and they live in a house they own.

Senora De las Nievas is the owner of a dispensary in her house. She began it as a small project, selling a few basic products. But with time, the business kept growing thanks to the increase in customers and the fact that she lives in a busy and highly populated zone.

De las Nievas is requesting this loan to buy various merchandise for her shop, such as tea, sugar, various drinks, bakery items, dairy products, household cleaning products and novelties.

One of her goals is to be able to grow her business to the next stage, acquire new equipment and furniture to open an eatery in the future. She would like to offer breakfasts and lunches to the people who work in the area.

La Sra. De las Nieves A. de Caballero, es casada y tienen un hij. Su hijo está estudiando en la Universidad Nacional, está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Ciencias Exacta; su marido trabaja es herreroy trabaja de forma indepndiente; la familia vive en casa propia. La señora es dueña de una despensa en su casa. Empezo como un proyecto pequeño, vendiendo algunos productos básicos; con el tiempo fue ampliandose gracias a la amplia clientela, pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. La señora De las Nieves solicita el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, azúcar, bebidas varios, panificados, productos lácteos, de limpieza para el hogar, bazar y artículos de mercería. Uno de sus apiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, adquirir nuevos equipamientos o mobiliarios para poder abrir un comedor en el futuro, ella desea ofrecer desayunos y almuerzos a las personas que trabajan en la zona.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TEA, SUGAR,  BAKERY GOODS AND DRINKS FOR HER SHOP.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz G. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 33 years old.  Eldaniz is engaged in cattle-breeding.  He has some cows and now wants to increase the number of his cows.  Eldaniz needs a loan in the amount of $500 for buying one cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Agnes N. is 43 years old. She is married with five children, who are between the ages of 12 and 26. She has two other dependents, who are her nephews. In 2003, Agnes established a shop selling general items. She now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock in bulk

loans.name: Mugunza A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hamida H.. She is currently in the business of retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock in shop. Hamida is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children ranging from age 6 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Hamida makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a new fridge for her shop. Hamida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her busienss by add in more stock in the shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Hamida is joined in her small group by Zubeda D. and Aisha N.. Zubeda D. has a business in selling used clothes and wants to add in clothe business. Aisha N. is currently operating a business in retail shop and wants a loan to add stock in the shop.

loans.use: To add in retail shop and increase stock

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang Y. is a widow with six children, three sons and three daughters. Five of her children have married; four of them live in separate houses and one lives with her. Savang and her family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Savang has been a silk weaver for over forty years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother and now she also teaches her daughter to weave silk.

She is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Shuweya

texts.en:
Shuweya is 26 years old and is a married woman. Shuweya is a tailor, and she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Shuweya has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy a sewing machine for her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr:
Born on 10 December 1980 in DANGBO in the department of OUEME, Mrs. Firmine S. is married to François AMIGO, a refrigeration technician in the city of COTONOU. She is the mother of 3 children : Alvine, aged 7, Francky, aged 4, and Anicet, aged 2. All of her children are in school and are in the care of their parents.

She is based in ADOGLETE, a suburb of COTONOU, where she runs a business selling various products such as canned food, eggs, liquor, rice, and other goods. An upstanding woman, Mrs. Firmine S. is on her fifth loan and has always repaid her debts without incident. Currently, she faces some difficulty in satisfying all her customers. For this reason, she is asking for this loan in order to supply herself so as to meet the demands of her clientele, as well as to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 10 décembre 1980 à DANGBO dans le département de l’OUEME, dame S. Firmine est mariée à AMIGO François, frigoriste dans la ville de COTONOU. Elle est mère de 3 enfants; Alvine 7 ans, Francky 4 ans et Anicet 2 ans. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et sont à la charge de leurs géniteurs.

Elle s’est installée à ADOGLETA, un bidonville de COTONOU où elle mène son activité de vente de divers produits tels que les boîtes de conserve, les œufs, les liqueurs, le riz et autres produits. De bonne moralité, dame S. Firmine est à son cinquième prêt et a toujours fait un bon remboursement. Actuellement, elle éprouve quelques difficultés à satisfaire tous ses clients. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce prêt pour pouvoir s’approvisionner afin de satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle et aussi pour diversifier son activité.

loans.use: To buy 20 trays of eggs, 10 bags of rice, 2 boxes of canned food, and 2 boxes of liquor

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura T. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and works on her local collective farm, as well as in a variety of other businesses.  She currently owns two cows and has over ten years of experience in raising livestock.  Because she wants to one day own a large flock, she plans on raising money by making milk products and selling them in the local market.  Therefore, she is applying for a loan of $1,200 for ten months, which will be used to purchase special equipment that will help her in milk production.

loans.use: To buy equipment for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small flower shop in her community.

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov P., 26, is a mother of two children who are too young to attend school. She and her husband are rice and livestock farmers. Collectively they earn approximately eight dollars per day. The couple would like to use a loan to increase the number of chickens they raise and purchase a motor-bike for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and a motor-bike for the buisness

loans.name: Raya's Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Raya is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 4 and 8. She has been a shoe and perfume seller since 2004. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Raya is now looking for a loan to buy more shoes and perfumes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Nuru, who has a business dealing with chips and snacks sales.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Lira

texts.es: Lira tiene 36 años, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su aspiración de seguir  luchando en su negocio. Su esposo Carlos, quien siempre la apoya en lo posible, está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, es una  madre que desde muy temprana edad ingresó en este negocio, es por eso que en la actualidad cuenta con una gran clientela, gracias a su buena atención.A parte de querer seguir surgiendo en su negocio, quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, sin embargo, no cuenta con lo suficiente para lograr lo que desea, es por eso que estima de un capital para poder cumplir con su objetivo. Ayuda a la señora Lira madre que demuestra su interés de seguir  adelante.
texts.en:
Lira is 36 years old and a mother of 3 children that are students and her inspiration for continuing to fight for her business. Her husband, Carlos, always supports her in what is possible and agrees with her objectives. She makes a living by selling natural products and has run her business since an early age. This has resulted in a large list of customers, thanks to her attentiveness. Besides wanting to continue developing her business, she would like to improve the infrastructure of her home. However, she does not say she has enough to attain what she desires, which is why she estimates that the capital will be able to fulfill her goal. Help Lira, a mother who shows her interest to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of natural products she sells and also fix some structures in her house.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Josefa L. desde 18 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de verduras las cuales las comercializa en su propio tramo donde es visitada por sus clientes para comprar las verduras.

Con gran esfuerzo se ha desarrollado en el negocio y ha logrado salir adelante manteniendo su familia compuesta por sus 5 hijos. Hoy en día como todo negocio en desarrollo ha logrado mejorarlo y es por este motivo que ha acudido a Ceprodel para continuar con el mejoramiento de dicho negocio. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa L. has been selling vegetables in the Israel Lewites market for 18 years. She markets the products in her stand, where her clients visit to buy vegetables.

With great effort, she has started her business and has succeeded in going forward, supporting her family, which is made up of her 5 children. Today, she has succeeded in improving her business and, as a result, she has come to Ceprodel to continue improving her business. Both she and the family that she loves will benefit greatly from this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Mrs. Bobby Potutan A., 42 years of age and a widow, lives in Looc Mansabay, Bajo, Lopez Jaena. With their simple abode near the seashore, she works hard to support her family with buying and selling fish and other seafood. Her son comes with her to help with bags and bundles of vegetables for added income.

A pail of fish in one hand and a pail of seafood in the other makes a daily earning of PHP 450. She sells around the little "barangay" of Tipan and even reaches to nearby town of Aloran. Close family ties are what motivates her to survive and be strong for her children as their father and mother in one.

She desires to send all her children to school with Paglaum MPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish and vegetables

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Don Juan es operario en una maquiladora, y su esposa pertenece al gremio de veladores, estos son sus únicos ingresos y a pesar de no tener más dependientes económicos sus egresos absorben una gran parte de sus salarios.
En este momento el suegro del Sr. M. requiere de unos estudios médicos inmediatos, pues la enfermedad que tiene (Diabetes) le exige el mayor cuidado.
Solicita de su apoyo para cubrir el costo que se genere, y sobre todo para el tratamiento que tenga que darle. El enfermo es de edad avanzada y no puede sufragarse por si solo; Manda un saludo cordial para todos ustedes que altruistamente lo socorrerán con esta gran necesidad.
texts.en:
Juan is an assembly plant operator, and his wife works in the business of selling bedside tables. These are their only sources of income and despite not having more economic dependents, their expenses take up a large part of their salaries. At the present time, Mr. M.'s father-in-law needs medical tests done right away because the illness that he has (diabetes) demands the greatest amount of care. Mr. M. is asking for your support to cover the cost of the tests, and, most importantly, for the treatment that his father-in-law will need. He is a sick, elderly man and cannot defray the costs by himself. He sends warm regards to all of you who will help him out of the goodness of your hearts during his time of great need.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for medical tests

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.en:
Erkinjon offers taxi services in Isfara, Tajikistan. He has been working in this sphere of business for 4 years. Erkinjon admits he has benefited a lot from the financial assistance he has received from IMON International, Tajikistan. Currently, his business has grown to the point where he takes in 15 – 20 $ per day.

Erkinjon is hoping to buy a better and trendier vehicle in the future to offer more high-class services to his clients. Now his car needs thorough repairs for which he is requesting a loan. Erkinjon thinks that this loan will help him move closer to the fulfillment of his plans, as due to repairing his car, he will increase his clientele. Some day when Erkinjon saves enough, he is hoping to buy a newer but affordable vehicle.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
